vWs8Vt1rPCW6NE1PQbzrog.text: As soon as you walk in, you smell the awesome food. Immediately greeted with a smile by everybody and service was great.  The menu can be a little confusing, as I have never heard of a lot of the ingredients on the menu. This was resolved when the waitress explained everything on the menu very well.  Hanger steak is very good and the hummus is also great.   Decor is very relaxing and good place for social gatherings.

5pm7wWWs9RK-HFwzuLwGsA.text: I work at SLS and I always hear great things about this place, so I took my sister to eat there. Right from the start they get you water and all the small things you need before you eat. We ordered the Roasted lamb and some other great dishes but the RL was the best very unique taste of the charts. This place is for people who are foodies and love to try small but tasteful dishes. I would go back any day

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuuupppp
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soooooo good

AZtpTEF4wnEz5mRx4ZL8FQ.text: It was my first time at Cleo and I was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere is very nice. I was alone on a business trip and decided to eat at the bar. Bartender Stephen asked me if it was my first time there and explained the food and the menu.  I was not real hungry so I just ordered the calms on noodles.  The broth was Saffron and lemon.  It was amazing. I had never tasted anything like it. The noodles were very good.  The clams were served in the shell and the portion was good.  Only complaint I had was that two of the clams were not cleaned well enough and had sand in them.  Ugh.  A bit off putting but it won't stop me from eating there again.  The food I saw coming out of the kitchen looked amazing. The people on the other side of the bar were commenting how much they were enjoying the food.  The service was great and they were very nice.  A pleasant experience.

X8B1Hnor9rBdgjOTAdPg6g.text: Food is awesome but like all tapas restaurants, cleo does not have the capacity for large parties. Never take the closed menu from here.

XKOroJRCPL4saFwo32jetg.text: OMG !! We are staying SLS and went for having dinner to Cleo. I have a 2 and half year old baby boy who has severe feeding disorders. We are struggling with it from his birth. Right now he is only eating fries. So we bought kids meal from McDonald's  next to SLS. My son didn't eat or drink anything for 20 hours and just started eating one piece of fries and we were looking out  the Cleo's menu. The waiter came to us and told us that they don't allow outside food !!!! That was new as we travelled a lot of places,eating a lots of restaurants  with my son and his food. So we asked the manager for a permission. He called the manager. Also the manager came and told the same thing to us even we explain him my sons condition. There is nothing written anyplace on that restaurant. They don't  have any  kids menu on their own. Though they give us a high chair, they don't allow him to eat !!!! No kids menu on their own!!! Really !!! What was that !!!'They said it's an law that you can't bring outside food even for babies !!!!! Really !!! My husband ask is it only for here? The manager said no it's all over. We are traveling a lot of restaurant around US and always take food we bought separately for my son.Nobody said that to us. I asked the manager what's the health reason? He replied we could get sick by outside food and say about this restaurant !!!  My husband offered the manager to sign a bond that we won't claim something like that. But well, They just make us leave the restaurant for McDonald's  Kidsmeal !!! We went to the next restaurant of SLS, north side cafe and ask them that do they have this kind of law. And they said Babies can eat anything that you brought, it doesn't matter you bought it or cook it by your own. So I really don't know that is there any law out there/exist there or I am a Asian was the reason. Or our very casual dress up was the reason. I feel so bad that I told it to SLS front desk. They said they apologize for that but they can't do anything for that because the restaurant run separately. So they offer us 50$ food and beverage voucher for an apology. Though I didn't take their voucher. We feel so horrible by Cleo's behavior that we could not even eat the food that we ordered from north side cafe. We explain Cleo my sons condition very well. I told earlier that my baby has feeding disorder and just started eating something after 20 hours  and that time Cleo make us leave the restaurant. So my son stop eating and don't eat or drink anything for that day. That's our and my sons experience with Cleo !!! Insult ! My tips for you, dress up very well to dine there other wise you will be insulted very well that you wont forget it for your whole lifetime.

kxR_fkuX0q0RK2uucG7wZQ.text: We loved everything about this place! The babaganoush was on point and the lebnah was to die for. We dragged our three young starving kids in here at 9pm after driving in from SoCal and everyone was super kind in the restaurant. Can't wait to try everything!

F6JR1yadzPNOpTw5dFExXg.text: Tonight my friends and I dined at Cleo's at SLS and all I can say is WOW! The food was amazing, our primary server, Kassey and his team member Herald gave us impeccable service and created such an intimate and memorable experience that it will surely be remembered! The Manager, who's name I have regrettably forgotten was so accommodating and went above and beyond to ensure we had a wonderful evening! Flawless! Kudos to this team!

_IzBMDtUygX68B8sI2BeqA.text: Had a very nice meal here with the family. Walked across the street from the Hilton.  We were concerned about bringing our 8 and 11 year old kids so called ahead but they were very welcoming with the kids (kids are very good eaters and like to try everything).  This was also on a weeknight.   Cocktails were excellent.  Highlights on the dishes were the brussels sprouts, merguez flatbread, garlic shrimp and cauliflower with vadouvan and cashews. Did not feel this place was just "good for Vegas" like most restaurants in LV, but actually would be worth visiting in an actual authentic city.  Probably worth 4.5 stars.

KCCQ4a65xOcr5RI7Rig41g.text: Super expensive, small portions, noisy, and a waste of time. How it's getting 4.5 on Yelp is totally  beyond me - are they paying for those reviews? Then again, there are people who think buffets are amazing, so...  The place feels like they just re-did a cafeteria, definitely not "A dramatic pitched roof, Moroccan tiles and chandeliers, white marble counters, and emerald-green curtains create a warm elegance." It's loud and whatever theme they're going for, they just succeeded in only confusing us. It's not warm, not elegant and with our table packed in among many others, we were the pinball in the machine. Bump-bump-bump. We liked our server, she was quite nice and helpful and really on the ball when a drink was mixed wrong and when we got the wrong order.  Food-wise, we liked the spicy cigars, and the kebabs were good, but all portions were one not-hungry person size. The spanakopita was so salty as to be inedible, the laffa came in a brown paper sack (so not classy) and the shwarma was little more than a mouthful. After that and two drinks for $150, it was a complete let down. We had a really good dessert at the cafe next door though.

dHxntDIEj3g5K0fpaLaB7A.text: I kinda wanted something different than greasy hangover food, luxury dining w a menu that needs a pronouncing guide or a tourist trap... Here lies Cleo. It was sooooo authentic. My boyfriend is Moroccan and this is the closest thing we have gotten to Arabic/Mediterranean food in a while. The hummus was incredible, the chicken kabob was tender and well seasoned and the lamb shwarma was delicious. The plates are very small so order about 3 each and it can all add up ... But the unique feel of the restaurant and yummy food make it a great place. The service was ok... They recommended 4 to 5 dishes... Which is way too many... And they were a bit slow... The drinks are creative but light on the alcohol... So don't expect to get too full or too tipsy at Cleo. All and all... Great food, cool atmosphere and ok service.

-TSYjQUj1J_MXGpdciS8Iw.text: Service was excellent - I loved the scallops and tuna tarte - my husband loved the lamb sliders. we will be back for sure

W0Jqltc8XiYiaE3puc41OQ.text: I give my review three stars due to the service during our Christmas dinner.  Yes, we were a party of 20+ people but only had one server attending to us.  She also had 3-4 additional tables.  Given the amount of people in our party, arranging a custom pre-fixe menu, and agreeing to a food & beverage minimum, one would think our party would get great service.  Unfortunately, that was not the case.   The food came out very fast, before our first drink orders.  By the time we got our first round of drinks, we were halfway done with the meal.  Even at that, they were watered down for Vegas standards.  I did not get the attention for things we needed, ie silverware, extra bread, etc. in a timely manner.  It is the little things sometimes.  The positive from this experience was that we had pre-arranged a custom pre-fixe menu.  The food was amazing, from picked vegetables to dessert.  It gives me hope that next time I visit Vegas, I will be able to give Cleo another shot but in a more intimate manner.

qmRmkaWScyRnhVAjfxpE7g.text: This is a wonderful restaurant and has a wide variety of tasty Mediterranean food.  Everything is tapas style, so you'll need to order 6-7 dishes to satisfy 3 diners.  Plates are expensive, even for Vegas, but the food is flavorful, cooked right, and brought to your table piping hot.  Service staff is friendly and attentive, even on a busy Saturday night.  Some of our favorites are: Lamb Shawarma (my wife loves this and normally doesn't eat lamb), garlic shrimp, chicken tagine, and their amazing Spanakopita.  Desserts are mouth watering, but the best is their bread pudding.  A great place for lunch or dinner.

THbPlLLj2EIr4H-aF7Yh1w.text: Food was good, but there are better executions of similar menu items at places like Echo & Rig.  Service was spotty.  Amazing waitress, but then when it got busy, she forgot about us as she had too many tables. So we waited over 30 minutes for a dessert we ordered before receiving our final round of sharing plates for our dinner! Manager came over to introduce himself and check in, but then when we needed him, even getting the check took way too long.  That said, Cleo's food was above average and prices were ok for the Strip.

7O1AQjETw0mpQkTgqq3jQg.text: I went there with friends on a business trip. They offer small plates meant for sharing. We had falafels, a couple of flatbread varieties, street tacos and the brussel sprouts. They were all excellent, especially the brussel sprouts. It was so good we tried to go back the next night, but they were closed for a private party. I'm sorry I didn't get to try some of the other woodfire veggie dishes.

WfQTXJvoDXIN2SmB5Egw1A.text: I absolutely love this place! First off the decor is beautiful. The service was on-point! From the hostess who seated us and had a great attitude, to the waitress, Lindsey, who was delightful and very informative about the menu. We told her we had been dying to try this place out but unfortunately had only half an hour to eat before our show started. She made sure we had some signature dishes and drinks so we could get the Cleo experience, even in such a short amount of time. The stand-outs to me were the Moussakah, Tuna Tartare & Brussel Sprouts. Dishes are small as they are mezzes but they are so delicious and extremely satisfying. The Clementina and Melon & Mezcal cocktails were HEAVENLY!! At the end of our dinner the manager came out to ask us how our experience was, which was a nice way to end our dinner. I've been to many restaurants in Vegas but this one was by far one of the most memorable. I can't wait to go back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moussakah: A+, Melon &amp; Mezcal cocktail: A+!

kuEHwLpaEBlLNs8uoUV-JA.text: I have been to Cleo a few times. Its a great way to take friends to somewhere new and experience a different cuisine that they may not have ever tried before and not feel like they are in a very ethnic place where there is nothing they can relate to.  Many people really just relate to Mediterranean/Middle Eastern food as falafels and kebobs. But there is so much more. Much, much more.  My personal favorite is Kibbe Nayeh, which in a nutshell is a tartare. It can be made with beef or my favorite, lamb. Cleo does not disappoint with this delicacy. Just the right amount of seasoning and it transports you to another world. My one takeaway is, this is very much a tapas place. Plates are very small. A far cry from what one would expect in a "regular" Mediterranean/Middle Eastern restaurants where the food is sometimes overflowing the plate. But the best thing about the tapas style for those who are uninitiated is the small plates, to experience a little this and that. So I kinda, can get it. I'll be back soon, and maybe get 2 kibbe nayeh dishes next time.

AFd1BIl_74l4fdQGiXvQNg.text: Wow. Just incredible! BRUSSEL SPROUTS were AMAZING and so was their greek salad and also their lamb and steak. Great service and can't wait to go back! Also had one of their signature drinks with fresh rosemary. Love staying at SLS and now I love it even more!

yuSdPYWHRXp9t0llceGwLA.text: I have been to this restaurant with my hubby over a dozen times and I can't say enough how amazing their food it! A must try for anyone who comes to Vegas. From their Tapas style dishes to the quality of ingredients, a perfect experience every time.

-BEIQLQh66JtQ7nunVnnag.text: The BEST service and the food was off the charts! I'm vegan and they were so accommodating. They even brought me a vegan menu and the super nice  chef came out to chat with me about recommendations! He was even willing to make something off the menu. The menu was already filled with tempting options. I had the freshly made bread (the spices were a stand out!) with hummus, fried mushrooms and -- wait for it -- the crispiest, juiciest flash-fried Brussels sprouts! No wonder these were such a hit; we kept seeing servers carrying multiple orders to various tables. I also had a hearty veggie soup, decadent falafel bites and ended up taking a watermelon frisee salad to go. I already knew this place was going to be the hit -- the second you walk in, the aroma from the bread and antipasti bar greets you with a warm welcome. (Don't go biting the air now!) I highly recommend the flash-fried Brussels sprouts, mushrooms, bread + hummus (not your typical, so don't get it twisted) and watermelon frisee salad. You'll be full, don't worry. I want to go back to try the kale salad and more of the vegan options! I love this place and can't wait to get dolled up and dine here again. I'll stop and let the photo speak for themselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honestly? You&#39;re good right here. :) oh and maybe get the fresh bread and hummus as a starter. Boom.
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More veggie. I&#39;d be mindful of aioli &amp; parm &amp; feta if ur vegan. u can always leave it out
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Closeup of two (of many!!) vegan friendly offerings - flash-fried Brussels sprouts and fresh hummus

3fTcxHY2mBYFaLMWanMMIQ.text: Dined here last month as they were highly recommended. We arrived at 5:58pm and they had us wait for two minutes to open the restaurant. That was a little awkward but I guess they were not ready.  After being seated the waitress seemed in a hurry to explain how to order. We had to ask her again when she came back. We ordered mushrooms, lamb kefta, lamb kabobs, shrimp kabobs, spinach & ricotta dumplings and scallops. We didn't order chicken kabobs but they comped us an order  because they were a little burnt.  My favorites were the mushrooms, spinach & ricotta dumplings and lamb kefta. The lamb kabob was dry and the scallops were undercooked.   Great ambience - lighting, music & decor.  I would go back & try them again because the mushrooms, dumplings and lamb kefta were absolutely delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach &amp; Ricotta dumplings
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp, chicken &amp; lamb kabobs. Platter of yummy mushrooms
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

QbpT7H5m9VyzlZFE9hIf0Q.text: This place is AMAZING!!!  Been here twice at the SLS in Las Vegas!   You have got to try the Lamb Shawarma!    Came here with friends for the weekend.  We ordered so much Hummus!  We ordered Spinach & Risotto Dumplings! We ordered lamb, chicken, and steak kabobs! We ordered Lamb Shawarma!  We ordered Mushroom Flatbread!  We ordered just about everything!  The kitchen was running on all 8 cylinders. EVERYTHING and I mean EVERYTHING that came to our table was amazing!  But for me personally, they start of the show was the lamb shawarma!  It was seasoned great, came out warm and with a sauce that just made it call come together!  It was a little overprice, like everywhere you go in a restaurant in Las Vegas, but I have been here twice already and if I could, ONLY THING I would ever come here for is the shawarma, thats just how good they are!   Now, speaking of cost, it was pricey.  Not ridiculous pricey for Las Vegas, but don't expect to get much value when it comes to price.  But do expect amazing tasting food, so to me if you're coming to Vegas, its expected.  This place is worth a trip if you're planning on going to a nice restaurant on the Last Vegas Strip!  The atmosphere is good, the lighting is dimmed, and the decor works with a name like Cleo's and their mediterranean theme they have going on.  Very clean, open and airy.  Sometimes you go to these restaurants that seems like you're going to a board meeting where the CEO is about to fire you, this is not the case! lol  How server was great! She knew the menu very well, was polite, not pushy and took great care of us!  I saw the manager roaming around checking up on the tables from a distance to ensure you was having a pleasant time.  I like that, I don't need to have the manager come to my table but its nice to see that they are alert, attentive and accessible if needed.    Located in the SLS Casino, free parking...  Overall, I can't recommend this place enough!  RUSH AND GO TRY THIS PLACE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus &amp; bread
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach &amp; Risotto Dumplings
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb, Chicken, and Steak Kabobs!

El1He4OyKK2HLpqyNsiRCw.text: I'm not a huge fan of Mediterranean but i do love this place the Brussel sprouts are so addicting you don't notice you order like 5 and the hummus is amazing the food over all is just so earthy and full of flavor. I always recommend this place to people who love Mediterranean. The vibe is chill and atmosphere is pretty cool.

p9G7imPA_x3Kjmp0TtM_Sw.text: Great service and food! I think this is a great place to take friends and do something different.  It is a tapas style restaurant and some of the dishes are prepared right in the middle of the dining room.  My favorite dishes were:  Hummus- so nice and fresh and the bread was amazing. FYI- extra bread=$2 Borak- Puff Pastry with different kinds of cheese. So tasty and yummy delicate pasty Tuna tartare- make sure to mix everything together and eat with the chips. Sooo good!   Some Misses were: Spinach and ricotta dumpling- it is missing that X factor and lots of basil! It's okay not too flavorful  The Greek salad was a little overdressed.   We also had the beef and chicken kabobs which were good!   Overall the look and experience is something I would definitely recommend. This is a hit for SLS and I would like to try many more things.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef kabob
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Borak- puff pasty with cheese. One of my favorites!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus is worth coming back for.

0Hs-jk87eW7agRXXCXjCqg.text: even though it is a mediterranean Food the twist and the taste is very tasty  We tried it in Dubai but the Vegas is totally a different game ..  highly recommended

ELLmLISZbxFCWJoacx_tFg.text: I received a $40 food credit for booking my hotel room through Expedia, and Cleo seemed like the perfect place to use it at since they feature tapas at affordable prices. The restaurant itself is dimly lit and has a romantic ambiance. They play some fun Bollywood and middle eastern music which I thought was very fitting. Service was great and accommodating when we asked for a table away from the casino, but tables for 2 in the back are really close together.   My cosmopolitan-like cocktail was really good, but my boyfriend's drink was even better. We started with the pork belly and wagyu skewers which were both really yummy. The clam and noodles dish was also very good, but my favorite was the scallops. I'm a sucker for scallops, and these were delicious. I would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu beef

4QRPVGBph1GZ9qjcEYkAaQ.text: My partner and I had some business in the area to take care of, so we decided to go to Cleo mainly because he'd been there before with a friend, and they really enjoyed their experience.  We were seated in a booth, upon request, immediately by a curt but professional hostess. She didn't remove the extra place settings, and it was kind of awkward sitting at the table with three extra settings, but that's the old server in me. The server assistant came by with water and removed the extra settings then.  The decor wasn't my favorite. I'm not sure how the fake books across the walls are supposed to make the place feel Mediterranean. There is a strange disconnect from the bar to the restaurant, although they are in the same room.  But I was always told to not judge a book by its cover.  The server arrived quickly enough, but didn't take time to really suggest much until we promoted him to. Even then, he didn't give much explanation.  He told us he would give us a bit of time to choose. He wasn't kidding. When he finally returned, I went with my gut and ordered the lamb sliders and the potato latkes.  The server assistant was the star, though. He checked on us after he delivered the food, not the server. He made sure we had everything we needed. I believe he said his name is Horacio. Great customer service skills.  I definitely enjoyed my sliders. The lamb was cooked well, and he feta was just enough to compliment without overpowering the dish. I enjoyed the sesame slider buns, too. Great texture with the meat and the greens and veggies. The latkes were great, as well. Next time, I will ask for the tatziki on the side, because it was definitely overpowering.  We had finished long before our server dropped the check. He seemed like he was in the weeds, and didn't have time to check on us for quite awhile after taking our order.  We asked for the check, then he returned empty handed several minutes later, blaming the server assistant - whom we well know has no access to the server's checks on any point of sale system - and returned yet again, this time with the check.   On he plus side, it has taken me a bit of time to review this place, but the management staff has already reached out to my partner and has invited us back to make up for the experience.  I will definitely have to update my review then.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious lamb sliders. A must get.
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato latkes. Crispy anddelicious. The tatziki was a bit overpowering, so I&#39;d request it on the side in he future.

iGZLLoPQglpY1NX6i_p3gQ.text: This Mediterranean style restaurant is located inside SLS hotel. I had a nice Christmas dinner here last year thanks to the manager who corrected some minor issues caused by a few staff members who seemed flustered by the busy crowd that night. I had the seasonal lamb shank and flatbread and hummus. Both were very tasty. The lamb was a pound of tender meat with a pomegranate balsamic reduction over couscous ($37). I paired it with a house red. In hindsight, it was way too much food for just me but I enjoyed it. Would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus tahini and the duval double barrel draft--all recommended

aM-TxZgAQ7TxqI03hsb-pA.text: Cleo is an unassuming looking place in the SLS hotel . We stopped in to grab a drink and some apps and were blown away. Stephen, the bartender was educated on the menu and steered us towards the Lamb Tartare!! It was amazing as were the other small plates we got!! The brusselsprouts, the octopus, the pork belly !! Definitely will be back!!

0jTjIl549sgQ1aPoLdADtw.text: I'm quite a fan of Mediterranean eats and was excited by a non-French option on The Strip. However, it was just okay. I recommend the mushrooms, the lamb chops and the wagyu beef. I think all 3 stars can go to that. The rest weren't awful by ANY means, but there's really no "wow" factor.  Weird note was that we ordered draft beer and it came to us like it was completely frozen. Isn't the point of draft that it came straight from the keg and poured that way? Hubby felt his drink was flat. Still, management somehow noticed my husband's discontent and even though we said it wasn't a big deal and we didn't need a drink on the house, they still took that beer off the bill without us asking. Classy and nice!

mteK0PH5s4k-E9wK3tbK9Q.text: Cleo made my month long birthday celebration extra special! Let me begin by saying that our busser made my dining experience extraordinary. He serenaded me with a song by Stevie Wonder, my favorite artist of all time!   We ordered the following items: falafel, hummus, brussels sprouts, spinach & ricotta dumplings, roast lamb and lamb sliders. Everything was seasoned nicely, but my absolute favorite were the brussels sprouts. They seem to have a highly skilled pastry chef, so order one of everything.   This is by far, the best mediterranean restaurant on the Strip and should not be missed!

_Osg8EGo5V0fq-MUJ8bwmg.text: A group of 7 of us came in for dinner. First thing you notice when you walk in is the beautiful, large brick oven in the center of the restaurant. I wish we could have sat in front of that area instead of behind it.   We honestly had no idea what to order because everything sounded interesting and new to us. I ended up getting the Brussels sprouts, falafel and merguez flatbread. The food came out in a timely manner. The falafel was good, crispy on the outside but still fluffy on the inside; not something I would pay $10 for though. The merguez flatbread was their most popular of all the flatbreads so maybe I was expecting too much. It was light and crispy but it lacked flavor. The best part of my meal were the brussel sprouts. The slight char gave it some texture and the tangy sauce it's tossed in really topped it off.   The price of the food didn't match the flavors I had. But if you do decide to try this place out, you MUST get the brussel sprouts.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Merguez flatbread
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Falafel
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts

ShWhTQpZYOM0YBYzR7dNsw.text: Entryway of Cleo is gorgeous.  Look inside and you see the design flaws.  Books along a high shelf along the entire restaurant; more Mexican architecture than anything middle eastern; odd wallpaper (like Grandma's); uncomfortable seating.  Quick ratings: =========== Food: 3.5 stars Experience: 4.5 stars Menu choices: 5.0 stars Decor: 3.0 stars Service: 3.0 stars  I tried a flurry of things: ================== 1.  Hummus & Tahini ($9) -- you may pass by the hummus because it's so commonplace and you get it at Trader Joe's all the time, but it's more than amazing.  Served with piping hot, housemade pita.  (5.0 stars)  2.  Lamb Shawarma ($18) -- probably the best of the night, but expensive.  (5.0 stars)  3.  Chicken Kebab ($10) -- nicely skewered and sliced thin, it was really good and moist.  A winner!  (4.0 stars)  4.  Grilled Octopus ($16) -- overcooked and a little fishy.  The two other people in my party didn't like it at all. (3.0 stars)  5.  Saffron Rice ($6) -- boring; common.  Pass.  (3.0 stars)  6.  Greek Salad ($12) -- good, but not great.  Not enough feta for my liking.  (3.5 stars)  7.  Brussel Sprouts ($9) -- everyone has it on their menu, but doesn't do it this good.  Shaved and roasted with capers, parsley, almonds, red wine vinaigrette, the toasted hazelnut mix is worthy.  (4.5 stars)   8.  Flt Mushrooms ($14) -- Mixed with dates, hazelnuts, puffed wild rice.  I didn't like it in Hollywood, but it was done perfectly and I adored it.  (4.5 stars)  9.  GLS Luca Red Wine ($19) -- at an enormous $19 price, it didn't cut the mustard.  Go for the Numanthia Termes Tempranillo, 2010 (Toro, Spain) for $14 instead.  In summary ========= Service was weird, nice but not professional and borderline social skill issue.  I like the Cleo at the restored Redbury Hotel on Vine in Hollywood better.

NWZK4ZpYCy1nerwUbk_hqQ.text: Octopus and shawarma were to die for. I also liked the beef kebab. The service was a bit slow,  but we were not in a hurry, so it didn't take away from our experience here.

AyMRn3K4U-rdb__tYsp7mQ.text: We had a unforgettable meal at Cleo. The food was delicious and the plates were small enough that we were able to try lots of different plates. We had three people in our group and were able to order 8 different things on the menu. Pricing was reasonable and the decor was very Bohemian.

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xOIegm764CvdGlReFOSKww.text: Brought my team here after a trade show for a staff dinner. Had a nice private area and great service. Tapas style food. Had octopus, falafel, hangar steak, salad, babaghanoush, pizza. Located in the SLS hotel. Everyone was really pleased with the food! Will come back next time I'm in LV.

cv4UMUuUfhN3TQkQxBhNYw.text: Fantastic!  Try the spicy cigars and all of the kabobs are amazing!  One of my favorite restaurants anywhere in the US.

sGZlHrYb3lluUMTXwB0GAA.text: Very deserving of their spot on Open Table's 100 Hot Spots Restaurants in America list! We went here last night looking for a great meal, and we got just that. Everything from start to finish was perfect.   The dishes come in smaller portion sizes, so our waitress recommended we order four or five things to share so we got the watermelon salad, the wood-burning oven brussel sprout hearts, the hanger steak and the sticky toffee pudding.   I can't get over how good the watermelon salad was. Light, refreshing, incredibly tasty. I could have eaten just that and left happy. (12.00)  The brussel sprouts and hanger steak were both equally as fantastic.   And finally, the sticky toffee pudding. I didn't know desert could be that wonderful. I highly recommend this dish!  Overall, the experience was close to perfection.  It definitely doesn't disappoint.

zo5rIYbPa1pXD3XfrOy7BQ.text: I really enjoyed my meal. I didn't read any reviews before I ate there so I didn't know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised. They have a really good social hour menu with cheaper prices which is why I decided to try them in the first place. We ordered about 6 items and liked them all.  I recommend it.

30Acpj1dqC8LJqHaPPPTqg.text: Cleo is just amazing, their food is great. Ambience, Decor, Service staff is very on point and how can you go wrong with fresh baked bread and Hummus....Yummmmmmm

hegoQqTppOaH5j_ZernpTQ.text: Went late Saturday night. I called ahead and got reservation on short notice. I'm glad I did cuz the place was packed  We ordered the Kabobs. Probably enough for two, but it was so good, I ate it all. I ordered the combo. It came with two rice dishes., salad with fresh tomatoes. Also came with stewed tomato. Excellent!  There was a bit of wait for the food, but we had fun chatting so it didn't matter. Can't wait to go back!  Btw it appears to be the same owners as the restarant on East Flamingo and Maryland which I had eaten at several times. I wish I would have known that. I would have tried this place a lot earlier

KhHAyutDHKHTgLXKleGFpg.text: My friend and I went to Cleo on our last night in Vegas; halfway through the meal, my friend said, "I wish that we'd come here earlier in our trip so that we could have come back!!"  Pros: - friendly and accommodating service: We were seated promptly and welcomed warmly by multiple hosts/servers--they even helped me to find a place to charge my phone. I can't eat lots of things, and our server was extremely knowledgeable and helpful in offering suggestions; she provided me with a gluten-free menu and was careful to double-check with the kitchen when she wasn't sure. She reasonably recommended that we order about four or five plates for the two of us (one reviewer commented that their server tried to up-sell them, and that was not at all our experience). - "fast food": Even with my somewhat limited options, everything sounded so amazing that we had a difficult time deciding, so we placed an appetizer order while we tried to make up our minds. This strategy proved fruitless, as the food came out so quickly that we didn't have time to come to any decisions! Once we did place the rest of our order, the other dishes were prepared and delivered quickly as well. - delicious food: See my friend's comment above :) We ordered babaganoush, Brussels sprout hearts, tuna tartare, and lamb shawarma; I also got veggie sticks to eat the babaganoush, which comes with laffa. I'm salivating just remembering them all. --- The babaganoush was uniquely spiced and fantastic (and that's coming from someone who is very particular about babaganoush). The veggie arrangement also was stellar--great variety and bountiful!! My friend could not stop raving about (and eating) the laffa, which came out warm. --- The Brussels sprouts were SO GOOD. Order them!!! My friend thought that they were her favorite--until the tuna came out. --- The flavor combination in the tuna tartare was on point, and all of the ingredients tasted so fresh. It is presented with the tuna in the middle with the other ingredients positioned separately around the plate, and then the server offers to mix it for you. It was served with gluten-filled crackers that my friend reported also were delicious (I ate it with lettuce from the veggie platter or just with my fork!). --- The shawarma also was excellent (again, coming from someone who is particular about shawarma); the meat was cooked and spiced to perfection, and it was served with more bread, pepperoncini, tzatziki, and something else that I'm forgetting (sorry...my mental image is that it was red, in which case it probably was harissa or something else spicy and delicious), but the meat was so perfect all by itself that it really didn't need any accompaniments! My friend housed the tzatziki, though, so I assume that it, like everything else, was top notch! (I can't personally vouch for it because I can't eat dairy either.) - fair prices and portions: This is not your nightmare tapas experience of "empty tummy, empty wallet"; rather, the portions were wholly adequate as recommended by our server (2-3 dishes per person--we are small people but big eaters!!), and we were more than happy to pay for high quality food, service, and overall experience. In particular, the lamb shawarma seemed like a great value for the amount and quality of the meat.  Cons: - The only thing that left me scratching my head was that the chopped salad appeared on the gluten-free menu, even though it contains freekeh (wheat). I didn't ask about it (there were too many other/more creative options to get Israeli salad, which I can get anywhere), and they otherwise seemed to be extremely aware of allergen issues, so there must be a good explanation.  My friend and I both highly recommend!! This is the best (and arguably the only good) option in SLS, and it's worth the trip from anywhere on the strip!

APl8EbPjiOP8sKYIRXIPwg.text: Items Selected: Babaganoush  Lebaneh with Feta  Laffa Bread Kibbeh Spanakopita Falafel - Tahini, Tabouleh Mushrooms - Dates, Hazelnuts, Puffed Rice Lamb Tagine - Apricots, Silan, Couscous, Sesame Seeds Moussakah - Layered Eggplant, Bolognese, Bechamel Kale Flatbread - Creme Fraiche, Parmesan, Garlic Oil Sticky Toffee Pudding - Butterscotch, Walnut Feuilletine, Vanilla Gelato Fig & Almond Pannacotta - Amareto and Almond Brittle Small French Press - LAMill  Generally blase as it relates to Mediterranean cuisine but always hopeful for something to change my mind it was with guarded expectations that I sat down with a friend at Cleo, and although both the room and the crowd veer trendy and loud the food can best be described as bold - each of the eleven plates we experienced featuring textbook execution, beautiful presentation, and the sort of flavor profile rarely embraced in an upscale environment.  Located inside the SLS, under the gleaming guise of the Greek Pharaoh and Starck designed through-and-through, our 6:30 seating started with pleasant greetings at the podium and quickly swept away to a small two-top flanking an open kitchen the service could not have been better, drinks kept brimming throughout the evening and plates arriving in a slow, measured fashion - exactly as requested.  Beset by tagines and spice jars juxtaposing slick surfaces and sparkling chandeliers beneath a lively soundtrack that only rarely interrupted conversation our meal began with a quartet of $7 'mezzes' and with both spreads silky smooth and teaming with flavor atop pillows of Laffa the Kibbeh and creamy spinach puffs were no less special, the former balancing ground lamb to nuts and spice beneath a golden shell.  Moving next to larger plates under simplified headings like "Vegetables" and "Meats" it was with some disappointment that we were informed the coveted Duck Bastilla was unavailable but making due with four more items both the elegantly paired mushrooms and equally well conceived tagine were quite good while the still-bubbling moussakah was my favorite plate of the night.  A touch underwhelmed by crispy balls of falafel that had trouble standing up to the sauce in which they sat it was in flatbread that our savories finished and with a crisp, charred crust from the central oven likely to make any topping taste better the bitter kale amidst pools of tangy creme fraiche was wonderful, an elegant and light dish I could see playing well to the pre-club crowd heading to LiFE.  At this point approaching nine o'clock, with every seat in the space filled, our meal concluded with coffee alongside a duo of desserts and as much I liked the somewhat out-of-place pudding it was the pannacotta that stole the show - each creamy bite flooding the palate with milky-sweet tones while Amareto soaking the figs lingered at the end.  Although higher priced than the typical 'mom n' pop' or Greek festival setting, almost every single item we tasted at Cleo was reference standard, the total bill with tax and tip clocking in just under $160 for nearly three hours of great food, service, and 'scene.'  Certainly not a place for quiet conversation but definitely a spot where both the 'club' crowd or the local looking for a nice night out can be equally comfortable I commend the team at Cleo for bringing something totally new to the scene - it is original concepts like this and Yusho that The Strip really needs.

wT5bIBDT3F0g448UYizR8Q.text: We were greeted by a sea of smiles and genuine hellos. As various members of the staff stoped by to ensure our needs were met. We asked each one what is there favorite dish and we tried everyone of them. Not only is there magnificent staff well versed in there entire menu but also have palette for the finer things in life amd  pass it on to there patrons.

waNAB1FtueglIHjZjfinVg.text: Went to the one in la years ago so the boyfriend and I decided to take his parents and brother here when they visited. Decor was trendy, very open compared to la's location but maybe it's because the one in la was a lot busier than this location. Servers, manager, bussers, and food runners were all very friendly and well trained. This place is all tapas so we ordered 15 plates for 5 people.  - Falafel: very crispy! It was good but I wouldn't get it again  - Bone marrow: big portion. Very tasty. Comes with mushrooms with I liked - Sauteed mushrooms: comes with a variety of different mushrooms, not sure what sauce it was but I loved it - Couscous: super fresh tasting. Great side dish  - Grilled octopus: I liked the sauce that came with it, but I wish the octopus pieces were meatier  - Beet salad: so fresh. Comes with 2 kinds of beets and avocados. I would get it again  - Lamb chops: they didn't ask how we liked it cooked so it came out medium. I'd rather have it medium rare. It was just ok - Chicken kebab: on the dry side but flavoring made up for it. And dipping sauces made it less dry - Saffron rice: what I liked about the rice was it didn't taste oily or buttery like other places  - Wagyu beef kebab: too overcooked for my liking but I like the seasoning  - Lamb roast: definitely on the chewier side but I did like this dish the best out of all the meats. It came with couscous and some sauce that went well with it   We were completely stuffed with a total of 15 plates. They recommend 2-3 plates per person and I could have finished what was left but then I would've had a belly. It was a good full for everyone.

Wb3iCLnVzyAMNFnyFsraeA.text: Best restaurant in Vegas, the food was amazing, lamb chops, kebabs, lamb and couscous. The highest level I ever ate. Moroccan food with a flavor reminiscent of home. Highly recommend eating there. The service was good and the desserts delicious, price was right $ 60 per person. Halloumi cheese salad was disgusting not recommended. I really like fancy restaurants, I eat at the restaurants at least twice a day, I have never written reviews, but this place is really worth it.

u1jetRnb3K_efjMGQ-s6-A.text: I had never had Mediterranean food before and this was a great experience for me. We order alot of dishes to try and see what we liked. I started my ordered with oysters, the Greek Salad, spinach and cheese dumplings and Brussel sprouts. They were soooo good! I didn't think I would like the Brussels sprouts but they tasted like potato chips. My main dish I had the artichoke Flatbread, I loved that also. Then for dessert I had, I can't remember the name but it was a Custer with figs. I had never had figs and i absolutely loved them! The atmosphere of the place was really nice, and the waiters did a great job. I would love to come back again.

ag8CeDfRt2a_bImXkqboFw.text: I would love to give the hummus here 5 stars it's really that good!   However the 2 times I've gone though really deserves 2 stars. I would give the food 4 stars. The service though is slacking big time!!!!   The first time I went the server was very awkward and talked wayyy too much. Even went on to say something about not ordering the flatbread because it has "way too many carbs" under his breath. Hello I'm a normal 20 something girl, yes I like to watch my figure, but I freaking love carbs! Thank you! Ha! It also took 15 minutes to get both of my friends cocktails! This isn't even an exaggeration because a lot of the food we ordered was out by the time they got them.   As for my exact same cocktail that I ordered somehow got lost in translation. this place had barely anyone in it, I believe this was just the servers mistake at this point (no worries because everyone makes mistakes).   What takes the cake though is he tried arguing with me how I never order one when all I did was ask politely where my cocktail was. Okay, so you didn't think I ordered one, but clearly I did, don't argue, just say sorry and go and reorder or order the cocktail I requested.   There were a few other incidents with this server, I forget his name, but did not really set the tone for finer dining.   After that time I wanted to go back with my boyfriend because venues really do deserve a second chances. (Even third! Sometimes.) The second time was much much busier, after waiting 25 minutes past our reservation time we were sat at a small two top table in the front of the restaurant, wasn't exactly what we pictured, but weren't going to be picky because we just wanted a romantic night!   Some commotion started happening with the tables next to us, they looked as though they were setting up for a big party. Then a someone came to inform us that a huge bachelorette party was being seated next to us and wanted to know if we would like to move.   We agreed that this was probably best, so we were moved to the chefs counter until another table was available. As the food we ordered at our old table started coming out to the new spot, everything seemed awkward at this point, and definitely a mood killer! We just wanted to be at an actual table eating and drinking the food we ordered!  We were finally sat our [final] table and they told us they were moving our food, which they did; but somehow took a bit, and by that time most of it was cold. We were very polite the whole time, but the night just wasn't going as we'd hoped.   After the shuffle around the restaurant by multiple servers/ managers/ and hosts. We got the bill and (not saying that they have to) but not even a cocktail was taken care of for the inconvenience. Not that it was expected, but honestly it would have smoothed the experience over  for something as crazy as being moved 3 times in the middle of dinner.    It was my boyfriends first time, and needless to say he isn't as forgiving as I am, and probably will not be back.

LaroxjDwzuumgkwW6QT1hA.text: Love love love Cleo each and every time I come here. The Brussels sprouts - leaves and hearts are must orders everyone! I miss miss miss the infamous lamb shank and eagerly await it's return. Seriously- call me when it's in the kitchen and I'll be there!

XrOKVofCi1WSr8CUn_agjg.text: Very impress of this new restaurant inside SLS Las Vegas; Contemporary and quite chic Tapas style.  Decor is tasty and elegantly put together; Service was pretty good as well. The dishes are perfectly proportioned and delicious...  Watermelon & Feta Avocado, Spiced Nuts, Cucumber salad is a must; don't forget their assorted Hummus and their oyster too. Their pita bread was freshly baked and it was perfect.  Cant wait to go back; someday.  Definitely will recommend to anyone planning to visit Vegas.  Glad that we got to try this during our visit.

yrJtnMKzKq7wpRCW17ApHw.text: Stupid...stupid good.  Amazing food and service.  We had five dishes and they were all amazing. The flatbread mushroom pizza was off the charts.  Don't overlook the quinoa salad bc it'll blow your socks off.  If you have one meal in SLS, eat here you won't be disappointed.

KOlJH4oFLwFWqLiqKq2-0w.text: What a surprising gem inside of the new SLS. Upon arriving, I was impressed by the location of the resturant; being close to the front entrance.   The food was suburb! I'm usually not a big fan of a "Tapa" style menu, but I was happy with the menu items. Although I got full pretty quick (after ordering several items I liked), I was very pleased and satisfied.   I enjoyed the "cigars", Greek salad, hummus (bread was great), Lamb Beef Shawarma and the lentil soup. The food was fresh and seasoned to perfection. Service was great! Drinks were also flavorful and not watered down. Will be back...

t4tdL_hyfkXXC2BvbD-wjw.text: What a great place within the SLS! I love the atmosphere, decoration, sounds, staff, and food! All great! There was 4 in our party on a Sunday night. We went there and shared several dishes Including the Brussel sprout leaves (my fav), oysters, lamb, braised octopus, eggplant flatbread, and other small tapas dishes. Very flavorful and presented beautifully. Our server was Dani she was great! Answered every question we had about the menu, gave her options and also recommended some amazing dishes. She was absolutely great! All over great experience I think the prices were a little over priced but it's in a new hotel and on the strip.

hXAUXm3pVfspU-RJii1mCg.text: REALLY wanted this love this place, but can't.  Extremely slow service and forgetful wait staff overwhelms the otherwise great food.   Not a great place for a business dinner.  Even with reservations and advance notice of group size, the restaurant was totally unprepared.

q-N9Qb1nR8qb1aost6tdTw.text: Phenomenal flavors and presentation.  The grilled octopus was artisanal.  Jose and Mia provided superlative service and recommendations at the bar.  This is the best meal I've had in Vegas in recent memory.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outstanding grilled octopus.

Koe7du9_WW5dBEuA4wL3Uw.text: Went to have dinner last night with the wife. Really good food. My True rating is 3.5  Made reservation online easily through their website. Got a table at 10:30 one hour before their closing time and the place was full. Good energy, music and we were seated promptly.  Server's greeting was friendly, asked us if this was our first time dining there and answered any questions we had.  Ordered 2 featured cocktails and the following menu items.  Oysters, Tuna tartare, Dolmades, Kibbeh, Grilled Octopus, Fish kebob, Spicy potatoes with cilantro aioli, and the Bone marrow. Finishing with fig and amaretto panacotta.  Overall the experience was good.  The good:  - Oysters were good, were topped with this lemony confite that went very well with the freshness of the oysters. - The Spicy potatoes were my favorite - The Kibbeh was really good, crispy on the outside, tender on the inside. Even though I did get one that included what felt like a piece of rubber band that I had to deal with unfashionably.  - Octopus was really really good! - Fish kebob  The average:  - Tuna tartare was...meh - Dolmades.... mayo? really??? I already loathe mayonaisse, but now with dolmades?  The bad:  - They were out of bone marrow which we had read many great things about. Disappointing - Last part of the service: Server was nice and professional, until she decided she wanted to go home, then she started dropping off checks in the likes of her casino coworkers, one table after another. When she reached our table to ask if wanted something else (our check in hand) we had just been served last couple of dishes. I reminded her we wanted to have dessert and when we ordered the Flourless Chocolate Cake (wife is celiac) and we were told that it takes 20 minutes to be ready....along with other 2 or 3 dessert items.  Really Cleo???!  Is this True, or should we better order dessert at the beginning of our meal to be able to try the one we actually want? Maybe a heads-up at the beginning of our meal?   This is a great place to eat in Las Vegas. That is why I still gave the 4 stars instead of bringing rating down to 3. We chose a later time to eat because we had a late show to attend, and we arrived 1 hour before closing time. We ordered a decent amount of food and drinks. I believe we were a pretty good table based on my past experience as a waiter. We don't go out to eat that often, we are locals in Las Vegas so to feel that rushed at the end of our meal the moment the clock ticked closing time was very impersonal and impolite.   Will probably go back, but there are options available in town and as the buffet as SLS shows this is a crucial point for restaurants at SLS to not drop the ball with details like these. Good luck and thanks for reading.

lHfnZJliQ8ptQCeKebOFKA.text: Awesome service & amazing vegan options with staff who know exactly what's vegan. Tip: try the mushrooms, artichokes and Harira soup. Also the quinoa salad, baba and hummus are all fantastic.

P-2aEgdmvDyIxcT-4OMgpQ.text: If I could I'd give it a 3.9.  The food is good, it's flavorful and enjoyable. My favorite items are:  The hummus and the bread (sooooo damn good!) The grilled Octopus  The tomato & borrata salad The Lebaneh Lamb schwarma Lamb chops Kibbeh  I've tried 80% of the menu as the third time I went was with a large group and we basically ordered everything. Portions are small and meant to be shared  (tapas sizes) so it's great to go with groups and even if you go as a pair it's nice to try multiple dishes.  It's authentic Mediterranean/Middle Eastern but it's Americanized..so it's not intimidating food, even if you've never tried similar food.  The service is OKAY, they always seem too busy..in the sense that the staff can't quite keep up with the customers. The waiters and busboys are always running around like chickens w. their heads cut off. Something will always take (WAY) too long or not arrive at all, so don't be surprised. The service is ALWAYS just meh.  The atmosphere is lively, young (not like 21 yr old young but mid 20s and up but just feels good young, y'know) and fun. The music is loud and it's a good place for people watching and having drinks. It's decorated super cute and a little eclectic.  I personally don't love the SLS Vegas and feel it's a little out of the way so I don't go here that often. Also, I can't eat this type of food that often because it just doesn't wanna be friends w. my tummy, another personal reason why it's not one of my favs.   Overall, if you want a busy fun place with delicious small plates and a cool vibe hit up Cleos.

HeLp_WHGrv-AAXk3U6uyBg.text: The booths are very comfortable, we found the pricing to be reasonable for being on such a nice property.  The service is excellent.  Very personable. If you like middle eastern food this is the spot!  They also have private booths for partys.  We will def be back....

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best bread in town!  So good with their Hummus
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Lamb is excellent

U8z7ZmsLDICaQl3Gvp5d6g.text: I had no idea what to expect going into this place, but I'm so glad we came here! Amazing mediterranean tapas! Everything we had was delicious and we were very full by the end of the dinner. We got the lebaneh, hummus, lamb shawarma, chicken tagine, Brussels sprouts leaves, mushrooms, and falafel.  We started with lebaneh and hummus-- the laffa was DELICIOUS and warm from the oven. The lebaneh with feta was so flavorful and creamy, while hummus was good, but we could have skipped it (after everything else came out, we stopped eating it in favor of the other dishes).   The lamb shawarma came next and we actually ordered a second one-- it comes wrapped in laffa and is the size of a small, overstuffed taco. The lamb was spiced perfectly and practically melted in your mouth. I added a bit of the lebaneh to half of it which was an excellent decision!  The Brussels sprouts and mushrooms (recommended by our excellent server) were so, so good. The Brussels sprouts leaves (there are two different dishes, leaves or hearts) were charred and deliciously spiced. My husband hates Brussels sprouts, but had seconds of these! The mushrooms were a little sweet and crispy, and had the consistency of caramelized chopped nuts!   The chicken tagine was deliciously tender and moist. They give you about a 4-5oz piece of meat and some had the bone, some didn't. It comes with saffron rice, which was very flavorful and mixed well with the mushrooms!  All in all, we left very full and VERY happy with our meal. Not only was the food fantastic, but the service was excellent (I wish I could remember our server's name, I think maybe Netta?). The ambiance was also very relaxed and calming, which is saying a lot for a restaurant in a casino! If we're ever in Vegas again, we'll be back!

MtHx3TwCUqAgRgFAzo9-0A.text: We went for the Mother's Day buffet. The staff was superior despite the buffet layout. They had a variety of seafood, fresh crepes and prime rib. Everything was perfectly cooked. The bottomless mimosas were an extra step past excellence.

fAE8cyoUm9wLeAYmJq5_Jw.text: Cleo is an awesome Mediterranean restaurant.  Good Happy Hour with menu items about 25% off.  Small dishes and tapas. Fairly pricey otherwise.  $$$$

dCX4lnvzkD3OTNWyRqtJbw.text: Solid place to eat.  Tapas style, so sharing is caring and expect to pay for it if you have a big appetite.  We came with a larger party, so 20% gratuity was automatically added to our check and totally worth it with server Janelle (think that's her name).   Our server recommended most of all the dishes we ordered and she didn't steer us wrong in any way.    Grilled octopus- tentacles and all, good texture and cooked well flash fried brussel sprout leaves- house favorite and a must try spicy cigars- deep fried, thinly rolled with flavorful marinated meat lebaneh- amazing yogurt base dip scallops- can't go wrong, tender chicken tagine- pretty display, a little bit like fried rice with a Mediterranean flavor gyro tacos- hearty tacos, awesome flavor if you're info lamb clams over noodles- the clams were nothing eventful, but I must say the noodles were addictive flat bread- oddly enough they serve it in paper bags, but it was so fresh, you'll want more  There were a few more dishes that I can't quite recall, but the experience was so worth it and we enjoyed sharing all the dishes.  Located in the swanky SLS, you can't miss this place.  I would recommend making reservations or just come when they first open to get a beautiful evening with great service and excellent food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy cigars-flakey wrap, nicely seasoned ground meat with Mediterranean spices. Crowd pleaser...
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Light-medium bodied, $50 one of the more affordable and tasty reds.
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb shawarma-hearty dish, grilled octopus, both are excellent dishes

dAM1Hw-rSP8BCoAZVlfZHA.text: i loved it here! wish i could have gone again!! i sat at the bar and took the suggestions of the bartender...  i ordered the burrata salad to start...perfect portion and fresh and delish  he insisted that i get the lamb tartar...something i would have never selected on my own..  OMG delish! it was so damn good! if you order one thing on the menu...this is it  wanted to come back for lunch the next day but they are only open for dinner (and we had other dinner plans).

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lamb tartar

rOjtlCbGXfWzTZBWRpaVKA.text: Cleo is located inside the SLS Hotel. I really wish this restaurant was a little more on the center strip where the rest of the action is for us out of towners. We still wanted to try the Mediterranean food here enough to make the drive, and I'm soo glad we did.   We ended up ordering a few of the small tapas style dishes. All the food we tried was very good and left us wanting more.   We ordered the following items: 1. Lamb Kefta Kabab: Impossible to go wrong with this. Comes with one skewer of meat. Juicy and flavorful.  2. Spicy Cigars: Seasoned beef rolled into phyllo dough and deep fried accompanied with a yogurt type of dip. I thought these were just alright. Meat was flavorful but a little dried out. The dip was super tasty though and I realized I kept on dipping everything in it.   3. Moussakah: This little rectangle dish smelled sooo amazing!! I'm not enough of a food pro to even begin trying to explain the goodness here. Layered eggplant, bolognese and a bechamel sauce. Kinda wish there was some kind of a crunchy texture to support all the ooey gooey amazingness, but I don't wanna be greedy and mess with perfection here.   4. Brussel Sprouts: These seemed deep fried and mixed with capers and sliced almonds tossed in a vinaigrette. Great dish to share.   5. Lamb Shwarma: Teeny tiny pocket of heaven. I could eat at least 321 more of these babies.   There were sooo many other things one the menu which sounded so amazing -  BONE MARROW.... Any time i see bone marrow on a menu I get super excited. Unfortunately I didn't get to try it this time but now have something to look forward to when I visit next time!

GRXKwgfEw8uIxAcypHGFbw.text: Decor was lovely, food was delicious, but the service was lackluster. It started off with the hostess missing from the podium in the front to the servers, and the wait time for our food. The food was very flavorful and it was a breath of fresh air other than your go to cookie cutter restaurants. We especially enjoyed the shrimp kebab, hangar steak, fried chicken, and dessert. They had a good selection of wine and I chose the evodia which was  a light bodied red. They had a decent amount of food to chose from but it's more of a social spot than a nice anniversary dinner place. They also failed to acknowledge our anniversary as I added it on the notes section of the reservation. Go to Cleo with your friends and share some plates but if you're looking to celebrate a special occasion, this just isn't the right place.

CtxOSAtwKjtCa_NHJgpu0w.text: Mother's Day buffet had its highs and lows. There was an abundance of food including seafood, salads, breads, crepes, well done beef and pork tenderloin, vegetables, chicken, potatoes, baba ganoush, hummus and desserts to satisfy any appetite. Mimosas and Bloody Marys were unlimited and the tables were full of happy families. I was disappointed that the chicken tagine was dried out and the baba ganoush lacked any garlic. Overall, however, no one was leaving with an empty stomach.

kex3pSk2KIVJPhF-DIG0ww.text: This restaurant is very nicely decorated. It was even nicer when you get in than it looks when you peek in from the casino. Our server, Lindsey, was great and made us feel very welcome. We had the lebaneh with feta and laffa to start followed by a greek salad. Both were delish. For my main, I had the grilled octopus. It was so tender and tasty! I demolished it!!! My friend had the garlic shrimp and was equally pleased with her meal. All in all a very enjoyable meal. Skip Northside and come here!

7md4TAD0A8S4vmKmqpZo0g.text: This is a great Mediterranean restaurant! The service was superb the wait staff was very professional and fast. The lighting in ambience makes for a great dinner any night of the week or even a great lunch. I didn't realize they had a brunch until later in the week but when I'm back in Vegas I definitely will be trying it. I saw sign that said this place was "Top 100 Hotspot Restaurant in America"- I would completely agree with this statement. I had the Bone Marrow and it came out and looked even better than the previous photos I had seen and it tasted fantastic. This was my first time trying an item like this and I was extremely glad that I had it here first. It was tender and juicy with the balsamic reduction sauce. A slight bit of fat but that's expected with this type of item. It was perfectly balanced. I also had the pork belly, again a 1st but won't be a last. It again was tender and juicy and the small side picked vegetables was a perfect complement. So now you ask if it was so great why doesn't get five stars well truth be told you go to Vegas for really good food but on the cheap I found the Cleo was slightly pricey. For these two items to be on the appetizer menu they should've been well under $10 instead they're priced during happy hour mind you like the cost of a full meal. For those who will disagree and say it's not a fast food joint so expect to pay more. Wrong answer! I found these items for 1/3 the cost at other high end places. The Old Fashion was made to perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h9kOky3NFD8nstCRx6P5-g.text: Favorite go to place for tapas and awesome cocktails! Food is fantastic, service is even better!

W7GtrqDYrmQQ5UHk5ZxT1w.text: I chose this place to celebrate my birthday with some friends because of the good reviews and I have to say that this place was just alright. I guess it's because I had higher expectations of the restaurant in terms of food and decor based on the price and the reviews I read.   I ordered the lamb shawarma and the chicken tagine, but was able to try some other dishes (2 types of flat-breads, falafel, brussel sprouts, and this hash brown thing with apple sauce) that my friends ordered.   My favorite dish would be the chicken tagine because the spices used with the rice was really good and it really imparted a nice fragrance for the dish. The chicken itself was good, but nothing special or memorable for me personally. This was one of the few dishes where I can see the price being justified at $18-19. I was also surprised at how good the brussel sprouts were! I expected it to be plain, but it was quite delicious and flavorful.   I was kind of irked that my lamb shawarma had this tough piece in it (I couldn't chew it). I think it was cartilage, but I didn't look at it since it was already in my mouth and it would have been pretty rude to just place it on my plate lol. If someone is going to pay $9-10 for a small dish, I would expect it to be pretty darn good. Flavor-wise it was good, but I wasn't amazed.   The falafel was really crispy on the outside which was nice, but once you bit into it, there inside was pretty bland. That was really anti-climatic for me because I have had falafels before at school events, and despite being soggy, they at least had more flavor on the inside.   Overall, I would not recommend this place unless you are in the area and had a strong craving for Mediterranean food (and are lazy to drive to another place). I would take the other reviews with a grain of salt because I would say this place is a typical Vegas restaurant with overpriced menu items, which for the most part are moderate in terms of flavor and quality. There are some delicious dishes, but it just sucks that the majority is just not up to par with the prices you have to pay for them.

Personally I feel $29 for 3 tiny kabobs and a side of rice is crazy....wouldn't mind if that was enough to eat. Service was slow. Even though the food was really good we won't go back anytime soon. Too expensive for what you get.

It is a tapas place so the portions are smaller, but what it lacks in size it makes up in flavor! We ordered 3 dips and some dumplings and    lamb. Wowowow. We then split a toffee pudding for dessert and then we had to walk all the way back to our hotel down the strip. q9Vc-MCEQuwFI3uw_lCrZg.text: Cleo stood out when I was looking for a nicer somewhat more upscale dinning place for a fast birthday dinner. We made a reservation through open table for 645 for two, and when we got there the place was pretty empty.   The hostess is the reason why I gave this place a 4 star, there were probably 4 tables taken in the restaurant and she sat us right by the entrance in a small table. When we asked for a table towards the back for more privacy she gave us the unwilling look, and the other employee saw her and gave her that same face back like "they are one of those customers type of looks".   The server recommended about 4-5 dishes to share for two people.   We got the babaganoush with the pita bread, calamari and Brussel sprouts to start. The pita bread is fresh out of oven very soft and chewy, definitely one of the best pita breads I have had.   The calamari was delicious too, the sauce goes great with the calamari.  It is a must try. Brussel sprouts is my favorite food already, the way they fried the sprouts really brought out the flavor and the texture of it.  The second round we got the moussakah,  wagyu beef and chicken kabob, the chicken kabob was ok, but the beef one was very tender and juicy.  If I had to pick a favorite it would be the sprouts and least favorite would be the moussakah, it was baked and tasted very creamy.   The dessert was fig and almond panacotta. The figs we got were dried figs, weren't  fresh like shown in some of the pictures on here, but the panacotta itself was delicious.  The GM also stopped by personally to check on us. Great food place to check out if you want quick upscale food

MCZhZ38TTrc6-XCVuWd6Iw.text: Talk about an experience. WOWZERS. Cleo is a MUST FUCKING TASTE. Ok, check this out. Open wide....Randall and I showed up totally unannounced. No ressys, right? And Spencer, the General Manager greets us with a firm, hospitable handshake and a table right next to the brick oven. Randall and I specified that we are dedicated vegans. We were presented with a special vegan menu with 8 items. We ordered 7 of them. The flash fried Brussel Sprouts knocked my tiny little under amor socks out into the casino. The hummus was bomb. The eggplant looked like some retirement home shit. The falafel balls reminded me of cake pops. A mushroom dish of unknown origin arrived. Pretty sure it was compliments of the chef, but Randall paid for it anyway because he's a fucking moron. I consumed two drinks. The Cucumber Smash and the Get Smashed. Don't think that's what the second one was called but it was strong.

RBB6osfQDP4tUZH7jy66Cg.text: Great healthy Mediterranean food. Great service and atmosphere. Meat selection was only ok. I'd skip it next time. Focus on everything else they got. And make sure to ask for Turkish coffee.

xKocHNjQ9WKFX3CVWlyFsg.text: I am not an expert in middle eastern or Mediterranean food but places like this make me wish I was.   The atmosphere was just fine for a Vegas off-the-casino-floor place.  The food was excellent. I just wish I knew more. My lamb shawarma was as good as advertised. My wife loved the Brussels sprout leaves. Several other dishes were really really good.  Although I've not been to that many, this would have to be my top spot for upscale middle eastern food.  Smiley face.

7oocyZI-RQYp6BqWWtEnFw.text: Delicious food, beautiful decor, and a really accommodating and efficient staff. Everything we ordered was amazing, I can't even begin to describe how flavorful the Brussel sprouts are.  Also I wanted to note that we told our server that we had a show to catch and were in a rush, they were amazing and super quick.  Now that we are leaving Vegas I can say with all certainty that our favorite meal was had here.

c-rpeqii4vKS4XlOg3sVZw.text: What a great place, the best Mediterranean food we have ever had.  Thank God to the cab driver who recommended the place.  Food was excellent, amazing service!  The Hummus, the brussel sprouts, the chicken and lamb kebab was all excellent.  Can't wait to go back to Vegas and eat there again.   Thank you Angel and Rahel for the amazing service!!!!

GkznxN5NHQaaG_V4QHEXdQ.text: I was so nervous to try this place out but it was so freakin good! The prices there are great and the food is fabulous! My fav tapas Vegas ! When I come back I def will be here. My fav thing I ordered was the octopus here and wow so flavorful .

D2kGGi5dAg7PdmpTGhbGAg.text: Went there for Restaurant Week 2017. Tried every item on the menu. I cannot believe how amazing everything was. The service was perfect, food was amazing, and drinks were perfect. My favorite picks:  -Brussel Sprouts (hands down the best I've ever had and I'd go back just for it!) -hanger steak (juicy and flavorful. The sauce was perfect) -bread and dips (I could have just those and be happy) -try the mojito! -sticky toffee pudding (I usually don't like desserts, but I was in heaven with this)  I'll definitely be back to try the regular menu items! The $40 per person Restaurant week menu was such an amazing deal!

xfvG9AR5_kGD_SkM1Y6hDQ.text: We went again and REALLY loved the food. Although we aren't crazy about having to scream at each other through all the noise in the restaurant... That is the nature of the restaurant and our particular preference shouldn't get in the way of their five stars. Amazing cocktails and the bartender was so knowledgeable and made us feel right at home! Loved it!

lDX7TJ-_vuQUJyZsH339Sg.text: We chose this restaurant almost blindly, no one in our group had been here and all we wanted was a very different dining experience. Let me tell you, we got that and so much more. Instead of ordering one entree per person, you order several dishes between your group and share everything, which gives you a much better idea of the menu as you go through your dining journey. The brussel sprouts came incredibly recommended by our server, and if you're not a fan I beg you try them here. They're crisp and full of flavor and reminiscent of salt and vinegar chips! The roasted lamb is also noteworthy - the most tender, juicy lamb I've ever eaten. And the Moroccan fried chicken was so crisp and light and the apricot mustard that came on the side was so sweet and tangy and to die for. We came for a birthday, and they surprised us with the lightest most delicious toffee pudding cake for our celebration. And on top of everything, I was so surprised how small our check was once we'd finished. Between four people, we spent just more than $100 when we were anticipating so much more - it is absolutely worth every penny. The service was incredible, prompt, and so friendly. We came at a slower hour, but don't hesitate to make reservations if you're unsure. Cleo is definitely a stop you want to make while you stay in Vegas.

xPAE0fo449jaTMIocFS4iA.text: We had 3 people and ordered about 7 dishes which are tapas style. Must order the flatbread ($5) which I dont think it's individually listed on the menu. If you order the dips or hummus, the flatbread comes with it.   Meatball Tagine ($13) - comes with about 6 meatballs? Nothing special, but meatballs in a bowl of tomatoe sauce. It was good, but not worth ordering.  Lamb Shawarma - lamb skewer which was slow roasted with spices. It was very delicious and flavorful! Must try!  Grilled Octopus - with celery, potatoe, lemon vinaigrette - just medium cooked and flavorly  Garlic shrimp with gigante beans, castelvetrano, and preserved lemon - one of my favorite dish! Probably comes with about 12 shrimps. Not your typical garlic shrimp, the sauce and the seasoning was different, but very good.   Quinoa and roasted vegetable salad with spiced almond and cumin - Good salad, but portion is small.   Denison sausage - not too salty and the order comes with one sausage that you can cut up.   Overall, this mediterrean restaurant has a balance of flavor (not overwhelming with seasoning like most mediterreanean food). Each dish is about $10 to $15 which could be shared. I enjoy sampling the variety of diffferent dishes. It doesnt seem like a lot of food, but it was filling.

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lamb kabob, vennison sausage, garlic shrimp

9qwZEV51FIzoGWyUqHEacw.text: Went a few days a go and loved the ambiance, the service and the food. Tried their hummus and beet salad was very good. Got the guts to try their Fried Octupus for the first time and it was amazing the seasoning and the sauce they had on it was very flavorful and the texture wasnt weird like I thought it was going to be. It looked very pretty which made it more apealing to eat. It has an open kitchen so you can smell the aromas from the cooking. The dishes are not huge more tapas style like to share but just enough to fill you up with a just a few orders. Prices  are reasonable. Great place for a date, pre-game before a night out, or with a group of girlfriends!

i4oGLc99WFcMQN9Xq1999A.text: The food was super tasty. We had the  garlic shrimp, grilled octopus, brussels sprout hearts and the laffa.  Can't beat the  taste of the Mediterranean tapas served here. This is a restaurant to come back any time! Service was also first class as expected from this type of establishment.
