kdSeZS2Qab0SI_SHvM3tuQ.text: Coming to this spot was a recommendation from our bartender Justin at the W. My partner lovessss lamb chops and this place can SLAY some damn chops! Everything we had was delicious; chicken kabobs, Brussels sprouts were banging! And we had the kale flat bread...so good!

B_9rNIVVH2BNVjoryFa6VA.text: We enjoyed ourselves here.   We had a vegetarian in the group and this menu was VERY vegetarian friendly.     We had the most popular items on the menu and everything was tasty.   We has the pickles on a lark, and we're super impressed - best hidden gem on a menu ever!!!

So4KhTla_aVKZd3G33LvqA.text: The food's good it's just.... weird... its tapa  (could have spelled it wrong) style, which means the food costs a lot and you only get 1/7 of what you thought you ordered, enabling the staff to encourage you to get a second entree. The menu is very pretentious and confusing but the staff was nice! Probably won't seek the place out again when I come back to Vegas.

t-NFjueFV_uvOENfRUvsGA.text: After the craziness of the rock n roll las vegas 5k, my friend suggested Cleo in the SLS, which was just across from the race course.  We made reservations prior and were seated after checking in.   Ambiance was nice, a sense of adventure with books and globes stacked along the ceiling walls.  Feels as if we were exploring an old mysterious passageway in Egypt and a booby trap can be activated at any time...  Food was amazing, strong flavors and characteristics: - hummus with bread:  bread was warm, soft, and delicious.  came in a paper bag, which was very clever and fun. -burrata and heirloom tomatoes:  so simple yet so tasty.  tomatoes were perfectly riped and sweet with the creaminess of the burrata.  topped with arugula for some bittiness.     -chicken kabob: super moist and tender chicken breast on a metal skewer -mushroom: very earthy and a tad sweet with great textures.  the mushrooms were meaty and delicious.  the pop came from the rice puffs and chopped hazelnuts.  -scallops: packed with flavors for such a simple scallop.  scallops were not overcooked.  sat on a bed of red pepper paste and topped with frisee salad and capers. -roasted lamb with couscous and yogurt: the least favorite dish of the night, but was still decent.  lamb was a bit bland and not as tender as I expected.  It was a bit too dry, since there was no sauce on it.  the thick yogurt on the bottom did not help with the moisture but gave it a creamy tart flavor.  couscous was pretty bland. -sticky toffee pudding with walnut brittle:  soft cake with crunchy brittle, creamy vanilla ice cream, and side of caramel sauce.  good way to end the meal.  service lacked some smiles and comfort, but with good company and food, I can brush that aside.  overall great food, ambiance and company.  definitely worth a trek away from the main strip of las vegas to the SLS for cleo.

ixTQPlmiroVByhLezEDejQ.text: I know the star rating was 4.5 at the time I went but I really did not believe that I would be following suit.  Located in the SLS right on the casino floor and getting a table right at the front I thought I would hate this experience because of seating location.  The good thing I guess was casino was empty and the table game right there did not have anyone playing.  The host sat us down and I asked her what does she like, she said the lamb hawarma but cautioned it is small...in my head in like it is tapas place mostly everything is small.   The waiter came by and mentioned to use the tasting menu is a great way to go. I think there were two options one for 65pp or 45pp.  It looked good but I wanted freedom to try whatever would wanted so we passed.  He also mentioned the lamb  shawarma as his favorite item so we got that, falafel, 3 kebabs (2 chicken, pork belly) with saffron rice, mushroom Flatbread.  Falafel was mainly for the wife because I only like it one particular place in NY.   Kebabs were great. Chicken came still on the skewers and the pork belly was just on the place. Pork Belly was my 2nd favorite item. The top had a nice crunch and under had a great meat to fat ratio that created juicy gelatin explosion of flavor in my mouth. I really enjoy the rice too.   The lamb shawarma was small. The moist, flavorful lamb fill to the max in a tiny pita (that sounds funny).  S*** this was so good, amazingly good, the level of goodness can't really be described. This was literally one of the best things I have ever eaten in life. I could order 3 of these and just have it as a meal and be completely satisfied, probably have a heart attack when I was finished though.  This is a must have item imo if you visit Cleo.    The Flatbread came last and at this point we were pretty full and I was lamb shawarma drunk so I really don't remember the taste of it.   We had a very cocktails that were made nicely as well.  Wait staff was great on service and being attentive to us. One thing that did annoy me though was the uniform of the ladies on the wait staff.  The women wore these open bow tie with their white shirts...it looks disheveled.  Hopefully it can survive the horrible location that the SLS currently has when more projects are completed up north

rej1cYp0LZfAe-tQILVV1g.text: I had greek salad, chicken tagine, falaful(?),mushroom flatbread. I was so full. I thought everything tasted very good. The ambiance in there was amazing. The restaurant features are beautiful and lighting is great. Great tapas restaurant!

FhWK_MAVwAiEqucK_aUUqA.text: I hAvent had the opportunity to dine there for I can not comment on the food and customer service.  I had a reservation mAde 24 hours before, when we got there the hostess told us that she was not able to offer us any table anymore as their capacity was full.  Extremely disappointed because we had a reservation and we're delighted to meet our friends, we had done our hair / make up at the salon, put on a beautiful outfit on. You just don't do that to people.  At 9 it was hard to find another place in Vegas inside a hotel that we're gonna take us.  It's a shame.

zrMiKINvKM9lzcAkaStYcQ.text: Food is SO TASTY I don't think you can order a bad menu item. Definitely a spot to share dishes to get a full taste of what they off.

EapGTMINBlGCWsdJYyxrEQ.text: This was a big nice surprise, the Potato appetizers were great, the Labneh app was also amazing. We loved the environment, our service was awesome and speedy, great food and great place to visit.   The Grilled kabob (Chicken adn Kafta) were awesome. Bold flavors, very tasty and well worth the experience  The best thing was the dessert. the mahalabeya was simply out of the world.    Super place.

W26yO2atp1LBvFUG_80kPw.text: Went to Cleo for my birthday last week and honestly had the greatest time. Service was top notch and the food was sooooo delicious.   We all decided to do the $45 tasting menu which was served family style and they definitely did not skimp on food for our group. There was more than enough for everyone and I'm a big boy.   First, the hummus. Super delicious, full of flavor and we opted for the yogurt and cucumbers as well which was a smart choice. Lots and lots of hot, fresh bed to indulge with.   Second, the cauliflower. I don't think I've ever tasted a vegetable that was so damn tasty. It was cooked perfectly, with a little hint of cumin. Definitely suggest it!  The garlic shrimp and hanger steak was next. Steak was tasty, but the shrimp is cray. Lots of flavor just don't plan on macking on your date afterwards because it's full of garlic flavor.   Chopped salad was unlike any salad I've had before. Super tasty.   Lastly, the desert. Sticky. Toffee. Pudding. Definitely ended the dinner on a delicious sweet note.   What was very impressive was that they split the bill for 13 of us with ease, which you don't find to be easy at a restaurant of this caliber. If the tasting menu is not available I would still recommend any of the items listed. You will not be disappointed!!

yXCDAZVSgwvudSX4dM2stA.text: Good food, good service ! I was just a bit overwhelmed that some of the dishes were over seasoned . Too strong! But overall , was ok !

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus

vg_yMfD2wqZpITDgzeCU-g.text: We dined here and really enjoyed all the dishes. Everything is super delicious, and because of their extensive menu, it's probably best to order several dishes and share, tapas style/family style. Loved the Hummus, Flat Bread, Grilled octopus, Meatball,  and Scallops!  The ambiance itself is super cute..had a very Greek/Mediterranean feel inside! Darkly lit room..makes Cleo the perfect spot for date night, although they are happy to accommodate large parties!  Make reservations at Cleo, it's definitely the most popular restaurant within the SLS hotel!

k3JlOfcLPnAXjn68XPCsfw.text: I didn't like the service and attitude of everyone at this place.  I have been to Cleo's in LA and the Ambience , Food and service was 1000 times better.

0yh3Il-V82l6gvHTmNVq6w.text: This is essentially a high end Mediterranean tapas restaurant. Small portions, Strip prices (most dishes range from $7-$16). I was a little skeptical about it, but I will say that everything was very delicious and well done. Our server was a tad bit too casual for my taste (I have a bit of an issue when servers sit down next to me to take my order), but she was very personable, friendly, and checked on us often.  The decor was very sexy, and would be perfect for a date night. Just dim enough to feel romantic, and very sophisticated.   We ordered: Garlic Shrimp, Grilled Octopus, Hanger Steak, and a lamb dish whose name escapes me. They were all delicious and perfectly cooked. Our cocktails ($14) were also delicious. Now, 4 dishes between 2 people totaled just under $100, which did sting a little bit.. You're not going to be full, especially if you go and you're very hungry. But if you're not starving, you'll be pretty satisfied.  A solid choice.

FULUKhpr9VboAGgP9raPLw.text: The lamb shawarma and spicy cigars are really good. Good service. Atmosphere a little underwhelming for Las Vegas.

DdyJTE3Eup3SvTQAKypUsQ.text: Loved my experience here! Went with a friend to celebrate our birthday month & everything was perfect. From the hostess to being seated, to the server, cocktails, food, service!!! I'm definitely returning back!

SoWloY0rXPkFUXQ7Mm1mkg.text: Took uber from Venetian to dine here. I hope that's explains it all.  Not enough characters to post)) so, when I want mediterranean in Vegas, I go to Cleo. (Maybe smell of SLS and memories have something to do with it as well)   Anyway, good food, good service and reasonable pricing.

Rvf1cyIRAYvsIS1FSu7BjA.text: The small plates are amazing here. Sausages from a number of different countries, fantastic dips, warm seasoned delicious flat bread, Sonoma lamb, incredible scallops, what a great place.  It has an open kitchen, nice ambience, and a good wait staff that is knowledgeable about the food.  The prices are such that you can have something really good and not break the bank. We tried all sorts of goodies with wine, coffee, and desserts and still got by for $100 for two of us. I'm a fan.

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing scallops.

FvF_aKLIG2LCqEsXA-fYfg.text: Cleo is an outstanding restaurant in the trendy, sophisticated SLS hotel. I received a $40 food credit and thought, why not check this place out? Firstly, the ambiance here is so adorable. From the chandeliers to the silverware, everything in this restaurant gave me a warm Aladdin-esque feel. We were seated in a little private section with drapes all around to give it an essence of seclusion.  We were a group of 5 girls and stuck to the mezzes. We had to order two rounds of the grilled octopus topped with fennel with a garlic cream sauce.. it was outstanding! Just enough of a smokey taste but it was still soft inside. We also ordered two plates of the brussel sprouts. They were a bit on the oily side but I loved how they were decomposed and shaved, which gave it more of a crunch and flakiness after they were baked/fried. We had the falafel, beet salad, lamb and chicken kebab, hummus, chicken liver, and the Turkish salad. We loved every bite of every plate.  Keep in mind, the plates are small and they are all family style. They bring the food as its made, so they come out individually.  For dessert, we had the sticky toffee pudding with Turkish coffee. The coffee is made with sugar, which would have been nice to have known prior to ordering. Regardless, it was a decent shot of coffee. The toffee pudding was good but not memorable.  The service was quick and friendly. All of the waiters had a smile on their face and were eager to fill our glasses with water. I am glad I tried this restaurant and am looking forward to trying their other location in Los Angeles!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely plates
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkish coffee
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee pudding

0F-DqYVa9iy7bswVuoGsaA.text: My husband and I decided on a quiet Christmas and this weekend we took each other out to two surprise dinners. Tonight I took him to see SLS and its interesting historic references, the video Center Bar, the giant kaleidoscope, the carpets, chandeliers and Monkey Bar. Cleo was good- we shared the wonderful spicy potatoes with cilantro, the flavorful chicken kebabs, the roast lamb which was very tender, and raw oysters. We had the bakhlave and the hot apple cinnamon tart with vanilla gelato. Servers were really helpful. One craft beer and one riesling later we paid about $128.00. We liked the ambience although the location means the music from the casino area pushes its way in. All in all a very enjoyable meal!

Huv9MY-uIZzk-WT_OY8LMA.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas and I'm never disappointed! Love the new happy hour from 5-7:00...what a great deal! Jessica is a great server and had lots of great recommendations. Can't wait to come get more Brussels sprouts soon!

rWfjFKA3P2KkM6Lk_AZ5ew.text: I had two friends staying at the SLS so once it came to dinner time we walked around looking for a place to eat. Because it was late and in the middle of the week most places were closed so we settled on Cleo and I am very happy we did! This place was a wonderful surprise. I have to say I wasn't expecting much which is probably what made the experience even that much better. The variety and quality of the small plates was wonderful.   By far, my favorite dish was the lamb tartar. I had never had lamb tartar before so I don't have anything to compare it to but it really blew me away and I have been telling people about it ever since. The three of us ordered a number of small plates because we wanted to try it all. What really stands out to me (aside from the lamb tartar) was the pork belly, falafel, brussels sprouts. and definitely the grilled octopus. I am always hesitant ordering octopus, even though it's one of my favorite foods, because of the way some places cook it. Cleo served a perfectly tender octopus dish that definitely surpassed my expectations.   Not expecting much from this place I was pleasantly surprised. I can't wait to try it again with my now high expectations.

JIhCRcJYBw8TuiGCYLl9rA.text: Nice place  Unique music and food was good  Can't give them five stars because of the price

xhKRy2GvrDvN_Y7MWqHrHg.text: Everything we ate here was amazing!  The Brussels sprouts leaves were incredible!  We got the pick 3 dips with laffa bread - babaganoush, humus, and yogurt with cucumbers.  We also got the shrimp, steak and chicken kebabs.  There were 4 of us and we shared it all.  Highly recommend this restaurant!

XreT06AbRC0xb24R-iXFvQ.text: Great food, strange atmosphere and slow service and WAY off the beaten path.  I love small plate dining, and the selection and tastes did not disapoint. Everything was delish. The atmosphere of the dining room is odd. felt more like a cafeteria than a fine dining establishmnet. Lots of tables located too close to one another. Also the place was too lit up and bright in my opinion. It was obvious our waitress was new, took a while to come around and take drink orders and did not seem she had knowledge of many of the items on the menu. Also there was no timing to the spacing of the course we ordered. Our first course of small plates came out there there was a 15 minute gap after we were done with our first plates before the second plates came out. Then once the second round arrived we were not more than one or two bites in before our third course hit the table.   Summary: All in all the food quality was great, Cleo had only been open a couple weeks so maybe they were just working through some kinks. Straighten out the atmosphere of the dining room and train your servers a little better and this could be a 5-star experience.

NYaFYFsLlKZ7OTDy8x19JA.text: Made an 8:30 reservation on a Tuesday evening and got seated right on time. The restaurant was not busy at all. My guest and I waited at our table for a few min before the server greeted us. Her name was Jessica. Few min go by and she returns with our water, having to make a second trip for the lemon we requested with our water.  By now, my guest and I realize how careless our server is.  So she takes our order and our food come out in a timely manner. Food was phenomenal!!! Especially the spicy cigars. But the lamb shawarma was by far the best I've ever tasted! Highly recommend the shawarma.   I would've been happy to give five stars to Cleo if the service wasn't so terrible.  Our server had us waiting on her! So irritating. It was an hour before closing time, there was one other table in our section and we waited more than a few min for our server to cash out our check.  I would like to go back and give this place another chance, but next time I'll know who to avoid waiting on me.

meYDIZ8Uh_vWwyXkshSJZQ.text: Went to Cleo for date night and my expectations were surpassed. Our server, Janice, was amazing! I really appreciate her knowledge of the menu and recommendations.  The cocktails are unique but delicious. The Brussels are surprisingly addictive.  Overall a very fun and tasty evening!

wZ_a4EC_l3A49gIQ4lwSlw.text: Lovely service; clean, fresh food; perfect amount of choice in the menu; a great way to eat a gourmet meal on the strip without feeling gross at the end or breaking the bank.

BnAhsY1ecYuSOTT3MxLYLg.text: I consider Cleo to be a hidden gem inside of the SLS Las Vegas, located on the Northside of the strip. It is a contemporary tapas style, Mediterranean cuisine with seasonal shared plates, mezzes, and flatbreads. Dishes are fresh, flavorful and beautifully presented. The menu accommodates all kinds of eating restrictions such as, kosher style, gluten free, vegan, etc. There honestly isn't one bad dish on the menu.   The restaurant has a selection of handcrafted cocktails and unique wine that are pretty spectacular. I recommend trying Lotus Flower and Mediterranean Margarita. As for dishes, The Hummus, Brussels Sprouts, Hazelnut Mushrooms and Grilled Haloumi Salad are some of my favorites. The Merguez Flatbread, Prawns with garlic, dumplings is also recommendable.   Happy Dinning!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dishes at Cleo are colorful and beautifully presented.

K7fysyaEKMPtroiU91S98g.text: Cleo is at my top 3 places that I recommend going to eat in Vegas. The tapa style entrees are masterfully executed and extremely memorable. I am salivating at the thought of the meals we had here several weeks ago...  The tapa style experience allows you to not fully commit to just enjoying solely one meal, but rather sharing many flavors with the company of others.  I recommend getting in-house bread - I later wished that I had asked for some to-go - alongside some of the dips. I enjoyed the hummus, babaganoush, and shawarma the most. The shawarma was extremely flavorful and not really intended for sharing (unless you are okay with sharing a bite). I was extremely pleased with it.  For dessert, at the recommendation of our waitress, we enjoyed a creme brulee. I encourage you to do the same when you visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toffee pudding with gelato.. absolutely amazing!!

rcu4tUhdCCbtrR4g85zXsw.text: Our waiter Manny was super cute and provided great service.  We arrived at around 6:30 on a Thursday. The place was empty.  We ordered a bunch of stuff to share including (since it was before 7pm we could order some of the super reasonably priced items off the happy hour menu):  - Spinach & Ricotta dumplings (our least favorite of the night) - Babaganoush - a platter of skewers (pork belly, kofta & waygu) - A happy hour flat bread with olives - Flash fried brussels spouts (leaves) - Scallops  All of it was very good, and a reasonable price for Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 skewer platter, pork belly, kafta, and waygu.
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dumplings. Meh.

_5aSagTEMWKE77CqVqvz-A.text: Wow what an experience I had last night. It was my partner and Is anniversary and we decided to make reservations here because my last time here was so good I NEEDED to go back.   I was greeted for my 6:00 reservation by the manager Spencer at the host stand. He took us to our table and made some really good recommendations for us that we defiantly ordered. When the manager says something is good you usually get it. Spencer started us with some water while our server Jessica (I believe her name was, super sweet blonde) started us off with some great wine. We told her we like new Zealand Sauvignon blancs and she paired us with two amazing wines according to our flavor profile.  My meal was over the top amazing. The best part about this place is that it's Tapas style but the portions are hearty and actually filling compared to other places.  Cucumber dip- great starter with their warm bread they serve. The dip has cucumbers and dill in it. Just spread in on the bread and it's a perfect starter(4/5)  Spinach and Ricotta Dumpling-  not your normal "pan fried dumpling" these babies are soft and prepared for over 4 days just to be perfect. Literally melts in your mouth. Served over a pesto sauce that was amazing!!!! (5/5)  The garlic shrimp- I literally have this all the time. It's my favorite dish. (5/5) just get it if you love shrimp.  We had so much food that wasn't mentioned, the thought of dessert scared me I might have popped.  I truly want to thank Spencer, Jessica and even the busser staff for making my experience memorable. We felt welcomed, and super appreciated. Everyone gave us attention and that's how you put on an optimal 5 star dining experience. I'll be back...AGAIN cleo!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BONE MARROW LITERALLY TASTED LIKE BUTTER
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pisole
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic shrimp

2ylz93ra7r8t_7TPmBQ31Q.text: This will be my third time to Cleo. I came for Restaurant Week as some of the things on the menu were things I haven't tried yet and you couldn't beat the price. I am just in love with the labaneh. It's extra extra extra garlicky though so if you have a hot date I would caution against it if not or if you're both eating it,  then you're good to go and I wouldn't skip it.    The other standout for me was the brussel sprouts. Wow crispy slightly spicy flavored just perfectly an amazing addition to any meal here!   The venue is sexy the service is outstanding and the cocktails are on fleek!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour Menu!!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fig and almond panna cotta with a tawny port
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Labaneh (sp?) And a great 2012 Faust.

TRl0f1BiIgRxcz1YaoytTA.text: Ok, so hubby and I came and order a few things. Amongst that order we had "oysters --Chile-lime Mignonette, Granite" for $18 (mind you it's raw and only four singles small bites!) Four isn't enough when you are a hungry guerrilla! The portions are extremely small and you can have better luck eating at a hole in the wall establishment than this place! Sorry just don't bring your large family here when you are ready to get down--if you know what I mean?

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G0m8nzs7OiOkdqjL4Pt9kQ.text: We went to a lot of restaurants while we visited Las Vegas and hands down this one was the best. Service was great I mentioned I can't have dairy and he tried really hard to see what dessert they have available. My husband has the lamb and said it was the best he has ever had. The bread hummus falafel was super yummy. Great decor and loved the character of the restaurant. I am also Armenian so I am picky about Mediterranean food. This is one of the best I've had. We will be back.

KgIVS4xZGQ7dRMdy-GzkaA.text: This is a beautiful restaurant in the SLS. We went late one evening and were sat immediately. We asked for one of the private booths in back and were accommodated with no issue.   We did the $65 tasting menu and it was so good!  Although it was small plates, we found it to be plenty of food and a good value.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KW3SzT7XODbBvxw0KU35Lg.text: Medeterrain tapas was a new experience for me. Cute trendy spot inside the SLS with a gypsy hyped theme. Definitely a lot to admire and look at as far as motif.   Greeted graciously by the hostess and seated within a few minutes started our night off right. We were greeted soon after by our server who took our drink orders and suggested a few items as well as how many plates he thought would suffice since our party was a bit larger. Everything is served tapas style and meant to be shared by the table. We ended up ordering about 18 plates (some the same but multiple orders).  Our drinks came and very soon after our food started to arrive, one right after the other. The pace of the food was super fast. From a group who likes to sit and enjoy the food, while ordering mutiple drinks...we only had time to really drink one drink. That's how fast the food came out. Honestly, for a nicer restaurant if they paced the delivery of the food better, patrons would be permitted the time to order more drinks. Which would increase the overall check. Also it would allow people to actually enjoy the food vs scarfing it down.  The food itself was pretty good. I definitely recommend the brussel sprouts, lamb chops, bone marrow (heads up it is very fatty and oily, but good) and shishito peppers.  The various types of hummus they offer are worth a try too because the bread they give along with it is delicious!  Now to be fair, I have never had Mediterranean food before so I don't have much else to compare to but the cost seemed really high for the little amount of food you received.   Our sever was really friendly and personable however so he made our overall experience pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6ZVoDv0GK16Pc6C52izsZw.text: Came here with 3 other people and did the tasting menu. The atmosphere and venue are great, but the music just didn't seem to fit. It was a Mediterranean restaurant with pop music playing, it felt a bit awkward and out of place.  The service was great as the food showed up when it was ready. The highlight was their house bread which is freshly baked in their oven! We got many courses, the non meat came in abundance. Most of the meat beside the octopus were fairly small portions which was a bit disappointing ( reason for 4 stars and not higher).  Most of the food was flavourful and cooked really well. There was a lot of variety so the tasting menu was great !   My favourites were the octopus, cigars, the lamb, and the bread. I'm a huge meat lover as you can see.  The desert in the end was amazing as well. We got one flourless chocolate cake (it was like a lava cake with melted chocolate inside) and the coffee cake. We really enjoyed both the deserts!  Overall great place and experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

djMzB7kj2BXApQYMAKpTRw.text: If you're looking for a delicious Mediterranean place, in Las Vegas, this is it!   Ambiance: Mediterranean-semi casual (casual if you're looking for a date night)  beautiful decor, comfortable seating throughout.   Seating: good for small parties of two up to large parties. Indoor seating only (this place is in a casino)  Service: Excellent!!! Glasses were always full, empty plates were cleaned off immediately. Table was professionally cleared off for each course.   Menu: a scrumptious selection of Mediterranean inspired dishes. Mouth watering and cooked to perfection. My husband and I ordered all the happy hour small plates and we were NOT disappointed!!!  Snag a glass of wine, your BFF and grab a comfy seat, but make sure you bring your appetite too! If you're a foodie like me, you'll have a hard time picking just one dish to sink your teeth into.

MpxE0cV2IH20JjRVa2LsXw.text: Dined at Cleo with another couple and we all LOVED it! Truly spectacular food and wonderful service (special shoutout to our amazing server Manny!!) Chef T came out to greet us- so nice and so talented! We all agreed to come back the next time we're in Vegas. The photos I posted are just a few of the dishes we tried. I love being able to sample so many things on a menu- especially when it's all so delicious. Definitely give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Octopus
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms- SO GOOD!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Labneh and Hummus

MHCptm_z0nHqCrZt9QUhSg.text: Very slow service but they are friendly and helpful. Place is very nice and has good atmosphere. But don't bring your phone - no signal inside! Drinks were good but expensive and took forever to be made! Food was hit or miss. Loved most but the falafel balls were a return - dry and tasteless. The sliders, Greek salad, octopus and scallops were delicious. Egg plant salad was average. Too expensive to be average.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Falafel balls - do not order!! Dry and tasteless
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops delicious

AdQ0TO21lwC_TH0WtRKlbQ.text: Great place to have a nice NYE dinner with friend.  The brussel sprouts and garlic shrimp were amazing.  The beet salad was also a hit.  Drinks took a little while to brought to the table after ordering.

3sIqcxK17GisHaPtF24Dpw.text: Food was very good. If anything, a little expensive for the size of the plates. We got pork belly, hangar steak, Brussels sprouts, Greek salad, cauliflower, octopus, potatoes, and branzino. Favorites were the octopus (poor value though), cauliflower, and the meats.

a9pGOyHFMpW_j4aA9cdt0w.text: Service, food and atmosphere were all on point!  I was delightfully surprised to find this gem in the SLS casino. The servers handled our group of 60 with grace and apparent ease, no small task! Their gluten-free selection was impressive, and they made sure to inform the kitchen of my needs. I was impressed with the hangar steak, roasted Brussels sprouts, and the chicken tangine (although I would question if a real tangine is used). I would definitely return next time I'm visiting LV.

ifIlGZFHESnPOwjydybTGw.text: This is a great place for mediterranean tappas.  I loved the octopus and fried chicken.  I will be going back there again tonight to try other items on the menu.  The bone marrow was delicious, nicely seasoned with a great sauce that you can dip bread into.

jz5d3nxnbFR4g61CTlr4HQ.text: If you are craving some Mediterranean food and are tired of the same old food that you'd find on the strip, Cleo is a great alternative. The dishes are reminiscent of tapas style dishes. I only ordered two dishes, but I could have easily eaten a couple more.   To start, I had a glass of their Duval on tap, which is a Belgian beer. It was really crisp and delicious. I ordered their Wagyu Beef Skewer as recommended by a manager. It was quite very tender and tantalizing to the tongue. At this moment, I realized that I probably should have ordered their combination of kebabs with rice because it was that good, but another dish that seemed to be touted by their manager was their grilled octopus. Apparently, this particular dish was featured in Las Vegas weekly recently. However, I was truly disappointed in their grilled octopus. Although the presentation was quite nice with its variation of color, the octopus was cold and lacked texture and taste. The octopus was bland.  Overall, the dining experience was excellent. I was somewhat envious of the large family that sat in the communal table at the front of the restaurant. It is a great area for a large group to gather, something to keep in mind for my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really enjoyed the Duvel on tap
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Octopus

9i6pkg-AMvqxVvFYI0pAGA.text: Definitely stop by.   I was there for happy hour.   Brussels sprouts....NOT WORTH IT. It's more like Brussels sprouts chips. For $9, you deserve about 15pieces or more. Rather, they take about three pieces, peel the layers and fry them. Rip-off!!  Flat bread...very thin and light. I enjoyed it. THEY NO LONGER serve the kale flat bread.   The service was excellent!!

YIA51MlfH_Z9sLaj_a_N2Q.text: Just awful!!! Went in with high hopes well dressed.  Ordered grilled Calamari and it was cold and disgusting.  The Falafel also was dry and inedible.  Large price tag for horrible food.   Stay far far away

2ztQxS1aB5o1i5nHP3A0-g.text: After a long day of sight seeing we stopped in for Tapas. Amazing food! Our waitress Jessica made great recommendations and provided great service. The lamb Kebabs were delicious! It was an awesome end to our day.

2QJsRLvJGjCiyJfaS7MARw.text: This place it's a gem in its own the food is really good little expensive but worth it, I go here once a month that's how good it is ask for the kale chips it will blow your mine away

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gdg6WhE3ogGAsNKazlXoWQ.text: The food here is top of the line. We came for a girls weekend from Chicago. We are a little bit snobby when it comes to food because we have access to so many amazing restaurants.  Cleo has an open kitchen concept and the food is very fresh and authentic. I would recommend the hummus and waygu beef.

HfTcSL4Kql23H27T8rDlDA.text: Went with Canada to Cleo in the SLS hotel. Great restaurant and yummy food. The interior of the casino looks a bit industrial (lacking ambiance), and the restaurant looks right into it, but otherwise, atmosphere was good. Our server was awesome, attentive, informative. We ordered maybe 1-2 dishes too many - the server recommended 3/p.   Carrot Harissa (added veggie sticks)- really yummy, creamy. Waiter actually gave me the ingredients for it. Chopped salad - refreshing, tasty - but had a lot left Falafel - Yummy, moist, but the Tahini was SUPER salty - I would avoid or have them put on side instead of bottom of plate. Tasted like I was sucking on a salt cube.  Mushrooms - this dish was ok, a bit sweet with the balsamic cartelized (I think) and didn't 'wow' me. Lamb Tagine - loved this dish. Apricots were a very nice touch. Grilled Octopus - delicious. What really blew my mind was the shaved celery...yep, it was that good.   I would recommend & would most likely return.

oPEDAKb4Gdg52M9dr-NZsg.text: The place looks amazing the atmosphere also great the food looks better than it's tastes pricey,small portions ,the hummus taste bad with more lemon than tahini and not smooth as it's should be.the kabobs were good the rest 2.5 stars for food .if you from Middle East you know what I mean

lDBdrHALgwfAPEKUIzyTbg.text: Amazing! Chef T outdoes himself every time. Ask for his recommendations. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fvukxHufuMNAjYJjUvYrww.text: Visited Cleo's on my birthday based on Yelp reviews (despite needing to cab it there) and most of the food was outstanding.  The scallops (the accompanying salad was OUT OF THIS WORLD) and brussels sprouts were amazing; the garlic shrimp just so-so.  It was definitely a pricey excursion ($158 before tip for 2 of us to share bread with hummus and 4 small plates then each of us had 2 cocktails), but we left satisfied with the meal.  I really want to give 4.5 stars; would deduct .5 star for the hostess' demeanor and her trying to seat us near the kitchen when the restaurant was nearly empty.

eb54lW8eDwY0b9qkp9fOzQ.text: Wow. What a great find on the strip. SLS has a winner with this place. We did the Chef's Tasting Menu. Everything was outstanding! The Sticky Toffee was to die for and goes well with the Turkish Coffee.   Will definitely return to this place!

ppDhGJWVTs6iI9LmiIGvJg.text: Wow... Cleo for the win.    I came with a party of 8 last night. We ordered everything family-style so we could taste a bit of everything on the menu (spoiler alert: it's all delicious and I definitely recommend coming with a group to do the same). We ordered:   -The bread and dips (to die for) -Shishito peppers -Brussels sprouts (some of the best I've ever had... and I'm coming from L.A., where it's virtually impossible to find a restaurant that DOESN'T serve brussels, so that's saying a lot) -Kebabs (we ordered 3 different meats; the wagyu [beef] stole the show--they marinate it in Pepsi!) -Tuna tartare -Moussaka (stellar!) -Lamb (mouthwatering, comes with a delicious sauce over couscous with raisins/currants) -Grilled octopus (cooked to perfection) -Mushroom flatbread (flavor and texture like WOAH) -... and an embarrassingly wide selection of desserts (*cough, get the fig one and the apple one and the baklava one, cough cough*).  So yeah... basically a food dream.  Also worth mentioning: the waitstaff and restaurant manager were accommodating AF (and let's just say one of my party members is, ahem, particularly difficult to please) and really made for an incredible dining experience overall.   If you're in Vegas, definitely make it a point to eat at Cleo. I honestly would relive my entire business trip just to eat here again!

qqmsfagR5JdK7OdguIyC5w.text: My family and had an incredible meal at Cleo. Kind of place where you can spend $250 on dinner and not feel like you got ripped off. Probably the best restaurant I've ever been to in Vegas. The service was excellent, we got lucky and had a really nice private table near the front that closed off.   It can add up to being expensive. One tip, drink the tap water. The fizzy stuff is $9 per person. The drink specialties are expensive too. With water and drinks we had spend $90 before we even met our waiter.   It was a few weeks ago I was there. Unfortunately I can't remember the specific plates that we love, but 3-4 of them completely blew us away. I would go back to Cleo in a heartbeat if I was in town.

ucMz6kd8BpQa4tsbNJdxrQ.text: We stayed at the SLS over Christmas this year and I decided Cleo would be where we would enjoy Christmas dinner. I made reservations the morning of through Open Table and while all time slots showed as still available, was beyond pleased later, that we had done so.  We checked in with a bit of hassle, primarily because the restaurant opens directly on to the casino floor and there was only one hostess. We had to wait an additional 20 mins for our table and found it very awkward as we essentially were taking up a walkway around the casino floor.  We were seated at a table for two in the back of the restaurant. We enjoyed the decor and the cooking station in the center of the restaurant is a nice feature. I had read through the menu online and so already knew what to order. My husband wasn't familiar with Mediterranean food and so I nicely got ordering control after outlining dishes to him. The alcohol menu didn't match what we were looking for and so I ordered just a lemongrass lemonade after seeing it listed in a cocktail. This turned out to be a $7 drink, so watch out for that.  We started with the cucumber and yogurt (tzatziki essentially), spicy potatoes, and chicken kebab. The orders were nicely spaced out and we loved everything. The fresh pita was amazing as well, though served a bit too hot to touch. For an entree, we split the grilled hangar steak. This took about 20 minutes after our mezze's to come out, which was a bit irritating, but overall worth the wait. The steak was very tender and I liked the spoon salad. We added on a side of the pickles and I was very pleased with the fact that they were instead spicy pickled carrots, celery, and various colours of cauliflower, instead of cucumber.   Service was very good, though spotty at times, and we also had a buser exclusively for our table, who was excellent. Our water glasses were never empty and we never had a used dish on our table. That was excellent to see after some of the earlier Yelp reviews, that they needed to work on this.  Per our SLS stay, we had a $40 resort credit to use, which left us actually owing very little. This has been our favorite Vegas meal since coming together for 5 years and I definitely can't wait to come back. It has also allowed me to cook some of these dishes at home without a nose turn-up. Success!

00CxtoqHw4keZpSf9Rrrlg.text: LOVED LOVED this place... Tapas style dining, Mediterranean cuisine... We tried their signature spicy cigars which were truly amazing. My 7 year old asked for a repeat order! Excellent options for vegetarian, I had the harira soup which was like a hearty bean soup with garbanzos and lentils, very flavorful one of the best soups I had. We also ordered the falafel, lamb sliders, chicken kabob and watermelon salad all of which were Excellent! We had the sticky toffee pudding for dessert which was ADDICTIVE!! Service was above and beyond our server was Ricky. He described the food perfectly and took great care about refilling our wine. We even had the pleasure of taking to the chef! Can't wait to return and would highly recommend this place.

o8dwIG3TchRR6XMY7Ia7lg.text: So we went back to Cleo last night and took our friends to dinner. We all LOVED the food as always... When our waitress greeted our table we hoped that this time we would have a better experience, as it was the same server we had in my previous review... Well once again we had an awkward experience every time she returned to the table... I understand that this is a "tapa" style restaurant, and if we were still hungry and wanted more food, we would order more food. Can I recommend not to ask your table 5 times if they want to order more food when they've already said they're fine??? The guests that we brought to dinner were getting very irritated as she continued to interrupt our conversation attempting to push more food on us. I felt like we were being stalked by a car salesman trying to meet a quota. I hope next time we come in "Nessa" (I think her name was) is not our server.

mdokl9XIZZKjFbm1IKdAgg.text: This is the first negative review I've ever written on Yelp. I'm hoping this is a wake up call to the staff and management working tonight. We are staying at the Sls and know this restaurant to have good food. It's Tuesday, so not a busy night. We called ahead, and then walked down to the restaurant. The hostess seated us at a table literally next to the casino. The rest of the restaurant was practically empty. We politely asked to be moved further back into the restaurant so we didn't have to hear the slot machines etc. she moved us to a nice table, and our group sat down.  Then we waited.  And waited.  And waited.  There were maybe 5 tables that had patrons sitting at them.  No water, no greeting, no server.  At one point the manager walked out, glanced over, and kept walking away.  After about 20 minutes we got up and left. Not a single server or manager or hostess said a word.   We had to say something to the manager, he tried to get us to stay. Too little and way too late.  We are happily enjoying milos at the Cosmo now!

aasrFEs6h3J4Fl839v_QeA.text: I met a friend at Cleo to enjoy an amazing dinner!  I started off with a glass of champagne while we perused the menu.  The restaurant is beautifully appointed and the service was quite good.  We decided to share a few dishes tapas style and enjoyed everything - the scallops, brussels sprouts, grilled halloumi salad and the lamb kefta.  The extensive menu offers a little something for everyone and I love how you can try so many different tastes during your dinner.

WhVSZQlKEFMmK4Tkznibtg.text: This restaurant has been in my dreams since I left this place! We had a variety of items and shared between three of us in a party. The drink menu was crafted with care and a specialty cocktail I had there with muddled green grapes was exceptional. We tried first a trio of dips the bread fresh from the oven in its little paper bag was warm and adorable. The hummus, some sort of taziki-ish dip and a carrot dip was all excellent and could've been a meal all by itself. Then the spicy cigars which are a delicately rolled egg roll type meat stick of delight. These are to die for and I could have definitely eaten like 20. Then the lamb on a plate with pearl couscous was one of the most tender and delicious things I've ever put in my mouth. This coming from someone who usually doesn't order lamb because normally I think it can be a bit 'gamey'. This was not in any way. I love the different plate patterns that come out looks like lots of different China patterns and therein tradition of breaking the plates was a happy surprise as there was a bride to be in our restaurant who got to throw a plate down and everyone yelled 'OPAH!' That was exciting! We sadly had no room for the dessert but would gladly go back anytime. We had attentive staff and even met one of the general managers who was very pleasant. Bartenders were amazing at making memorable and unique drinks.

BudSCLn4pZh28rY1j7OMXA.text: Amazing! This restaurant is so good! You will not be disappointed going here for dinner! Well done Cleo! We will be back!

5sraM7c38HmcoWUy-VwTdA.text: The OYSTERS!!!! The Oysters are absolutely out of the world, the best!! Mushrooms great too as well as the yogurt deep and Brussels sprouts. Didn't care much about the beef or shrimp but its my personal taste. Next time I want to eat 3 dozens of oysters! Great cocktails too!

FCMx2Fr5eeVTb69TtK3x7w.text: This was a Mistake!! The review posted was for another restaurant. I APOLOGIZE to Cleo for any problems that may have caused them! I don't know how this error occurred but I am truly SORRY !

VO25j7WBRE4DuR1PEnAwHA.text: I ate here last night and my meal was so delicious! I was solo so I couldn't order everything I wanted to try.  I ended up ordering the falafel and lamb shwarma. The falafel was so fluffy and light,  they served it with a tahini dipping sauce and tabbouleh, both accompaniments were spot on.  The shwarma was the best thing I had eaten in months! I definitely recommend both dishes. I also splurged on dessert and ordered the sticky toffee pudding, this too was spot on. Not super sweet,  just the perfect end to my meal. Since most people wonder, the only reason it didn't get 5 stars from me is because the service was only so so.

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WFnNOxj77UqCgwfbWOmJVA.text: Cleo was DELICIOUS!!!  I'm already pondering a return trip to Vegas just to eat the Lebaneh with Feta - a yogurt, garlic dip accompanied by freshly baked bread.  Other highlights were the Chicken Kebab and Brussell Sprouts!    Prices were reasonable and service excellent.

OENxpGLKjKBBzCOOHFFPqA.text: The happy hour portions are not even half the regualr portions sorry but this is not what you can do to ur customers  I love cleo hollywood but i was realy disappointed here in las vegas

cqsMH1GirVItJC03RUoOkA.text: I've come to dine here a good half a dozen times and I love this place! I loved the idea of a Mediterranean tapas place with plenty of healthy yummy options. It's also still easy to get a last minute reservation. I've come with different groups of people almost every time and they all went back a second time. I really like how the atmosphere is not as loud and fast pace as a lot of restaurants on the strip but at the same time still has a really good vibe! My list of items you must try :  Brussel Sprouts - flaked  Grilled Octopus Lebaneh with Feta Lamb Kefta Grilled Hanger Steak Panna Cotta (dessert, so damn good!)

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My vanilla fig Panna Cotta. So delicious!

0WTbmLyiFpTGVDbPQpg7uA.text: The best meal we had in Vegas and very reasonably priced!  The crispy Brussels sprouts were just awesome. The chicken tagine, the oysters with granita and the spicy cigars were also great.   One star down for very over cooked scallops in an otherwise yummy preparation   Will definitely go back when I'm next in Vegas!

iuUG5xcGoVT8cjvOO7qAoQ.text: I had dinner reservations for a Tuesday evening for 7:00 pm via open table. Once entering the dining room my senses were mesmerized by the aroma of the kitchen and stove which is in the center of the restaurant.  I was seated asap and my friendly waitress took my order for a glass of red wine and having reviewed the menu earlier in my room I placed my order for my tapas, this is what I ordered:  The hmmus and tahini served with bread baked from the stone oven - very good  Brussel sprouts with capers, almonds and vinaigrette - light and flavorful delicious. Pork Belly - crisp on the exterior with just the right amount of seasoning - tender & juicy. Lamb Shawarma - Not gamey, tender and seasoned with a hint of curry. Grilled Octopus - Celery, potatoes and lemon vinaigrette. Bomb so tender! Clam & Noodle - Awesome finishing tapas - generous portion and so delish.   Fig & Almond Pannacotta - OMG, HAPPY ENDING!   Overall the food was stellar, service was solid and the interior decor is sexy and swanky! No wonder this is the top five of reservations made on open table. I'll be returning here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fig pannacotta
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam noodles
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Shawarma

TlycPnXRFoisIJU90IGucw.text: Hubby and I ate here last night (9-23-17). It's by far our new favorite Mediterranean restaurant.  The grilled lamb is fantastic.

lTd6NZHZonlo2fKiAdwLGQ.text: This spot has been on list for a while now! I was so excited to come try it out and every time I suggest it my picky friends haven't been for it. Regardless I made my way here last night. I wasn't as satisfied as I thought I would be. The waitress recommended the Lebaneh over the Hummus but we ended up ordering both. The hummus tasted water down or someone didn't drain the garbanzo beans well enough before they top off our dip or so it seemed. The Lebaneh was okay it had a strong sour taste but I feel as if that comes with Mediterranean dishes. My friend wasn't so pleased by that. The laffa that came with it was so cold. I would've preferred it to be at least warm if not hot. We ordered an additional 3 skewers 2 shrimp and 1 steak wagyu and it was mediocre. I felt like it was a home made dish. The steak wasn't seasoned much at all and tasted bland. The shrimp was okay I mean it didn't have that Mediterranean kick I was looking for I guess. Okay I'm saving the best for last.... the Brussels sprouts. They were the only hit at our table!! They was sooo flavorful, crunchy and simply delicious!!! I highly recommend them even if you don't like brussel sprouts. Let me honest not everyone does. Don't miss out on them though and you will thank me later. I tried to look over the dessert menu but nothing stood out. I am give it another try later if I'm in the area to try the rest of the menu and see if I can get Mediterranean cuisine taste they offer. They do have a great happy hour deal I posted in my pictures and the prices are really generous!   Side note, I took some take out for the fam and I managed to try a lamb chop from their order and it was delicious but it did lack flavor and seasoning. Thank heaven for salt and pepper?!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Laffa
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels Sprout Hearts, Hazelnurts &amp; Fresno Chili
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu Kebab + 2 Shrimp Kebab

26vCNEOV0f78UIOUktvUQw.text: Middle Eastern food on the strip!  SLS players club offered $30 off of $60 during my birthday month so that made it a clear choice on a recent Monday night.  It was packed at 8:30pm with quite a few people waiting outside.  I'd suggest making a reservation.  Being the middle ground between casual eateries at the resort (Umami) and high end (Bazaar Meat) makes it easy to see why Cleo is so popular.  The menu offered a lot to ponder over, but my mind was already set on one thing....falafel!  It's not easy to find a good version of those deep fried balls of chickpea/fava bean heaven around these parts, but the ones they're serving up here are falawesome.  The light crunch of the exterior went into delicious, warm legume center that was well spiced.  My only regret was not ordering the side of hummus since the amount that arrived with the plate wasn't even enough for three balls let alone seven.    A minor complaint was that while six of the balls were dark green on the inside, one was very pale green.  It didn't taste much different...still... can you imagine if Robert DeNiro's character from the film "Casino" saw this?  He would have ripped the chef a new one and then made sure he personally saw to every falafel that came out of the kitchen!    "Kibbeh Nayyeh": chopped raw lamb accompanied with mint, bulgar and lebaneh, was my wife's favorite dish.  It was unlike any other tartare I'd ever had.  The creaminess of the lebaneh (Lebanese yogurt cheese) blended so well with the meat and the toasted parmesan crackers to spread it on.  I found the shawarma portion to be very small for $8 and would definitely pay more for a full lamb entree or just get kebabs instead.  The moussaka was below average and we didn't even bother finishing it before ordering the impressively rich and decadent sticky toffee dessert.    There are plenty of other menu items worth checking out on a repeat visit like grilled octopus, flatbreads, and multiple mezzes.  I don't plan on being a stranger.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled hanger steak
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast lamb
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb kefta kabob

WcsoYX3Grjwndp-BRuRacg.text: We went here for mom's birthday dinner. The interior reminded me a bit of the riad I stayed at when I went to Morocco. I was excited. They serve Mediterranean tapas.  Wagyu Kebob: Tender, flavorful and mildly sweet. It comes with a slightly spicy tomato dip. 4.5/5  Falafel: These were excellent. Comes with tabbouleh. Warm and grainy just the way they should be. 5/5  Lamb Shawarma: The lamb slices were cooked until they have crispness to them. The lamb's slight saltiness was balanced by the mildly tart tahini. This is small (hint: tapas). 4/5  Brussels Sprouts: Citrusy vinaigrette with hazelnuts. The Brussels sprouts were crunchy. 4/5  Squid and Rice: Slices of squid with rice with squid ink and saffron. The squid wasn't rubbery. 4/5  Pork Belly: Crisp on the outside but fatty, tender and juicy inside. Great flavor. It comes with a sna cup of pickled veggies. 5/5  Garlic Shrimp: Peeled shrimps with lots of garlic. I wish I asked for bread to dip in to the sauce with. 5/5  Moussaka: The Greek eggplant "lasagna". Careful how much cheese you get or it can get real salty. Rich, creamy, delicious! 5/5  Bone Marrow: Glazed and served with mushrooms and grilled warm buttery bread. The marrow just spreads so easily onto the bread. Hello, clogged arteries! Sinful! 5/5  Almond and Fig Panna Cotta: I've gotten so bored with pannacotta. But this has nice flavor and texture combinations. The syrup and crunchy figs add excitement to the rather blah and predictable creaminess of pannacotta. 4.5/5  The servers, table runners and the chefs behind the kitchen were all outstanding. Excellent service. The manager was going around to make sure diners were enjoying their meal and experience. Mom would've loved this place.  Also, if you love Moroccan mint tea, get their iced tea. So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu Kebob

ksVnCVBspouwunhFdX0xKw.text: One of the three fine dining establishments at SLS hotel. This one is exotic, more affordable with decent portioned dishes for a tapa style restaurant.   I have never had Middle Eastern / Mediterranean food, I've always thought it was all meats, turned out there were lots of veggie and seafood dishes, the menu is extensive with many choices for everybody! We skipped mezees and flatbreads, not in mood for lots of carbs that evening, went for some protein and veggie dishes, along with a specialty cocktail and Perrier champagne.   Our tapas: Rice ball soup, Brussel sprouts, Grilled Branzino, Alaskan salmon fish kebab, Wagyu kebab, Grilled octopus and Grilled hanger steak.  I wanted the Seafood tagine so bad, but they didn't have it that evening, was a little bummed.   First time tried kebab, I was impressed, the salmon fish was not hard and chewy at all for a skewer! Very tender inside, so flavorful outside, the hot sauce was bomb, I used it on everything! Hubby's Wagyu beef kebab was very tender and soft too, wow...how did they do that!   Since they didn't have Seafood tagine, so I tried other seafood. Branzino was kind of light with crispy skin, I liked it. Our waitress recommended the grilled octopus, said it was a very popular dish. The octopus was extremely tender and flavorful, probably one of the best I have ever had for a very long time, but I hated the sour cream underneath, I didn't like the creamy stuff in all the dishes, but I guess that's just how Middle Eastern food is. Overall I liked the salmon kebab the most among all the seafood we tried.   Brussel sprouts worked for both of us, I had most of it, loved it. Hubby had a rice ball soup, I suppose it was a huge rice ball in chicken broth? He liked the soup, left out the rice ball. The hanger steak was so tender and flavorful, perfect in medium rare, hubby loved it with rice. The Middle Eastern style rice looked so dry, tasted even drier, can't say I liked it too much, guess it's just great to go with meats.  The food portions were so big for tapas, our waitress suggested us ordering quite a few to share, I even kept a menu just in case. Turned out we barely finished all our food, no room for dessert, the flavors were so rich, we got full so fast, or we were just not used to Middle Eastern food, yet....   My specialty cocktail Lotus flower was a very weak vodka drink, I didn't like it too much, hubby's Perrier was very tasty of course.   Our waitress was not very attentive from time to time, it was a very slow dinner, I don't think they had enough servers at the moment, that's weird for a Saturday night.   I have yet been to the Cleo in Hollywood, think I will give it a try soon, I got curious about Middle Eastern / Mediterranean food since this meal, very exotic flavors, very interesting, I love fish kebab!

rUsIjrUWBvaijU6bgqqDOw.text: My wife and I went for dinner. The atmosphere was very good and excellent service. They have some flat breads, salads and soups. We ordered the mushroom flat bread and the artichoke one. My wife had a salad and I ordered the Lamb Chawarma which it was land on a flat bread shaped like a taco. For dessert we had flourless chocolate cake. Will recommend.

SoXxzjeEcJkwrPUHSp4UAg.text: Decided to try the Cleo here for dinner. My husband mentioned they got good ratings here so we headed off the strip to check this place out.  Walking in everyone greeted us politely. Very friendly. We just had buffet that morning and wasnt pleased so we were hoping dinner would be better. Turns out it was.  I understand that they served tapas here but its a tad bit expensive. You definitely get what you pay.  Lamb Shawarma: super good. The meat just melts in your mouth. Im not a huge fan of lamb but this restaurant has turned me into one   Venison Sausage: this is my first time trying anything venison. My husband told me before its very chalky or grainy when hes had it previously. But the sausage here was amazingly delicious. No complaints and I'd have it again if it was offered. I cant describe the taste of it but it was definitely worth trying.  Bone Marrow: honestly this is also my first time having Bone Marrow. Technically Ive had it at a buffet before but this tops it off. I love how buttery and fatty the taste came out. So far im convinced anything ordered here will meet anyones expectations.  Last order is the specialty mushroom flat bread. Since we had ordered all small plates I was worried my husband and I were still hungry.  So we decided to order the flat bread which actually filled us up. Very delicious and full of flavor. The plates seemed small but it was actually a lot. The bill at the end came out to about 73 bucks. Totally worth it for the two of us.

qMlQDRYgOO_Ca1LFyzsuog.text: Group of 6 girls - things were made and presented to a good standard but I found everything to be just a bit too salty.  The server up-sold us to order 3-4 plates per person and we knew better... we ended up with 2 plates per person and still had tons of foods left over.  I ordered the flat bread and it was yummy. There were also other flatbreads ordered, bone marrow and some sort of chicken as well.  It's super romantic inside and yet we found it a little TOO dark to see our food.  Everything was very tasty and we felt super cool while there... Just be careful if you're planning on dancing the night away as many of these foods can be rich and heavy - aka hard to feel sexy after lol!

2pltMiefU2bcBO1YDDwJ7Q.text: I had a wonderful birthday dinner here. My husband and I shared several plates starting with hummus, spicy rolls, brussel sprouts, lamb and grilled octopus. The star was definitely the octopus! So meaty, tender with amazing char smokey flavor. The lamb was moist and the brussel sprouts were terrific, crispy bits of heaven. We also had a nice bottle of wine and a dessert wine.  Our waiters were awesome! They brought out a nice cake for my birthday and our server Walter sang me happy birthday. He had a great voice! Our other server, Manuel, was very attentive and had good suggestions. When they were out of the dessert wine we requested he gave us another option and discounted it. Plus he gave us the last bit of the one we did request at no cost. They did so many little things to make a wonderful dinner experience.  Now we need to go back and try so many other of the interesting options on their menu.

o78eiT67rrQzwLQo3GJLMg.text: Cleo is a tapas style Middle Eastern restaurant inside of the new hotel SLS. The ambiance is quite nice. Not to dark, but also not too bright as well.  I came here with a party of 3 including me. The wait was around 30 minutes on a Saturday night. Not too bad. We were seated in a huge booth. The seating arrangement was kind of awkward since the table was huge.  I'm a fan of Mediterranean food so I had pretty high expectations for this place. We ordered the following dishes to share.  Babaganoush that came with warm lavash bread. The babaganoush was extremely disappointing for me. It had a kind of sour taste to it. It tasted nothing like other babaganoush's that I've tried. However, the lavash bread was amazing. Soft and warm like it just came out of the oven. It was so good, that I had to order another one just to eat by itself. I don't need a dip for a bread this good....  We also order the falafels which were pretty amazing. These were probably my favorite dish of the night.  Other dishes we tried were shrimp kabob, lamb shank, bone marrow, and octopus. Everything was just okay. However my boyfriend really enjoyed the lamb shank. He said it was probably one of the best he's ever had. Our friend was really disappointed with the bone marrow and said that it also had some kind of weird sour taste to it. The octopus was good and tender.   Overall, for the price, I think I wouldn't come back here for Mediterranean food. There's so many other places in CA that has authentic and good Mediterranean food for 1/2 the price.

y6VOhpQ0WzF1UaCTenVZZA.text: Went here on a whim. Very impressed. Our server was very knowledgeable which is very much appreciated. Other restaurants should take note.   Spicy cigars were great: wound up getting two orders. Wagyu and shrimp kabons were good (in that order). Also got the soujouk sausage on recommendation from our waitress as they were out of pork belly kabobs. I liked this the least, but it wasn't bad at all.   We will be back to visit.

frSCHCWQkhiHs7Z4X7HoFg.text: Try everything! You cannot go wrong here it is fun! It is like a tapas place except it's eclectic, and innovative.  They serve everything course by course and you share... I came here with my mom we had a blast.  On top of it the staff loves the food too and they are excited to share ideas and get excited about the food as well. The atmosphere is interesting and kind of eclectic almost like a puzzle ... Old books, busy tiles, strange ceramic cookware.... Not pretentious at all but definitely a place that welcomes you and treats you like a king.  Whether it's date night, fun with friends or family please go here and give it a try... FUN... How eating should be...

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KQJUp-fs3vaw8PhWK2RoYw.text: The food was delicious but the portions were small. Atmosphere is sophisticated and charming. Good place to share a few bites with friends before going out on the town.

zc0SckUO0CNywWygQiqBcA.text: Excellent all around! Fantastic happy hour from 5-7. Amazing desserts. The drinks were superlative. The service was outstanding. We could not get enough of the baba and the hummus. The grilled octopus was absolutely incredible. If you like Mediterranean then this place is for you. Their take on the Old Fashioned is simple delectable. We will be back. As well, we brought our kids age 5 and 8 and they found things to eat. They have rice and fried chicken for the more picky of eaters.

obE6CjCxNCeN6bXSaI-8SQ.text: Very good Mediterranean food.  I had lamb for the first time and it was good.  The service wa s excellent.   I recommend Cleo, you won't be disappointed.

egpFDZ2ZI3R0LJxZn04G3Q.text: The food is absolutely delicious and Jessica is the best waitress ever.   She's patient and has great recommendations based on what you're likes are. She recommended the absolute best food I've EVER had and I'm an absolute foodie.

uke-ZGXxqbxiOjGEQJlUAg.text: Creative Mediterranean food at a decent price. I've had difficulty finding great Mediterranean food in Vegas until now. My wife and I loved the duck pastry dish, salad, and cucumber dip. I hear the brussel sprouts are a must....next time!  Good service and good drinks too. Cocktails are creative, but overpriced at $14.

RsFFGgTY8qf-cpWVRF5Vbg.text: Food was fabulous! Really interesting flavors and the presentation of the food was way beyond our expectations. Kudos to the chef on all fronts.  Unfortunately the decor was uninspired and boring. It's a shame it doesn't match the quality of the food.

eaLPNpAeercMG_xH75Tz8A.text: Woowo I never taste such a bad food! How can you take a Mediterranean food and make it so bad?!?!  And the service is even worst.  You have to understand it's a tapas restaurant and the dishes are$11-$19 for a mini plates not even enough for one person!

IPbumA1gIp-NUccwyB2UfQ.text: Awesome.  Different atmosphere from Hollywood one and better portion in each dish which is a huge plus. Gotta try their desert too! I had some sort of toffee pudding and it was divine. Wine selection is not impressive but we got decent Chardonnays.  Enough lighting and noise to enjoy conversation and dinner at the same time.  If you are seeking tapas in Vegas, try here!

NdzcTEdnU-z-5K5gX4sIVw.text: Sheer heaven! Great food and service. Favorites: kale flatbread, Brussel sprouts, beet salad, my little pillows of love-ricotta and spinach dumplings and the toffee pudding.   Oh yeah-forgot the oysters! Just skimming the surface of what's on the menu.  Prices are very reasonable and the atmosphere is lively. Great dinner-never disappoints a True favorite of mine.

AnxzBBm5Nf-N2XTSOSEuNQ.text: I came here with a friend prior to attending a concert. It was early so the restaurant was not too busy. The waitress was very friendly and gave some great recommendations. The food and drinks were tasty! The wait staff was a little too aggressive in picking up our finished plates (or what appeared to be finished). It felt as though there was someone at the table every five minutes. Then again, it's better to go above and beyond (;

CKhIIUI8esT2O11xKGgs3A.text: The atmosphere is beautiful, the service exceptional and the food was great.  Then unique flavors really make it standout from all the other restaurants around.  We went back for a second night to experience different tastes from the night before.

T1ZfZWAXGmuwtrUNYnVq8Q.text: Excellent excellent restaurant if you go Hollywood very busy but here in Vegas I can get best table right way .. taste same !! How luck I am ..Lam, Brussels sprouts & almond pinacota are best .. we definitely go back.

7pNHXspLg_Wa6EO0RNqETw.text: Manny and Harold at Cleo are just awesome. Harold's voice is amazing and Mannys serice and attention impeccable. Thank you for making my birthday celebration so wonderful. The food recommendations were so wonderful!!! Cleo's atmosphere just terrfific... thank you!!!

Po71pGsfCEgBm3Iiy0QW5g.text: If you are not staying at SLS it's not worth going all the way from the other side of the strip to dine at this restaurant.  Food was mediocre, drinks were meh and service was ok. Server dropped the plates in front of us and one of our starter arrived after  the entrees.  We had a reservation, yet when we arrived they seated us in the corner, we asked for a better table but they did not move us.   Music was too loud causing everyone to speak louder and shout when ordering food.

XTnq67WJo4R-kgm_2aIbEw.text: Our anniversary+my birthday, couldn't have been better. We were recommended to sit at the bar, and that was what started a absolutely great evening.    Jose` was our bartender/YOU NEED TO TRY THIS GURU, and he was hitting homeruns...  We had our menu planned out, but his suggestions made for literally some of the greatest dishes my wife and I have eaten in Vegas. From start to finish, this meal was everything a human being would be able to distinguish from, what is Great, what is good, and what is okay... Cleo is Great!!!  Thank you for making a great night for us...See you soon! Joe, and Eryn

rYktP5U_WLl6S_WsjF2JAA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas! I'm a local here and am not a big fan of SLS but I go there just for Cleo!   Grilled Octopus is a must ... I'm not an octopus lover at all but the dish is amazing!  Lamb sliders and Hummus are delicious ... Every time I go, I like to try new plates and I haven't had one I didn't like!

AiiBy5pRQOyw_2FVp6dTYA.text: The brussel sprouts are the best!  Definitely order them no matter what else you get! Cleo is Mediterranean food with a fun,  funky atmosphere.  Service was great!

DkpA_JcaLfl-E_7baQz8Mw.text: We had dinner at Cleo last night for our 23rd wedding anniversary.   We made an early reservation to avoid any holiday weekend crowd. Couldn't believe how empty this yummy place was.  Since they knew it was our anniversary,  it would have been nice to be seated at one of the lovely empty booths rather than a small table.  Service was prompt and friendly.   Pricey for a nearly vegetarian meal for 2 with no alcohol  - over $100.  Highlights:  potato latkes, fried brussel sprout leaves, harira soup and the only non-vegetarian choice - the scallops.  All  delicious!  Very disappointed with the house pickles - carrots, celery and cauliflower.   For $5, we would have liked more creativity.   No sweet white wine options.   Spicy potatoes good.  Grilled halloumi salad just okay. Dessert was fig & almond panacotta and flourless chocolate cake.  Both were nice. I appreciated being able to order a decaffeinated cappuccino.   Again, ambiance and service excellent and we really enjoyed ourselves.   We would love to come back often but will have to remain a place for special occasions.

4JbGGdUzdmTpB_nx7as77Q.text: Excellent service, a little pricey but what isn't at Vegas now a days, food was just perfect, lamb was tender, octopus fantastic!! Their hummus and flatbread amazing!!! Definitely we will be coming back

Gz9vOFHn3jJEK6TGjX0ocg.text: Fantastic meal at Cleo last night.  There isn't one dish that I wouldn't suggest.  Our service was fantastic from our Busser to our Runner and the Waitstaff.  We will definitely return (probably this week).  Every dish was fresh, light, seasonal and well executed.  Thank you! We loved it!

Zn2xA7fNTftjQ77TZfld9w.text: This is my first time here. It is located inside of SLS hotel. Small plates and very pricy.

fnijb9ozdsvYkVCEDN7PoQ.text: First time in Las Vegas and tonight's dinner was excellent. The food comes in smaller portions so our table sampled many of the wonderful selections. In addition to the food the service was also 5 star.

5h6IB5PRrENw4nJD0trfjw.text: Excellent food. Excellent service. Excellent ambiance.... I could drone on and on gushing to say more, but these few words sum up this place beautifully. I will most definitely return any time I come home to Vegas. Highly recommended!!!

KHpyottgl6rcRJBss0uvlQ.text: Enjoyed my shawarma tremendously. Cocktail could have been better though. Think the food overall would be tasty for people being introduced to this type of food.
