Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brick oven pizza. Like the spices around the pizza bar.

0jNTqFoyIQ13l5VUL74iYQ.text: We've been in Vegas 3 times now, and this place has had the best meal ever so far. Just amazing food, service speed and some great atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Axp7P167vAtwsDvVwEisWQ.text: was there last week and this place was awesome. had the pork belly, moussakak, babaganoush, artichokes and the saffron rice. everything was super awesome except for the artichokes. they were just ok but everything was out of sight! setting was beautiful, service was fabulous and I LOVED the mismatched plates on the table! i would come back again and thank you for the great food!

M1MVMeXdZXL6GeoudHKv9g.text: Best Moroccan  restaurant I have ever visited .. I really mean it .. Best chicken screw I have ever tasted.. Never miss it ! and never miss the Harira soup !

iT3jjkDf49dNmsM881CtiA.text: Amazing dishes. Brussel sprouts in red wine was amazing and the drinks too. Spencer and Sydney hosted us like we were at their respective homes. Great food. Great service.

Yz2TI5k6RfpmgPb-wS-XZw.text: Wonderful, WONDERFUL meal at Cleo mediterranean tapas inside the new SLS Las Vegas Hotel and Casino (old Sahara).   We wanted to experience the new place as soon as possible, so we secured a reservation at opening time, 5:30 PM Sunday, 8/24. Our waiter was awesome: funny, without being too fake-chummy or cloying. He took a few minutes to explain the menu and sold us immediately on Lebaneh with Feta, a very creamy, almost cream-cheesy dip with wood-fired bread seasoned with garlic and zatar. Addictive, sour, spicy - everything wonderful to start the meal!  I ordered fried brussel sprouts hearts with piquillo peppers, hazlenuts, and preserved lemon as a second starter. What a wonderful explosion of tart, garclicky, salty flavors. I already love brussels sprouts, but this was heaven! My partner ordered dolmades (grape leaves stuffed wtih lemony rice and lamb). The waiter accidentally delivered 2 orders, and comped the extra one. Already starting to see that one of the "Ss" in SLS certainly must stand for servicel!  My partner ordered a chicken tagine, redolent of aromatic cinnamon, preserved lemon, pichouline olives, and chicken thighs. I ordered a meatball tagine with charred tomato/piquillo pepper sauce and a soft egg in the middle. So wonderful: rich and decadent. I have a picture of it that I would like to include with this review, but it's my first time posting on Yelp! (this meal most definitely inspired me), so I apologize profusely if I can't figure out how to upload pics!  By the time we were finished with our main meal, we were both far too stuffed to have anything else, but our wonderful waiter talked us into a dessert to share: molten chocolate flourless cake with vanilla bean gelato and super-ripe banana. What a wonderful, light desert! Best part of the evening came after we waited for what seemed like quite awhile to receive the cake. Eventually, the house manager came to our table, apologize about the wait for the cake, explained that ours had already been prepared, but the kitchen wasn't happy with the quailty of the result, so they cooked us a new one. The manager offered to comp something else while we waited. I had a divine Turkish coffee served in a wonderful little copper pot. Also while we were waiting, our waiter comped us with a little appetizer-sized desert (toffee chocolate bar).  Do yourself a favor and go. This was by far the best meal we've had in Vegas - anywhere (and we've bowed at the altars of Honey Salt and Lotus of Siam)!

QTwW6xs4ArkZAXRHW0WVfA.text: Where shall I begin. Well first off we had a reservation for 9:00 last night and didn't get seated until 9:45... We were a bit upset but already went into it knowing that it was a brand new restaurant and it was the first Saturday night of they're opening! Once we got seated we immediately got greeted by the manager and he apologized for our wait and gave us two free bottles of champagne for the inconvenience (was there with 7 girls so we were all super happy for that gesture and totally was surprised/thankful)! Now to get to the food... Mann oo man we had about 6 different appetizers and non of us could decide which appetizer was the best because all the food was phenomenal! The food is tapas style and comes out as it's ready so threw out the entire dinner we all raved about the amazing food! Service was unbelievable especially since it's a brand new restaurant, in a good way :)! Each time a server passed our table they topped off our water cups, took done plates and kept making sure we were all doing good! I could go on and on how great this place is! Must check it out :)

Un63AU89UJLdceNr7tbEXg.text: I took my parents from out of town to Cleo because I heard a lot of good things about it but I was not very pleased because their prices are very high and their food was not that great. I had their bone marrow

gPbA9irhAkNsylej1quSsA.text: Great place for vegetarians and carnivores alike. Ordered about 15 vegetarian dishes which were all amazing except not to impressed with the mushrooms. Wine menu is lacking but the Syrah from Morocco was fruit forward and full bodied. Delish.  Friends had some specialty cocktails that they enjoyed. Will definitely be back.  Try the Kale pizza. No joke.

Mrndg_q3UU-ZCczBRgazIg.text: We live in Las Vegas and try to avoid eating in casinos.  Our family (Greek American) has made a big exception for Cleo.  The food is amazing.  It is easy to get in and out just to dine.  The have done a beautiful job with the interior, so we don't even feel as if we are in a casino when were are eating.  Get the brussel sprouts.  And the hummus.  And the tangine chicken.  Actually, get whatever you want because it is all great.

ERzMh96yKbHha7NpQ7ggAg.text: I am so excited to have Cleo's in Las Vegas as it is definitely my favorite restaurant  in the city. Their food is simply amazing!  We started off with the Lebaneh with Feta and a chopped salad, followed by Brussels sprouts,  mushrooms, a flatbread, chicken kabob, steak kebab and a weekly special of their salmon kebab. I tried the Lotus Flower for a drink and it was so light and refreshing. Everything was over the top. I can't wait to try EVERYTHING on the menu.

Nsmwrj_OCinOJfg8hdtpDg.text: i am a local and took advantage of the half off during dec. the prices of cleo's  tapas were not too bad.  the food was exceptional.  the service was great.  i have been back twice since their half off offer and will continue to come back as long as they don't charge for parking! refuse to go to strip casinos that i have to pay for parking!!! even got lucky playing craps a few times after dinner!

E7TBOA37-yLverEINlPR6Q.text: After waiting way too long to be initially acknowledged and dying for drinks, I wasn't sure how I could be soothed, but...WOW. Unbelievable food. I mean better than I've had in years. The ambience was sexy, yet casual. The quinoa is beyond expectations and the kale flatbread was also perfect. It was ALL a ten! Excellent!!!!

a5BhanoNNXub4fKatFyYLw.text: The finest Mediterranean cuisine...oh so delicious!!!!! The friendly service was excellent too!

qgAG7kMeNm24PVfkI4LFMg.text: I had a chance to dine in at cleo with me and 2 other friends, it took about 30 minutes to get seated and then when we got seated the server said she will be right back to take our drink order, comes back 15 minutes later asking if we'd like to get drinks started she seemed unhappy and in an unwelcoming mood, we asked for a lebaneh with feta cheese and some brussel sprouts they were great we were ready for some more things our server was no where to be found,the busser was basically doing the servers job we tried to get him to get us the order but he wasnt allowed, when she finally got back we were upset because the service was so bad.We wanted to just leave but we were already here so we went for it we finally put our final order for a chx tagine ,grilled hangar,grilled octopus,and a flatbread. We received the hangar steak cold but the rest of the food was great. Food is amazing but Service could use a little more training.

grpLX_MOHkIDi1wGPE6sIg.text: Extremely overrated, there are way better restaurants to try. The service was painful! Ordered a bottle of champagne and 15 minutes later had  to ask where it was.....was the trend for the night, always chasing food and drink orders...The food was good, but some of the portions very small, even for tapas. Tried it, it is off the list. The only positive was, as SLS and north on the strip, parking was easy!...Management need to get more staff in...don't like to be rushed but this was way too slow..

vePDOVf57Cf05f5EOXrXyw.text: Service and food fantastic. Try the lamb  shawarma and chopped salad!  The drinks are amazing, they are made with fresh juices. Hostesses are nice and accommodating.

_aM18987oMS150O5W8ERkQ.text: Absolutely my new favorite place to dine. Everything was delicious and hot. Service was great in a romantic room. What more can I say.

IP5IS4zvDgSkRTjkrt0U8Q.text: Great service! Cocktails and food are reasonably price and tasted great! Had the octopus and beef skewers. You can't go wrong with any of the dishes.

8_u1PPrqmnriGCK8MpKOPg.text: Cleo is one if the most tasties restaurants I've been to.  Especially for such a good price. Must try the Wagyu beef kababs. They are well seasoned and very tender. You probably saw reviews for the brussel sprouts and I agree,  they are amazing. Flavors are different than any other brussel sprouts appetizer I ever had. They also had a smoky watermelon drink that was very unique and full of flavors. I will go back again!

Sjl8PmYwWyTzBzxAlk8Bgg.text: We were a party of 4 dining at Cleo on a busy Friday evening on Valentine's weekend.  We ordered about a dozen plates to share, along with a bottle of Spanish red wine.  The bill came to $298 after tax and tip.  Shockingly, I discovered that we were even charged for water, which was poured from an already-opened bottle and tasted like the Vegas tap water.  The biggest hits at our table seemed to be the lamb dishes, the freshly baked flat bread, and the wine.  I enjoyed my meal immensely, and the service was friendly, talkative and very responsive.  However, I wouldn't recommend Cleo and I doubt I would go back because of the steep price. Everything we ordered on the menu was wonderful, it was just overpriced--even for the Vegas strip.

BDUFYOWPFLxs6l4nhqyt5w.text: We had about 5 plates between 2 of us. It was very good, authentic scratch made. The environment is very different, homie, sorta southern European feel. The service was a little slow, but it was ok because it fits the laid back vibe there.

FR7NwdNEO5Rq8FrJjcc2Pg.text: We stayed at SLS during our visit to vegas and were told about the 50% off on food menu at Cleo so decided to check it out. We ordered the flatbread, greek salad and lamb shawarma along with clementina. I am glad to didnt order more here as both drink and food were below average. The food tasted old and nothing special. I guess that explains half off food promo! Not coming back

qwyyyC66RxA2Nx6_4LEFuw.text: I am a big fan of this restaurant! It was my first stop in Vegas and the food was wonderful.  Here are two things that impressed me:  1. Everything is clearly labeled! Have an allergy? Don't worry. Want something vegan / gluten-free? They got you. This was why I decided to dine here in the first place!  2. Great flavors! You can tell that the ingredients they are using are fresh. The colors and flavors are vibrant and amazing. I would highly suggest the falafel and the beet salad (both vegan).

qLtpNyLDhGDCtxLfYcUKDg.text: Cleo serves the best Mediterranean food I have ever tasted, hands down. The experience is certainly one of the highlights from our recent Las Vegas trip.  The portion size is smaller than typical American restaurants and the dishes do not come with any sides or add-ons. We ordered two appetizers from their Mezzes section: 'choice of dip with laffa' (we chose hummus with tahini as the dip), and 'from the oven' (Brussel sprout hearts, hazelnuts, and Fresno chili). For the main course, we tried the 'pick three kebab' combination platter: lamb kefta, chicken kebab, and shrimp kebab. The amount of food was just about right for a table for two.  Each of these items had a distinct touch of the chef that keeps them apart from the other restaurants we tried. The ambiance fits well with the lobby of SLS Las Vegas. Food price is justified to the flavor they come in. We would definitely pay a re-visit to try out the other items on their menu the next time we go to Vegas.

Rqi7IcMkrrH8IkgSBAg0Ng.text: Never open and hogh prices, words out on news they are closing the location in SLS Casino

0paIDJz9QYB8jkDTbfXnSg.text: Best falafel I've had in my life. Brussels sprouts and cauliflower were great. The deserts were also amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

USeAzd0KaSDd3fr1sWm9rQ.text: This was such a lovely meal. Mediterranean is a go-to for me, and this certainly didn't disappoint.  When we arrived, the hostess seemed to be assisting staff elsewhere, but we were quickly greeted and seated. We had no reservation, but still managed a great seat. The service was friendly all around, and we didn't have to wait too long to order or for our food to arrive.   My partner and I shared the "Summer Menu" which consisted of a single/shared order from the "First," "Second," and "Third" courses of the meal. We each ordered our own "Fourth/main" dish and we each got our own "Fifth/dessert." The price for this was $50 per person. I am somewhat confused how this works out economically when one person orders compares to two people, but it worked out, I guess.  For our shared dishes, we  had the Hummus with Laffa bread, the Quinoa & Roasted Veggies salad, and the Brussel Sprouts. The hummus was smooth and tasty, topped with creamy tahini. The salad was decent with lots of yummy veggies. The Brussel Sprouts and salad were a tad bit salty for my taste buds though.    My main dish was the Hanger Steak cooked medium. It was very flavorful and super filling. Definitely one of the better Hanger Steaks I have had. My partner had the Grilled Branzino and it was cooked perfectly (maybe a little salty for me).   We each ordered separated desserts. The Sticky Toffee pudding was rich and extremely sweet, and the Flourless Chocolate Cake was sweet as well with oozing chocolate insides.  All in all, this was a great meal in a cute, fancy setting. I am curious about the Happy Hour for next time.

rM6HLpX59FDeVjnF-flK3g.text: Prompt attentive service. Enticing menu. Amazing tastes and flavors! A special request was handled deftly and perfect to the occasion. Totally enjoyed our meal; hummus + cauliflower + garlic shrimp + Moroccan fried chicken = fabulous dinner. A lovely food decision in this crazy town of many choices! Also, I loved the decor of the place; especially the books, chandeliers suggesting old Hollywood glamour.

6gHwS3VDCtt3NKBYk20IfQ.text: Very disappointed, after seeing nice reviews about this place we decided to give it a try. The greek salad was bland, no flavor, also tried the clam noodle, and that was a nightmare of a dish, along with the chicken tagine which was well undercooked. I think the kitchen staff needs to spend a week or 2 near the Mediterranean sea and try some of the real Greek and middle eastern  countries' dishes as this place has no business being open serving this type of food. Maybe we were there a night the staff was off duty, not sure.

OI-8ZXD0rpot3uEXv1g8iA.text: I'm so glad we came across this gem! We were staying in SLS and everything looked closed except this. Thank god! We tried the shrimp kabobs, falafels, mushroom flatbread and Brussels sprouts. Everything was amaaaaazinggg!!!! Definitely try the Brussels sprouts- very unique, highly recommended!  Here's a photo of the dessert!

YHu2jwm6iXGl9NAojCm3Fg.text: Such a gem of a restaurant in Las Vegas! I've yet to take advantage of the infamous social hour but the prices look awesome. If you go, make sure you get the labaneh dip - this stuff is what people dream about!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Labeneh dip with laffa bread is to die for.

r-81-7YJnr42JNPdgjAtzw.text: We went for social hour for a quick snack. Very fun decor. The hummus was very good. We also had the roasted veggies and quinoa. The olives were a surprise in it,but a welcome one. I needed some greens in my body after a few days of Vegas gluttony and these hit the spot. Alcohol was more expensive than I would have liked for social hour, but I that it is fancy. I'd eat here again.

-GsCXUlu3LglK-ctgH5eFw.text: This restaurant has amazing food!  Everything I have tried has been delicious.  I always sit at the bar with Dana is my server. Dana always has great recommendations and excellent at her job!  A hidden gem within SLS casino.

ZQcgwXaGxUVEYFa2ydOOfA.text: Truly an excellent and fun experience all around. Came here for my birthday dinner recently and it did not dissapoint!  **Food/drinks: 5 stars I forgot the name of the cocktail but it was bright yellow and citrusy! Very good. And lotssss of  H20 because it's vegas and you must stay hydrated! Horitiaki salad -- yum! a bit of a twist on the classic presentation but same great appearance Babaganoush -- not too smoky, comes with a well seasoned flatbread Kale Flatbread -- parmesan, light hint of garlic, one of my favorite dishes Baby Kale salad with grilled greek cheese -- very good, has hazelnuts and citrus! Felafel - 7 of them, a bit dry but flavorful inside, with tachini and tabouli, it came out last and I was too full by then so I only had 1. We could have done without this one.  **Experience/Service: 5 stars Service was personable, not rushed and very helpful. She recommended 2-3 dishes per person and we got 5 things, but they're pretty large portions so we could have gotten just 4 and been fine.  **Ambiance: 5 stars Nested inside the SLS hotel (which has a lot of good restaurants by the way!), the ambiance was so beautiful. Books and old antiques all over with ancient writings and beautiful old tattered mirrors lines the walls. I like how the fire pit oven for flatbreads was visible from anywhere in the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Social hour menu pricing! 5-7!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Babaganoish ams amazing flatbread
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek salad

ejsXZbehqSUT2gyZ3OSYvg.text: Very upscale, pretentious, excellent service, mostly great food served in small portions. It was suggested for the four of us that we order 8 or 9 entrees, we ordered 11 and were stuffed. Very loud even on a Tuesday evening after 7.  I've had better chicken and lamb kefta kabobs, I'm not a fan of falafel balls before we walked in and these did not change my feelings. The salads we had were wonderful as was the spanakopita and the baba ganoush, hummus and labni. However, the portions of the baba ganoush hummus and labni were the serving size I've gotten as "included with" a dish from the many middle-eastern restaurants I have been to and they did not cost us $10 a plate or the 3 for $28. These were great, but the price was over the moon, as was everything. Vegus prices I guess. The fresh flat bread in brown paper bags was good. The brussel sprouts were also excellent.  Cocktails were great at $15 each. I had 2 Market Mojitos and they were unusual and good.  Put this on your bucket list and go for the food and the experience.

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three kinds of Kebabs with saffron rice
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. falafel

0YCQGB9Q8d_HYu0ZjV2TGg.text: Staying at the SLS makes this spot very accessible for dinner. They open around ~5 so after a few attempts at the Roulette table we decided to have early dinner/ happy hour. The hostess is very inviting and informative with all menu options, explaining everything even before you're taken to your seat.  It was the perfect week to decide to dine here because they had their Dine LV menu available which was an amazing 5 course meal option for $40.   First Course (Appetizer) - LABANEH WITH FETA  `If you like greek yogurt and tart flavors with well blended spices this is definitely the better choice over the hummus. The laffa has it's own spices as well and it is even delicious on its own.  Second Course - BEETS SALAD `If you have never had beets before, this is a good way to begin your introduction to them. The beets and avocado slices are topped with a pomegranate vinaigrette of some sort. There's some tang/ citrus that mask the dullness of what you anticipate a beet to taste like. Absolutely delicious combination! Once I finished, I immediately began brainstorming ways to integrate it into my routine meal prep rotations.  Third Course - BRUSSELS SPROUTS `It's crispy, it's tender, and it's fresh! How is this possible? Well, it's flashed fried! The leaves on the Brussels sprouts are all separated (by machine, not by hand as that would take intense manual labor haha!) and then quickly fried at high temperatures and immediately therefore after brought to your table. Ahhhh you could just eat this and eat this and not feel guilty because it's just so light and crispy! I even want to come back just to have a big bowl of this stuff!  Fourth Course - GRILLED HANGER STEAK ` THIS IS A MUST! I ordered this without realizing I didn't disclose how I wanted my steak cooked. I was pleasantly surprised when it was brought to me media rare (just how I like it). I would suggest if you like it any other way, to mention something at the time of ordering your meal because they do not ask you as they would at any typical restaurant. The hanger is accompanied with small grilled potatoes (about bite size) and a little "spoon salad" but I just used that to dip the potatoes in because they were a little on the bland side. However, the meat was soft, juicy, and very flavorful. Not once did I think to ask for pepper or salt to season.  Fifth Course (Dessert) - Flourless chocolate cake with Ecuadorian Arriba chocolate and a scoop of vanilla gelato. `OMGAWWWWDD the warm flourless chocolate cake just oozes melted Ecuadorian chocolate as you spoon into it. The fact that it's flourless makes you feel less guilty with every bite you continue to take till it completely disappears into your stomach! The vanilla gelato is great to balance out the palate with the rich flavors of chocolate.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flourless chocolate cake! Delicious dessert option!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Hanger Steak! A must order!

pFF_4raI3HI0HbGoXUOlXA.text: Outstanding service and spectacularly scrumptious food. If you're a foodie, you'll love this tapas restaurant. The happy hour was voted the best in Las Vegas by Food and Wine, and I completely understand. We ordered crispy brussel sprouts with a delightful vinaigrette. One reviewer said the portion was skimpy, and I absolutely disagree. We ordered lamb schwarma, and it was tender and flavorful. We ordered babaganoush; one of us is gluten free, so the waitress offered to bring fresh veggies to eat the dip. The veggies were plentiful and included much more than the usual carrots and celery. Those staples were there along with zucchini too. Delicious indeed! We also ordered the flatbread during the Social Hour. It was so big that we had to take some back to the hotel room and enjoy it later. Two of us split four tapas and the market mojito (flavorful and refreshing), and we left completely satisfied. We had a late reservation for Bazaar Meat (another restaurant in the hotel), and we had to cancel because we were still full from Cleo's. It cost us approx $40 total plus a hefty tip for one of the best waitresses we've ever encountered. See the pics I posted for food, ambiance, and drink. We will return...again and again! Hope to try Bazaar Meat sometime soon too!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a2yfCj1dau_G8pXzTLV4XQ.text: The only time I'd been to Cleo was not long after SLS opened, when Elites were treated to an overnight stay, dinner tastings and drinks at Umami, Cleo, and Katsuya, drinks in the Lounge, then admission to the club with bottle service, and breakfast the next morning at the fabulous coffee shop that closed soon after.  It was a never-ending Dionysian/Bacchanalian feast that has yet to be matched.  Oh, those were the Elite days!  But this visit was strictly for dinner, and with a $30 birthday comp in hand, we bravely set out for the restaurant after a great comedy show at the Smith Center.  We didn't have a reservation, but the restaurant wasn't crowded, so we were seated right away at a large table.  I wasn't blown away by the wine list, so I ordered a Mediterranean Margarita - tequila with fig puree and lime.  It was heavy on the tequila, so I had to ask for more of the fig stuff to moderate the alcohol.  Probably a problem only for me :)  We shared a Harisa soup, which the kitchen put into two bowls, so we didn't have to keep passing the bowl back and forth.  I loved it:  just the right amount of spice, lots of chickpeas and other veggies in a thin tomato-based broth.    An order of falafel followed - 7 balls on dollops of hummus, with a small center mound of a couscous/tabbouleh combo.  The falafel were delicious, but slightly dry, so they could have benefited from a little more hummus.  What I don't get is that if all these small plates are meant to be shared, why have an uneven number?  You can't divide 7 by anything!!  For our main courses, my husband had chicken tagine and I ordered lamb tagine.  Our waitress said they were the largest of all the main dishes, but they really were quite small.  Enough for me, of course, especially after the soup and two falafel (along with a helping of the delicious bread that we had to ask for).  Hubby didn't expect dark meat and a bone to deal with, but he forgot to ask.  He liked it, but didn't love it.  My lamb was a bit fatty and light on the apricots, but with the generous portion of fluffy couscous, it was a good dish nonetheless.  Very good service and a delightful atmosphere, but the Strip prices don't make for a great deal without that birthday comp.  Still, a nice place to go for a special dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half a Harisa Soup
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Falafel (-2)!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Tagine

hJCi0WwsCyZG_fcqoOVlcA.text: I'm not sure if it's possible for us to Love this place more.  This hidden gem is so. Darn. Good. Everything is tasty! I know everyone are going crazy over the shawarma, as a vegetarian I can honestly say that everything I order is always delicious.   To me their best dish would be the Brussels sprouts! That and the cauliflower, are just... perfect.  My son ordered a pizza that was decent and good, the rest of the table ordered fish and some more shawarma and loved every bite ;).

WF44NccKCEBT3mroIU1yDw.text: Had reservations for 8pm on a Saturday night and we were seated promptly. Overall the place was 90% full.   Service - the entire staff was attentive and friendly.   Food - it's all small plates / tapas family style here which works well.   Hummus with tahini with bread/veggies - hummus was tasty and not too paste-like. The bread was warm, soft, and fresh which went great with the hummus. The veggies were crisp and fresh.   Wagyu kebab - 50/50. Half of the meat was tender and soft while the other half was just too chewy. Flavor was good though.   Chicken kebab - it was good but the same as any chicken kebab I've had in the past.   Watermelon and feta with avocado, spiced nuts, and cucumbers salad - probably our favorite of the night! Super flavorful and very refreshing. Couldn't get enough.   Mushrooms with dates, hazelnuts, puffed rice - if you like mushrooms then this is the dish for you. The puffed rice adds nice crunch.   The special - lamb shank cooked over 10 hours falling off the bone with pomegranate glaze served over bed of lentils.  - the meat was literally falling off the bone. Super tender and tasty. Fills you up as it is a heavy decadent dish.   Sticky toffee pudding - butterscotch, walnut feuilletine, vanilla gelato - nice way to end the meal. The middle was hot and soft which went well with the gelato on top. Not too sweet. Satisfying.

Ie5Q1_2pMUo7EBt7nCatRA.text: Delicious! I was in tonight because of the 50% off locals offer-genius! Everything was really really good! Our server Jessica was fantastic and always checking up on the table!   I highly recommend the hummus appetizer and scallop entree.   My one complaint would be that the scallops came out cold but they were delicious anyway!   Highly recommended!

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple dessert! Yum!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cfH6ef93BeElu7b-g0LN3w.text: Cleo definitely was a pleasant surprise.  I expected it to be way overpriced and small portions and was very pleased with my entree.    To start off: the ambience is great.  It is a Mediterranean themed restaurant that serves entrees and tapas plates.  We had a party of about 15 so we opted to get our own meals per couple.  I got the lamb shwarma pita and it was absolutely delicious!! The plate was also massive and gave me about 12 ounces of meat.  I left stuffed!!    The starters I got were spicy potatoes with cilantro:  These were oven cooked in a semi spicy oil and served with aioli and of course Hummas w/ Tahini Sauce:  The flat bread it was served with was delicious and the hummus was great too.    The rest of the table seemed very please with their meals as well.  I will probably be back here at some point.

H0CWiqCx4oi6dCHL7RAk1A.text: Hands down the best Lebanese food in Vegas. Always met with great service. Spacious restaurant in the SLS Hotel. Quality of the food is outstanding.

jPFTYzTKcEWgPSAjk0XJdA.text: Monday was Industry Night here at Cleo, and it's the first one yet.  Maybe our server thought she wouldn't be tipped because my table of 6 felt ignored.   It took at least 20 minutes for her to greet the table, and from there another half hour to get the pita bread down (with the most amazing taziki sauce I've ever had- so I ordered more). From there the food flowed pretty well.   Borack wash DELISH ... Some sort of cheese filled crossaint ... You can't go wrong with that.  Taziki was phenomenal  Chef Ty is extremely slow (we had a nice view of his station and it was a bit painful.. Quinoa salad is really good There's a drink called Adriatic Fresh - get one... In fact, get three.  After he finally came around, The busser - Nick- was the best part of our experience. Super friendly and just plain awesome. I don't know where he was during the first 30 minutes of our meal but other bussers would come and pick up one thing, or nothing at all. At one point my friend piled dishes on the seat next to her, and I had some on the table stacked, hoping someone would clear it. The food runners should really be picking things up that are overcrowding the table so they can make room for the new items, our runner must've notice how much unused dish ware we had because she told us a busser would be over soon. Note she didn't take a single thing off of the table.  They need to really work on keeping tables bussed and unused items out of the way. Maybe throughout the meal drop new share plates...   It's unfortunate that almost a month after opening this place is still dis functional.   At one point I saw what looked like a customer (because she was in street clothes and holding a purse I assumed she was a customer) completely rip into a food runner. I couldn't tell what was going on but it happened on the floor in front of guests, management, staff... It was so awkward. After making out what she was saying she must've been a manager. It's extremely inappropriate to speak to your staff the way that woman did and esp on the floor! Take it to the back! Poor girl.   Regardless, the food was wonderful and the staff seemed happy. Smiles are contagious.  You'll get it guys! Keep up the positive attitudes!

8O-QaTvkbqNrEAVYM_3C2g.text: After an extra wait for my table to be set up (even though I had a RSVP) I must say I really enjoyed Cleo.  The flavorful food and attentive service really made it up.    Cleo is a tapas style restaurant.  All the dishes are in small portions, yet sharable.  If you have an appetite, make sure to order more than plate!  But here's a tip, order a few plates at a time to keep the food hot and fresh.  The dishes come out pretty quick, so don't worry about not having food on the table.  What's awesome is the oven they have that pumps out hot fresh breads.  To start, I really recommend the Hummus.  I tried many of the dishes and all of them were superb!  I would also say the pork belly and the kebabs are all worth trying.   On a busy wknd, make sure to have reservations!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fig and almond panacotta.
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple torte. Must have for dessert!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanger steak. Tender steak, but portion is very small.

9vXoIERMKOpYQ8SPrXCv4Q.text: This was my last night staying at the brand new SLS Las Vegas and I wanted to eat at one of the hotel's "signature" restaurants. Tapas seemed like a really "LA" thing to eat but Bazaar Meat was booked solid so I made a reservation for Cleo on the TV in the hotel room (nice touch) for 5:30pm, right when they opened. I arrived right at 5:30 on the dot and was seated promptly after the restaurant staff yelled "Opah!" in the back signalling open time I assume.  There was a server who saw my California t-shirt and asked if I was from NorCal, and I said, nope, SoCal. He was disgusted. In my head I was like "Eww, NorCal? Get the hella outta here!" Anyway, all in good fun.  A guy named Chad was my server and he was pretty upbeat and knowledgeable about the menu except for a little confusion on the Honey Citrus Sidecar on their cocktail menu. It says on the printed menu there's crushed mint in it (which I hate) but thankfully, just a misprint! The cocktail was oh so great with the honey, yuzu and Cointreau really setting off the Bulleit.  The SLS has restaurant menus on the TVs in the room too so I already knew what I wanted to order! After looking through a few reviews for the Hollywood outpost of Cleo, I settled on the Hummus, Falafel and Meatball Tagine. I don't have a very sophisticated palette so I didn't want to go too crazy on flavor profiles so I settled on things that looked familiar to me.  The hummus came out first with housemade Laffa bread that comes out of the brick oven piping hot in their signature paper bag. The hummus comes garnished with whole chickpeas and olive oil. It was fantastic and I couldn't stop ripping off more bread trying to sop up every last bit of it. The texture of the chickpeas helped to break up the smoothness of the hummus so it was a welcome addition.  Halfway through the hummus dish the falafel came out and was a great complement. I usually have falafel on pita bread with hummus so this was perfect. I ripped off a piece of laffa, spread some hummus on it and topped it with a piece of falafel. It was glorious. I could see how someone who was just having the falafel plate would need some sort of sauce or complementary item. The falafel itself comes topped with a garnish of onion on top of some tahini.  I thought I could handle two small plates but it was too much for one person so Chad was nice enough to start a to-go bag for me and wrapped it up before my meatball tagine came out! He was really attentive (I guess I was the first person inside so that kinda makes sense) and the busser regularly refilled my water.  When the meatball tagine came out I thought I could fit no more but when the server opened the lid, I knew I had SOME room. There were eight relatively small meatballs in a tomato sauce surrounding the softest cooked egg ever! I gently poked a hole in the yolk and started dipping the meatballs in. The creaminess and richness of the yolk were a welcome contrast to the tender meatballs. I really loved the presentation in the clay pot as well. I finished half of it and the busser packed the rest of it up (I think his name sounded something like Orozco).  All in all, it was a great experience, the service was great, the food and drink was great and the value was OK (I hate paying $14 for cocktails from "mixologists"). I would come back here for sure! Make sure to get a reservation if you're coming on a busier weekend night, it seemed like it could get extremely busy as the night progressed.

-SlbW94-94DkTQr7GMkJCQ.text: This was an interesting find. This was close to our hotel. We didn't know a lot about the casino. The casino is new and fairly clean. It is a young hip type of atmosphere. The restaurant was open to the kitchen and relaxed casual atmosphere. We were celebrating and requested a booth. We received a booth that was open to the kitchen. We are watching the staff stuff the fresh bread into paper bags and deliver them to the tables. The food was incredible. The plates were expensive but it is Vegas. We had the baba ghanouj, hummus, Greek salad, falafel, lamb euro, lamb chops, chicken kebab, kefta kebab. Food was delectable and we will definitely go again. Unfortunately we couldn't get to desserts.

iuOuTpfQJqbWBa9aB1-3Hw.text: So this place is amazing there food is so good and I love the open space in the restaurant it's one of my go to places when I come into town great pricing and the service is great good quite atmosphere this is for sure a one of a kind place I recommend trying if you like tapas and great food

yYVGm3g77uOwwcjdyoE1AA.text: Chef Thanawat is the best chef in the world! Cleo is lucky to have him! Every dish he makes is perfection.   The hummus is to die for. As well as the scallops and steak kabob. Everything we ordered was mouthwatering!  Thank you Thanawat!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3MiDTVWsKnvvkJBEVyBTpg.text: We found this place as a backup because the first Mediterranean I tried to book had no tables for a party of 8 until 9:30pm. Searching again and found this place had tables available at 7:30pm. So glad we did find it. The food was AMAZING. Since it is tapas, we ordered just a little of everything and we just wanted more.  My favorite item (if I had to just choose one) was the grilled octopus. But honestly, I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. If you are in Vegas, this should be a place you want to eat.

fpe54fHlFgvUp2y1zeY_OA.text: When you go to Cleo, you go big.  That was our motto last week as a group of 8 enjoyed all that Cleo had to offer.  Luckily, the SLS is still not very busy, but the restaurants are fantastic.  Cleo is a Tapas style restaurant that has a Mediterranean flair.  It was delicious.  We probably ordered about 20 items from the menu, and each was fantastic.  This was one of those rare dining experiences, where you can't go wrong.  If it sounds good to you, just get it.  And, depending on the size of the group, get two.  We went to Firefly the previous night, and Cleo brew Firefly out of the water.  I ate with the usual crew, including Mr. Riches.  As we typically have similar ratings for restaurants, Mr. Riches also agreed that this was a great meal.  This may have unseated one of my previous top 5 vegas restaurants.  After working in Vegas for about 4 months now, I have to say that the top 5 are: 1) Mix  2) L'atelier by Joel Robuchon 3) Bazaar Meat 4) Cleo 5) Prime  I'm sure that this rating will change as I continue to try different places.  Cleo is def. a place to try!

sYuxvzW9u1vffts563by5Q.text: I think this is the only five-star restaurant on the strip.  Everything here from the food to the service with five stars.  We had a great meal ordering one of almost everything believe it or not.  My favorite where the vegetable dishes the brussels sprouts were amazing.  I really don't think you can go wrong here.  The interior is absolutely beautiful which goes along with the SLS itself.  I will definitely come back here next time I'm in Vegas.

5tmz3lqskpkrE9hiDiyAEw.text: So good and affordable. The atmosphere is very cute. Perfect for a date or dinner with family. I love the Brussels sprouts, lamb shawarma, lebaneh with feta. Also the asparagus flatbread is to die for. My only complaint is our waitress acted like a stuck up model the whole time.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BiVnvTcSntcvtqREkmlMmA.text: Amazing food, attentive service, great location and decor! Manager engaged in conversation with us to make sure everything was perfect. Wish we lived closer, I'd be here all the time!!

hNzNQMdorZlx7Q0j7uhfog.text: Ridiculously good. The fresh warm pita with zaatar comes in a small brown paper bag. Great with any of the mezze dips. We got babaghanoush and lebneh (yogurt). We also got the brussel sprouts with cashews. Just the vinaigrette with the roasted sprouts is amazing. I can't explain the taste but if you like brussel sprouts, get this! For the main, my mom and I split the grilled branzino and the grilled octopus. The branzino was delicious. Perfectly grilled, and not too dry. The octopus wasn't cooked enough in my opinion. It's very hard to do, but it just wasn't the correct texture. Overall, Cleo is a great place. It's on the opposite end of the strip but just hop in an uber and have some delicious Mediterranean food!

RzXyAR8IKvVaeTW0rgK-0w.text: That beef thing that they offer is crazy good.  The bread is crazy fresh.  It's also crazy hot.  The ladies who frequent the area look crazy hot, but they're probably also just plain crazy crazy.  Vegas is crazy.  This place was crazy bumping for a Saturday night.  That's just crazy.  Garth Emery was spinning here across from Macy Gray; that's crazy weird.  Do you guys even remember Macy Gray?  I do; I'm crazy old.  Crazy.  Btw, the check-in offer is a scam.  You have to buy drinks and whatever; it's not just "free", so read the fine print.  Not Crazy; not good.

KBS_1cpaJZiS80A3c4xvtA.text: Stayed at the SLS and decided to try this place out of convenience and I'm glad we did!   Cleo is a tapas style Mediterranean/Italian style place. It's slightly upscale in attire and environment but not overly so. You can make reservations with the SLS front desk when the restaurant is closed.   Four of us sat to dine and were pretty impressed by the plates we ordered. We tried the hummus, which comes with this great, fluffy bread, the Brussels sprouts (a must try, really well seasoned), grilled octopus, the burrata salad, the spinach and ricotta dumplings (also a must have) and the roman flat bread. The plates are smaller than the norm, but great for tapas style sharing. Even with four people everyone had plenty to eat from all of the plates. The food was more than enough to fill us up and it came out to about $30 per person with drinks. Not bad!   When they ask you about water, say tap unless you don't mind paying $9 per bottle.   Our waiter was really friendly and helpful when explaining the menu. Also, if you're interested in checking out SLS's club Life, ask your waiter about it and see if he or she can get you any bonuses like front of the line passes or something!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and Ricotta dumplings

UGaMfGbT3bIv4K7XUF0ksQ.text: Delicious food & good service. We just walked by & couldn't sure it good or not. Then made decision to walk in & eat by the rating of yelp. Thanks the yelp app which is really help us a lot.

kggYS-6x-3H5dEjttkmEUg.text: I'm pretty sure I was sat at the worst table in the entire restaurant because throughout my meal every single waiter and waitress kept walking behind me. There should not be a table at the end of the marble counter top if that's the area most employees use to walk through.   I ordered:  Hummus with Laffa bread- too much cumin used as a garnish, hummus was so generic in taste and not smooth enough. Laffa bread came out piping hot in a bag but was bland and I know it used as a canvas but because I did not like the hummus I would have liked for it to stand on it's own  Chicken kabob-first one was better than the second. second one was undercooked, luke warm, and did not taste made to order   Lamb kefta kabob- cooked well but not enough seasoning to enhance the natural flavors of the lamb  Shishito peppers-did not like that these were whole because I was eating seeds. They were also greasy and the best part was the Parmesan sprinkled on top   Watermelon salad- none of the ingredients in the salad were very good. Watermelon and avocado were both over ripe, I liked the flavors they were going for in this dish but they needed to use better ingredients and lay off on the dill   Our first waitress had a screechy voice and our second waitress didn't even bring a dessert or do anything special considering it was my friends birthday.   The best thing about Cleo is the hobbit house like atmosphere.

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flatbread
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb kefta and chicken kabob

O1WBTmYsDM9qAquEtw9m0g.text: Amazing amazing food. You have to try the Brussels sprouts and Greek salad!! The Haloumi was great too

BrfY-BKUOd8dgTDfX6bOhw.text: Excellent service, atmosphere and food!  Try the sliders, wood fired Brussel sprouts, beet salad, hummus and flatbed pizzas, I would rate all a 10!  Also try the vinebury cocktails for a spicy fun refreshing drink!

7kcHY88J2Z5pNzuo8fVPrA.text: Fabulous food, service and atmosphere!  You will love them all.  We were given friendly and excellent recommendations. Highly recommended are the delectable Mediterranean potatoes which were tossed in cumin, wood-fired and served with a cilantro aioli.  Also delicious were the hummus, the dolmades, and the chicken kebab.  Without a doubt, we will be returning to Cleo on our next trip to Vegas. Thanks so much!

3lz09VfbaCvwdy62UQ8w3w.text: This place is great. But the waiter will advise 3 tapas per person. The portions are large so 2 per person is right, even if you show up hungry. Our 10 person group wasted a lot of food because we ordered 3 pp instead of 2 pp. anything with lamb is fantastic, as is the grilled octopus

Ge0Hrv3O8kk-lNRVkvI0sQ.text: Cleo was easily the best food experience we had in Vegas. Our group of 10 raved about bright tasty flavors and how fresh everything was. Some favorites were the lebnah with feta (order extra to put on kebabs!), Greek Salad, Wagyu Beef, house pickles, bread (that came in a cute stamped paper bag,) and everything from the dessert menu. The food was amazing, even to the snobbiest Seattle foodie in our group. We loved sharing it all family style while hoarding the best like the crispy brussels sprouts at one end.   The decor is elegant, playful and interesting. The mismatched vintage dishes were gorgeous and old books and Egyptian "artifacts" line the top shelf along the sides of the restaurant. It is so original in any city but it was an especially nice break from some of the overly-themed restaurants on the strip.   To top off our perfect night, Chef Thanawat came out to say hi and meet us. He is a genius in the kitchen and is fun and infectious character to boot. We so appreciated our special night at Cleo. It was a highlight of our 4 days in Vegas and I would come back just to have dinner there again. Thanks Cleo!

N_n8byjKrL-5b51LSNasWQ.text: My friend chose this place and I loved it!! First let me say Lindsey was our waitress and she was beautiful, attentive & informative.   Extremely comfortable, clean with an eccentric, quirky vibe. We started with the Brussels sprouts which is a must order! The sprouts are literally pulled off leaf by leaf and charred in seasoning & oil that just melts in your mouth. Hands down the best sprouts I've ever eaten. Hummus was good & served with homemade flaky pita bread. Cauliflower was next and again an amazing vegetable side dish. I initially ordered the Schwarma as my entree but they ran out. Lindsey had informed us there were only a few left and she would hurry and put our order in, but unfortunately it didn't work out. I settled for my 2nd choice, Moussaka. This dish was different than other Moussaka I've had but it was delicious, very light but awesome flavor. My friend had the scallops which looked amazing, all 5 of them!!She ate every bite so I'm taking that as a plus. The portions are small which I appreciate. We were able to share everything, enjoy our own entrees and leave feeling satisfied, but not gluttonous. All of our food, 2 cocktails & 1 beer and our bill was $125 which I consider very reasonable for Vegas. I highly recommend Cleo and I'm excited to return. I definitely want to try their lamb on my next  go round. I hope your dining experience is as wonderful as mine.

GJiaoKo98fQsWcvF-QwZNg.text: I've been twice now to Cleo. Both times I've let the waitresses choose a salad, a veggie, a protein and desert. Both times were completely different choices and both time where spot on. The food and service make this the best dinner spot in Vegas.

g_L18jUUjwLBv8xAIY4Kdg.text: YUM!! Best Med food I've ever had in Vegas. Great service. Chicken Tangine was amazing...excellent Humus and Pita was perfect!

U93tummCN8IOnV8Fiwb9aw.text: great food, high end, super fast service, well done food, awesome to have this option in vegas

UNiopbMHJD0EII-1zjqqXw.text: This place is excellent! From the atmosphere to the cocktails they do it right. Patrick was an excellent and knowledgable server. The lamb tapas plate was excellent as were the hummus and the salads. Wine selection by the glass is sparse but Patrick made excellent and appropriately paired recommendations. Great, unrushed dining experience.

ewdz677DIrf2Wc0lBENFqw.text: Omg...you're  an idiot if you don't eat here. Best meal in Vegas in 15 years. Recommend: hummus, falafel, shrimp sauce amazing, flatbread kale (of course), branzini, Israeli wine. Amazing.

v8u8-Y350z1Pcrfop51bQA.text: We had dinner there last night.   The food was excellent and the service was even better. Ricardo delivered the best service I have had at any restaurant anywhere.  The manager Spencer stopped by our table he was very accommodating and gave us a complimentary appetizer. It truly was a great dining experience and a great way to kick off the weekend. Great job!

PW1zWK8ySe4Lq8z-bj-Neg.text: Great food!! Great ambience in the little side tables with the great chandeliers. Only complaint was the strange lag time where our waitress disappeared and we really wanted to order more. Other than that, fantastic food! We'll be back!

6UB0qRh4OaSoJOp6pj_HiQ.text: Kitchen was closing at 10:30pm . We arrived (group of 6) at 10:20pm  they took us in no problem! Lexie the girl working in the front was so sweet, she gave us a beautiful private room & Christine our waitress was amazing! We had a bunch of questions and she answered every one of them! Food was amazing & service was great! Loved the ambience ! Highly recommend ! Go there if you want a snack not when you're super hungry

iuUOtoM2DTc73AXpQqlnEA.text: Love this Mediterranean gem! Very good service too. Love their Hummus, Spicy Cigars, Roasted Lamb, & Wagyu Kebabs for the big win:))). Grilled Octopus was only just okay. We look forward to returning to try the rest of their menu's creative offerings.

kvxXEcnxViCp47xheRIgjg.text: Love at first bite! A perfect combination of two of our favorite things - tapas and Mediterranean. Also, the customer service is outstanding. The staff, our waitress Dani and the manager, Peter, went out of there way to make this a special evening for my husband's Bday.

ftgRkmGqScJok_eR0NdLhQ.text: This is the worse lamb I ever had. And the donut duck was meh too. Brussels sprouts had too much vinegar.  Chicken liver was good with hot bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nHJpgxShB5lYdTq0Cs1nBg.text: When we dined at Cleo, they had been open a mere five days. I expected a shaky kitchen, spotty service and a healthy dose of chaos. What I experienced was some of the most flavorful Middle-Eastern/Mediterranean cuisine I'd ever tasted-- brought to our table by a server who's knowledge of the menu was as encyclopedic as she was adorable-- all in a vibrant, exciting atmosphere. Some favorites were the wagyu and pork belly kababs, grilled octopus, mushrooms, brussels sprouts and the duck bastilla-- but nearly everything we had (12 small plates in all) was incredibly flavorful and well-prepared. And don't let me forget the cocktails. We ordered six or seven different drinks throughout our meal-- all superb-- and each one had some little unexpected twist to the flavor profile that paired perfectly with the exotic spices in the food. We'll be back!

EUL_qT1pKGezcgn5-2tK-A.text: I would give this place 5 but we arrived at 9 and got the "kitchen is closing...." line.  I completely understand but its 9pm in vegas hardly late. Anyway, despite that service was good. Food came out almost all at ince due to the "lateness". Food was outstanding. The only thing i would not order again was the flatbread and dips.  The bread should be pita. The dips were underseasoned. The lamb tagine, octopus etc were very very good. The dessert was memorable. Would definitely come back.

wI9NUYA92F86Pqgyl4i8qA.text: The scallops are to die for. The service is amazing. The scenery is beautiful. I'll be back again.

VSpvC5foj2xEaBrf_NLYIQ.text: The wagu beef was to die for amazing and worth the "upgraded" price! However, This place is pricey considering how small the portions are otherwise this place would get 4-5 stars.

tzhBlxCscPwSks9LJvA58w.text: We had an excellent meal at Cleo last week. The server was careful to check which menu items could be prepared vegan (which was a lot!). The Brussels Sprouts and Mushrooms with Dates were the highlight of the meal.

y416Q6GPPRNZkjmlJAzigg.text: Some items were delicious, overall mediocre on the $60 prix fox menu. The stars were the brussel sprouts, hummus, cigars, and the lamb was perfect. The flat bread did not look or taste appealing, only had 1 bite. The waitress was not familiar with the wines and couldn't answer basic questions which was disappointing. Otherwise, the service was great and the environment quiet and romantic, if seated in the back. The front section was open to the casino and likely more noisy.

beqghFlaYPOijirxo1gijQ.text: A fantastic experience... Food absolutely delicious, so many flavors to experience... Spencer the Manager gets five stars.... Don't miss this one at SLS LAS VEGAS!!!!

Rzjl7B5uYiyjJ7DcTg0MuQ.text: WOW - Cleo Las Vegas is just amazing on every level.  We were so excited to try this place and it topped our expectations.  The only downside for Cleo is that the SLS Hotel is just a dark depressing place, so tough location, but the restaurant is so good we will be visiting the LA location this weekend.    Service is top notch - couldn't be any better.  And the food...OMG - every dish was spectacular.  We ordered: Yogurt Cucumber dip, Hummus, Pork Belly, Falafel, Spanakopita, Clam with Noodles, Spicy Potatoes, Grilled Octopus, and of course double orders of that amazing bread.  The only thing we would skip next time would be the Hummus - the rest was just beyond words.  We skipped dessert - just too full, but next time we will definitely be trying that Sticky Toffee Pudding.    If you're in Vegas - Cleo is a must!!!  DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!

UJ1Sv_SjWTBkXiK2lSjCAg.text: Very slow service. Expect to be here a few hours for dinner. Food was overall good, just very slow.

MSOmWKA4fCBLvnd16VSdSQ.text: Amazing!    We went here for Valentine's Day dinner.  Everything was fantastic.  Waiter and busboy were attentive. Food was delicious especially Brussels sprouts.   Beet salad was amazing too.  But everything really was good.  Wine was perfect as well.  We can't wait to come back and order off traditional menu.   Burp.

oNG7IOGd529yy84FmRHhjg.text: All in all, one of the best meals I've ever eaten! The service and the food is tremendous. Cleo is a tapas type of place and the staff spaces it out so you have time between each course to eat slowly and take it all in. There were two of us and we ordered six dishes. We ordered the brussel sprouts, lamb shawarma, scallops, wagyu kebab, mushroom flatbread, and the sticky toffee pudding for dessert. Each were delicious but I specifically recommend the wagyu, brussel sprouts, and lamb shawarma! The sticky toffee pudding comes out warm with a beautiful presentation and just melts in your mouth. Our server helped us and was extremely attentive and even gave us recommendations for our next couple of days at Red Rock! Thankfully there is a Cleo in LA and so excited to visit again!

cFF81ovIsfEw0IbKF9gWvQ.text: OK food just very expensive .  $100 plus tip gets you two drinks, Brussels spouts appetizer, flatbread and octopus plate.  Basically 3 appitizers. Good but not that good.  I don't mind spending the money for good food but this left me wanting In N Out.

AgN-PzJSrix0TSQfS7LOtQ.text: Beautiful restaurant  Warm, friendly service  Fair pricing and proper portions  Kibbeh Nayyeh - Fresh and clean, delicate flavors, simply delicious Lamb Shawarma - Tender, well-seasoned meat that melts in your mouth Brussel Sprout Hearts with Hazelnut - fried delight Lebaneh with Feta - so good and creamy with one piece of warm home baked bread  Can't wait to return!

KvOPtabTACTRUDAfpiBkJQ.text: We were standing at the bar while waiting for a table.... We happened to look over and all 3 chefs were continuously crouching down to shove food in there mouths and preceding to handle food without washing their hands.... As we stood there for a second, we were still considering eating but we couldn't believe they just kept doing that.. As if no one could see them... It's so unprofessional... & a health hazard... We took our drinks and told the hostess we changed our mind... Hope this brings light to what is happening behind the scenes.. One word.. Gross!!

hFoVa8vxkJAuZHrZhnOy1A.text: Always excellent hospitality at SLS restaurants. Always leaves me with the desire of wanting to come right back. Great food, super friendly staff, and the manager, Jesus,  on top of everything. Bazaar you're next..

k_2dCwADaSXvFNGV-bNZDQ.text: Even if you're not staying at The SLS Hotel and Casino on the famous Las Vegas Strip, you might want to consider making the drive there to have dinner at Cleo.  The three of us had a Fabulous dinner.  It's small plates of very tasty food.  We had the pickles, veggie sticks and hummus and falafel to start.  Then we had the beet salad; the salmon & chicken kebabs; the garlic shrimp; the Duck Bastilla and Grilled Octopus.  Did I say fabulous!

qqNkahejp-EcCYoBI3P9bg.text: Excellent fiod!! Tapas style, I had the Greek salad, hummus dip and the Lamb sliders. fresh and great combination of flavors. The flatbread if amazing  .

0T_Q2sWa7RFLP6WfDAC3rg.text: Decided we were looking for something a bit different in Vegas one night - and found Cleo's nearby our hotel. Arrived early (6pm) and ordered the tasting menu for two. Every course was spot on - and food was plentiful (unlike many tasting menus). In fact, we ended up taking some of it home we were so full. Favorite dishes were grilled octopus and sticky toffee pudding. two small complaints - because we were one of just a few tables, the food came out rather quickly. Normally that would be fine, but with a tasting menu (and their portions) we needed a bit of time to rest which we didn't get. The only other complaint was about their 'famous brussel sprouts' - while they were good, they had gone just a tad far for our taste and had a tinge of bitterness as a result. They were the only dish we didn't finish or take home.

B3AV7JWAD8P5Y3LcvQcOkA.text: Love coming here. Many choices. Had a bad experience last time. Undercooked octopus. Had heartburn too. Overall, the food is great, service is ok. Location is perfect. Easy to grab a quick bite. Love the bread, lebne and Brussel sprouts

jMJ5r0wUGVKGoa9K3yFsXg.text: OMG... Was this a shining star in an otherwise horrible casino!!! It deserves 5 stars, but it's in the hellhole otherwise known as SLS & there's NO cell service ANYWHERE! I went last week & would've liked to check in, but alas, NO CELL SERVICE! Anyways, on to my very positive review. We had reservations & were seated immediately. Our waiter was Ricky & he was fantabulous!!!  Everything from the cocktails to the dishes to the dessert was GREAT!!! I have to give a shoutout to the cocktail Clementina - it's sweet, spicy & fabulous just like the food! They are smaller plates, but the waitstaff will try & tell you it's 4-5 plates a person-I THINK NOT! They are larger than the normal tapas so maybe just 2 a person... You can always order more! We had a little of everything from Mezzes to Raw to Salads to Vegetables to Meats & ALL were wonderful, but a special shoutout must go to the Grilled Octopus-it was to DIE for!!! This comes from a girl who HATES to eat Cephalopods, but it was like having beautiful bites of white steak... I still can't put into words how yummy it truly was!!! We finished our meal with splitting the Sticky Toffee & it was great, too! I really have no complaints other than the location of the restaurant & of course, it's very expensive...over a $100 a person, but well worth it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Clementina &amp; it was one of the BEST cocktails that I&#39;ve ever had!!!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the Lotus Flower &amp; truly yummy!!!

HTxWTEiEe-OhgwEW1wMQAQ.text: Gonna make this short and sweet. Everything tasted great, service was great. Tried almost everything on their menu and couldn't find one thing I disliked. Servers were friendly and helpful. Would definitely go back again.

53pV96Whn0Jw2NhxNevMGA.text: Amazing! No other words. The dips are all sooo good. The tzaziki was the best I've ever had in any Greek restaurant. Went to the one in Miami as well and same. However restaurant was empty, literally 2 tables. Was really shocked by this. Not sure why it's not getting the recognition it deserves. The service was excellent as well. The Miami location was packed and has a great reputation down there.

6UlRn_n10KBy-2M_4M7tgQ.text: I was not impressed with the hotel itself... It smelled funny, parking lot elevator was slow and old... I guess not much has changed since sahara. Definitely not as fancy as SLS @ Los Angeles. We weren't prepared for Jose Andreas' restaurant (financially, lol shame on us) So instead, we explored the casino, and Cleo seemed like our next best option. We decided to walk in, and a friendly hostess seated us immediately. It was around 8pm on Friday night, and the restaurant was approx. 90percent full. I saw a lot of couples, and one bachelorette party group of 10. Sexy exotic ambience with gorgeous chandelier, fire place, and open kitchen in the middle of the floor. We immediately order Hummus and Tahini, because a couple next to us was killing it. (Another couple who saw us eating it ended up ordering the same thing too) A hot and fluffy artisan bread came w/ dip and it was heavenly. I was pretty full off the bread and dip, but we went ahead and ordered some more: garlic shrimp, squid and rice, and one sausage I can't remember the name (lamb). All were uniquely flavored, and reasonably priced. We will definitely come back for more. Hopefully we get to be seated by the kitchen next time :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid rice w/ saffron mashed potato and black rice (right) garlic shrimp (left)
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus and Tahini Dip w/ bread

Ir2V6QAvFglSKPsrIS8Adg.text: This is one of those times that I wish there was a way to do 3 1/2 stars because I have mix feelings about this place so I am going with 4 because there were more good things than negative.  I just wish this place was in a different hotel/ casino or location. For some reasons this casino is so quiet and empty with a strange feeling to it. walking to the restaurant makes you feel you are going somewhere not very popular. The restaurant set up is very nice and we loved the decor, detail touches and the atmosphere but honestly we were very surprised to be one of the only 3 tables there. It was very empty and quiet so that make it little less exciting.   But the food made up for it. Even though it's kind of a pricey place with a smaller portions but the food tasted good.

c01rkqeI1VXYCThi_XIr-g.text: The decor is beautiful, felt like I was in a riad in Casablanca. The space was large, I liked the booths placed around and in the middle, as well as the counter seating if you feel like watching the chefs prepare the food.  We were immediately greeted by a very enthusiastic, borderline annoying server. He was really nice, so I can't be too annoyed. He started us out with his two top cocktails on the menu, I went with the Old Hollywood and my friend had the Garbo. I'm a fan of a good hand crafted cocktail, both of these were really good, but I did prefer the the Garbo.  Onto the food. I eat a lot of Middle Eastern food, a lot. I did see some interesting items on the menu. For instance, Kibbeh Nayyeh, I've only found this on the menu at Ali Baba here in town. And it's usually beef, not lamb. I do love Kibbeh Nayyeh.   We tried the brussels sprouts app, which was good (how can you get that wrong) as well as the Duck Bastilla and Lamb Tangine which I found both to be extremely gamey (I love both duck and lamb, and I've never had either item taste as gamey as it did here). We also tried the Kale Flatbread which was my favorite item.   I can't say I was blown away with my experience here. I've had far better Middle Eastern food around town.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kale Flatbread
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Tagine
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck Bastilla

SDIUIx-yfrLDXy_SiKGcpg.text: Amazing! Delicious!  I can't give this place enough accolades for the food.  Tapas! must for those unsure of what to order.  Small plates of many foods.  The tasting menu provides all the best sellers.  Every item on that menu was incredible.  Beautiful eclectic decor and wait staff that will explain all the dishes to you.  I'm coming back tomorrow night!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Tapas! A bit of everything..

RWmsKCpc5LARP0YEZA8ZxA.text: This place is amazing.   Stand outs include the Bread w hummus, Brussels sprouts, lamb chops, mushrooms and just about everything! These dishes are so flavorful it's crazy.   There's also some potent teas and fun mixed drinks.   You will not be disappointed. Prepare to have a great experience.

zwKsUCSKfl25X5IjgSUBgw.text: Went there during WSA shoe show. The food was good but a bit salty, need to pair with some cocktail drinks. Love their fig penna cotta, so creamy and the fig omg so fresh and sweet! Go try this restaurant people~

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qP4xAeCuwVuQ4IH4rtPTIw.text: Dear Cleo. Can I call you Cleo? Or is it too casual for the Queen of Egypt, better known as Cleopatra? You're my favorite restaurant at the SLS. Not that the others aren't good, but you're simply the best. An affordable Mediterranean culinary experience, with so many different flavors and adapted diet options if you're vegan or gluten-intolerant, a simple yet refined decor, and a great staff. I brought two friends with me there to taste the locals Special Summer Menu. Wait... A 5-course menu, on the Strip, for $35? You must be kidding me. Well... Not at all, this is an awesome deal indeed! Just add $20 for a wine pairing. Humus and feta spread cheese, Brussels sprouts, spicy cigars, beet salad, Greek salad, steak or shrimps, and an amazing chocolate cake (gluten-free) or a sticky pudding as desserts. Small portions, but in the end and after the fourth course we were already full. We left the place with the feeling of being privileged as locals, again with just the right amount of attention from the staff. Not too present, but always careful to our needs and super friendly. So, Dear Cleo, I will visit you again soon, if you don't mind of course. Thanks again guys, we had a blast.

Om8zIDTxhdZL8z6cgrp4rA.text: Great Mediterranean flare and drinks! My husband and I stopped by their happy hour and enjoyed tantalizing appetizers. Everything is house made with fresh ingredients and you can taste the difference! Waitress was also very accommodating with food allergy. Would definitely recommend!

c6ZfWsV42PhfpV-xcV2nMQ.text: Had one of the most memorable and lovely dinners in recently memory tonight at Cleo. Happened upon a review totally randomly a few hours ago and very glad that we decided to bite the bullet and drive here to try it out.   The list of "greatest hits" on other Yelp reviews is absolutely correct. The range of Mediterranean influences and balance of flavors is really unique and totally delicious. All cocktails are fine tuned & even wines by the glass are all standout.  Our server Manny made a great meal something very special. Knowledgeable, honest with a great sense of humor - Thank you!!

zZ9iGdmJPtYu3wCPHtYj-A.text: Food was great! Especially the Chicken Tagine, Wagyu and Watermelon Salad. The Sticky Toffee Pudding is a must for desert! Like eyes roll into the back of your head good! :) Nada was a great waitress too!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon Salad

JhAnJvgvGu4-Sm6YvvRXPw.text: Amazing culinary experience !!!! Meats was amazing, I recommend the mushrooms and the kebab plate.

ItVjfcp2afcMNrR3bIYo6w.text: This was excellent. We were staying at the SLS so this made a good choice for Christmas dinner. It is small plates, so you got to taste a little bit of everything. Had a few drinks before our table was ready, normal prices. We tried the cucumber yogurt dip with laffa (flatbread), pick 3 kebabs (lamb kefta, and wagyu, and longanisa sausage), the harira soup and apple strudel for dessert. I enjoyed everything and it was plenty for me for dinner, however I think my husband was a bit hungry afterwards. $80+tip and service was excellent.

5GxV_k_fSCf-lDUPPwQ6Gw.text: Debating between three and four stars..  went to the Mothers Day Brunch.  Pros - the buffet selections were amazing!  Our favorites were the Greek salad, hummus, grilled pita, bottomless mimosas, and the Bloody Mary bar.  The value was fantastic.  Cons - the hostesses and servers were clueless.  We arrived a bit early.  They asked for us to start the line in one direction...  then ended up changing it to the other side.  Two parties walked up after we arrived and were sat before us without waiting in line even though we also had reservations.  We sat down and the server was very nice, however, had no idea if we were to get our own coffee and mimosas or if they brought them.  She said that she was figuring everything out.  They should pre-shift their staff before opening the doors.  Also, tables are very tight.  I had to wiggle in and out of my chair just so I didn't bump into the person behind me.

a73CL1ezBSgTKJFpRenJLw.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here from the brussel sprouts to the Greek salad to the scallops and greens to the kale flat bread.  All of our dishes were carefully prepared and we both thought everything was so tasty and filling.  They also have a lovely wine selection.  Service was so friendly, cheerful and open to answering our questions.  The restaurant ambiance makes you forget you are in casino, and their prices are reasonable.  I would highly recommend this restaurant in the SLS casino/hotel as we had a very pleasant dining experience here.
