Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops and greens
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek salad and brussel sprouts

w2PglNrYsDrJ98gMv3lUug.text: The Skinny: some well executed dishes with some mediocre ones makes this joint a (3.5). Service: our servers were okay but our busboy was freaking amazing! Best busboy ever! (5 stars for the busboy, 3 stars for the servers), value: although a bit on the pricey side for Mediterranean, some of the outstanding dishes are worth returning for (3.5 with a bump up to 4 starred review).  We came during the half priced locals deal on a Sunday. Overall as a Mediterranean high end joint, I was a little skeptical if it was going to be worth it.  Just FYI, service is a bit confusing. We had two servers check in on us with regards to our table so we weren't really certain who we needed to talk to if we needed anything. In terms of explaining the menu, it wasn't immediately clear how many dishes we need to order as a tapas styled restaurant. So just so you know - 2.5-3 dishes/person depending if you order the mezze (smaller dishes) vs. a larger grilled dish.   We tried their hummus with laffa bread, spinach salad with figs, mushrooms with hazelnuts, lamb tagine with harissa, moussaka and duck bastilla.  They started us off with some great little puff pastries stuffed with cheese (I think it was feta). Piping hot, the cheese just oozed lusciously from the crisp layers. Really wonderful way to start a meal!  Hummus with laffa bread coated in za'taar was good. The hummus needs to be mixed a bit before digging in but the flavors were solid. The laffa bread came hot and mildly crispy in a bag on the table.  Spinach salad - also quite nice. I didn't realize that it came with blue cheese (which didn't add anything to the dish) and would have preferred it without. Loved the combination of figs and vinegar dressing.   Mushrooms roasted with hazelnuts were the hands down best dish we had that night. The perfectly golden crust along the crunch of the hazelnuts were fabulous. If you love mushrooms, you will love this dish. It is possibly one of the best dishes I have had all year.  Lamb tagine with harissa: lamb was quite tender however it was a tad bland for me. Would have been nicer with a bit more ?preserved lemons to give it a bit more acidity. Overall, just an okay dish for me.  After this set of dishes, there was lengthy wait about 15 minutes until the next dish. Unlike our server who promised multiple times that our dish was coming, our busboy pretty much made sure we got our dish while keeping our water glasses full and tending to a irate customer who was allergic to nuts who found nuts in her dish. I was impressed with our busboy. He did an excellent job and I wish he was our server instead.  Moussaka: ugh! did not like this dish at all. First of all, the dish was served stone cold in the middle.  Second of all, there was too much nutmeg in this dish - making it taste really off and odd. Never had moussaka like this before. We had to send it back.  Duck Bastilla: this dish was meh and not up to my expectations. In my opinion, the filling was a too wet for me and spiced correctly (needed a lot more cinnamon). The lack of nuts was also very surprising. I would skip this dish.  We finished off with the almond pannacotta with figs. It was okay - the texture was a bit too solid and not quite silky smooth enough. Flavor wise, it was rather uninteresting. I would probably skip this next time.  Overall, given the stellar dishes we received, this joint is worth another look. The service we received by our busboy was phenomenal however the servers were sort of lackluster although they did take off the horrible moussaka after we sent it back. 3.5 starred review with a bump up to 4.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panna cotta with figs and toadted almonds
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck bastilla
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moussaka

4IZq9tesGgdN8jTO6FB4og.text: We stopped in after having drinks at the monkey bar with my company's owners. Normally food always follows after some drinking and since Umami Burger and their staff completely blow it and embarrassed me after I spoke so highly of them we decides to eat here.   Let me just say I truly redeemed myself with this one. The Greek Mediterranean food was excellent the atmosphere was perfect even though we had to split the party into two booths of 6 or 7 people each.   The wait staff was great but the best part was everything...except for the Grilled squid with saffron mash potatoes and black rice. I normally love squid and all that but it was so fishy and gross I almost threw up at the table. Besides that the rest of the dishes were amazing. We had the lamb sliders, garlic shrimp, hummus, hanger steak, lamb shawarma, moussaka (oh the moussaka), duck bistilla, spinach and ricotta dumplings, bone marrow, raviolo, the spinnacota pretty much the whole menu and bottles and bottles of Stella Rossa! Wow were those all good can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.    Everything was pretty much tapas slash family style so order lots to share because  the little that you do get is all so good. Resturant of coarse was hip and trendy but by all means not trashy very up scale but at the same time very comfy.   One of the best spots to eat at SLS Las Vegas. If you are considering it just do it you will not be disappointed, just stay away from the seafood selections unless you really want the ocean!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb shawarma, duck bistilla and moussaka oh my god were these all so good!!!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorry I didn&#39;t get much pix I was with 20 business peeps and didn&#39;t want to get all ghetto phone piling all the food!

_2eeUt6pZ1rFwmJlT1ft9Q.text: We love Cleo LA, so when visiting Las Vegas last weekend, we wanted to check out the other Cleo! Upon entering, the host/hostess and waiter were all very pleasant. We had a 7pm reservation on Friday night, and the restaurant had a few tables full, but was still pretty quiet. Like the LA version, it is well-decorated and has a dark, cozy feel to it. The tables are a bit more spacious/spread apart in this restaurant compared to LA.   To start, our friend and my husband each ordered a drink. I ordered a mocktail, and my husband jokingly said to our friend how when I order mocktails, he wants to start asking for the alcohol on the side (a la when I order an omelette and ask for the cheese on the side for him to have extra cheese), as drinks are many times only a $1 or 2 cheaper without the alcohol. Our waiter overheard this and happily suggested he bring over the alcohol on the side in a shot glass. My husband and our friend (who actually ended up drinking the shot) both got a big kick out of this. As a side note, my fauxito was very good too. Not all club soda, as many can be.  The food was quite good as usual, and the menu was almost identical to Cleo LA, with one exception: it tasted like a full salt shaker was used to cook most items. Other than that, the sauteing on each dish was good, the serving size was good - not too big or small and the pacing that the dishes were brought out was good. We shared:  - Eggplant, Fennel, Chili - Had a vinegar taste to it. Very delicious! The texture of the eggplant wasn't slimy as eggplant can sometimes be, but rather melt-in-your-mouth. The eggplant pieces were thinly sliced.  - Mushrooms - The dates and hazelnuts really add great flavor but let the mushroom shine. Big pieces of mushroom too! The puffed rice adds a nice texture to this and the mushrooms are truly perfectly sauteed here. I preferred these mushrooms to the ones on the flatbread.  - Artichoke, Lemon, Olives - I'm a huge artichoke fan and this didn't disappoint. Lemon is always fantastic with artichoke and they executed this dish well. There were a lot of kalamata olives present, which also worked especially well with the lemon.  - Brussels Sprout Hearts, Hazelnuts, Fresno Chili - I preferred these to Cleo's more famous brussels sprouts. This was almost more of a warm salad, and the soft hearts paired nicely with the many hazelnuts (provided a good crunch) that were in it.  - Seasonal Mushroom Flatbread - Cheesy and nice thin crust. Thick, hefty mushrooms that were well-placed all throughout the flatbread. Didn't taste much in the way of fresno chili that the menu suggested, though.  - Flourless Chocolate Cake - The cake was good, though I wish there was a bit more of a molten center! The cool vanilla gelato, as usual, was the perfect accompaniment, and the best bite was when you got both together. The only thing I'd really change is that a half of a banana was sauteed and served on the side, but served still in its skin. It was kind of odd to keep the banana skin on. When you dug in, the inside was a good texture, but I only had one bite of that, as the outside skin was very odd.  Overall, we love that Cleo offers so much variety and something for everyone. If they tone down the salt a bit on the vegetables, they'll really be in business!

bxAslAJM8MGnvBaYB701tw.text: Every time I walk past Cleo, I must pause for the most intoxicating smell that wafts into the casino. I have been dying to try it- no better time to try it than the new SLS promotion of #socialsundays. 50% off a different restaurant for locals! (On Sundays).  I was seated right next to the big wood fire oven and OMFG the smell of like garlic and flatbreads was hypnotic. As many of the restaurants at The SLS, plates are meant for sharing, and I thought you get a lot more than the usual tapas size. Plus, the prices here (even if it wasn't the special locals promotion) were very good- between $7-$15 for plates.  The cocktail menu was very unique and delicious. The one I had was the clementina. It's was citrusy and spicy. It complimented my meal so well.  The food was perfection. Everything I had was kissed with roasted yummy goodness. The warm bread for my hummus - omg soooo good.  Plus- I had the greatest server ever- Jessica. She asked if there was anything I didn't like (olives) and made sure she left them out of everything I ordered. She really cared about making my experience great and I felt that.   I felt like I was British royalty visiting Egypt for camel races and was truly delighted by my most decadent meal. (When you eat here, you can pick your own fantasy).  I will be back, Cleo!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious hummus and warm bread in the bag.
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the best pork belly I&#39;ve ever had!

xjXxjysgHKvSpkAqqkzapw.text: We organized a corporate dinner at Cleo, and the menu we had stated family style. Hardly. Everyone left still hungry. The food was just ok, nothing special, especially for the price.   I'd never go back.

W4FCaD23_CzAoC28jSiJlA.text: We went to the restaurant for my friend's bachelorette dinner. We made a 9:30 reservation, but being a group of girls, we were running a little late. We ended up showing up at 9:55 (the restaurant closed at 10 pm that night). They were nice enough to still seat us and get our order in and served in a timely manner, without making us feel rushed.   We got the following items: brussel sprouts, mushrooms, potato latke, spinach and ricotta dumplings, the artichoke flatbread, the merquez and roman flatbread, and the three dips - hummus, cucumber and yogurt and carrot harissa. We also ordered 2 bottles of wine - there wasn't enough wine in the bottle for the girls that wanted white, so the server was nice enough to just go grab an extra glass for her.   The brussel sprouts and mushroom dishes were phenomenal!!! The two best things we ate that night. I was least impressed with the flatbreads...in comparison to the other dishes we had. The flatbread was extremely thin and crispy, so not heavy at all, but just felt like it could have used more flavor. The spinach and ricotta dumpling tasted very similar to a very soft piece of ravioli.   Overall the dinner was delicious and we all enjoyed it thoroughly! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting vegas and will most likely be visiting again when I am back in town!

LrkZMTYb-PeN4JRPVygpAA.text: Probably the best meal I have had in Vegas, and that says something. Went with a group of 5 and did not know what to expect. The best I can describe the experience is fusion Med meets Tapas.   Started with two dips, hummus and cucumber/yogurt. The pita was great, not too chewy, just perfect. Both dips were excellent.  Then we had spanakopita and spicy cigars. Possibly the best spanakopita I have ever had and the cigars were like meat filled sping rolls, everyone loved them.  We then had the Brussels sprouts, which even the most carnivorous of us loved. They were crispy shaved Brussels sprouts, reminded me of terrific fried kale I once had at Benny's in Chicago.   Our two meat dishes were also great. Lamb tagine with cous cous was both tender and flavorful. My favorite dish, and most surprising, was the duck bastilla, hard to describe but almost like a duck filled Krispy Kreme donut, just incredible.  Service was excellent though I do feel they could of done a better job pacing the meal, almost felt rushed as the new dishes kept arriving.

m3D1TtDMkZCIM-w1Ltl_wg.text: We enjoyed this restaurant. It's small plate tapas style so it's 2-3 things per person. We had the hanger steak, scallops, lamb(they brought it on accident) kabobs wagu, shrimp, and sausage. We enjoyed the meal and it was tasty. With bottle of wine it was around 200$. Our waitress Jessica was great this is a good restaurant to eat at if you stay at SLS.

Q_iduQMpgklzFR_0sdTyqg.text: Hedonism! gluttony! and an orgasmic culinary experience was all on the table today at Cleo. Today Cleo had an all inclusive Mother's Day brunch with unlimited mimosas and Bloody Marys. The mimosas came in orange, apple, passion fruit, mango, and guava which were semi self serve - patrons picked them up at the bar and got to select how much juice they'd like. A Bloody Mary bar had all the condiments needed and a special Mediterranean hot sauce that was fantastic. We sampled them all repeatedly, the juices and Bloody Mary mix were fresh, made in house and delicious.  Cleo specializes in Mediterranean and middle eastern cuisine and items on the buffet brunch such as roasted cauliflower, humus with whole chick peas, baba ganoush, roasted prime rib and lamb with Mediterranean and middle eastern spices were unique and stupendous.  Cleo has a stylish modern decor with Mediterranean and middle eastern accents. The feel is romantic and hip. The service was outstanding, our server Nada was ever present despite the large numbers that she was working with today.  The brunch had a seafood station that was out of this world-king crab legs, oysters, sweet humongous shrimp, and succulent stone crab in enormous mounds.  The crepes were made to order and filled with fresh fruit, chocolate, and an in-house cream. The deserts included various pastries and excellent tarts, chocolate topped cream puffs, and Turkish style baklava. This was our first time we visited Cleo and we will be back guaranteed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fantastic band!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe station
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Craving station

TzvfY6DTx9xHEPO-6dK2eA.text: Key destination whether you are into mediterranean food or not. Their lamb shawerma / appetizers, kebabs are one of a kind. Chicken Tagine was not that special but good. Even their tea is amazing!!

GMuEIaZKDg_q06oDTSVPkA.text: The food was good not great but that's not the story here. We had large party for buissness and the service was awful. Nobody offered second drinks when they where asked for mine took 25 mins and the other 40. How does is take 40 min to make a vodka on the rocks? We order a few apps for the table they never cleared the dishes when clearly we done. Moreover, the food came out over 40 min period. The kicker is that was do to party size the tip was auto grat.

ha7x-pOlKv60QKeHdPdY4g.text: Amazing experience! Definitely a memorable experience to put in the books.  Where do I begin? Had no idea I was coming here as it was a surprise birthday dinner from my better half. Glad she chose this place inside of the SLS hotel/casino. Perfect date spot...  We arrived close to the last seating (being 10:30 P.M) and the spot was pretty empty; although it was a Monday night; not so sure why so many restaurants in Las Vegas seem to close early but there must be some explanation. Anyhow, the atmosphere is upscale, chill playlist and some of the best servers/waiters that can be found...wish I could recall ours as he was great.  We started with a couple cocktails. Can not recall what she had but I went with a CUCUMBER SMASH consisting of Jameson whiskey, muddled cucumbers, some type of flower liqueur and lemon. Very good drink! 15.00 as with all of their cocktails. And from the two we had, I would say rest assured they are not skimping on the alcohol.  So the menu has a ton of small plates of which you can freestyle or go with one of their tasting menus. One option is 50.00 each, the other 65.00 with a two-person minimum. We chose to freestyle as there were too many enticing options that we would be sharing.  We started with a couple vegetable plates... the EGGPLANT (10.00) w/chili and fennel was so-so but the MUSHROOM (13.00) with the hazelnuts and puffed rice was def. ON point!   Next, we ordered BABAGANOUSH( 10.00 w/bread), and TUNA TARTAR(14.00). The tuna tartar should be taken off of the menu because it was the only thing that we both agreed that we found below standard compared to all of the other dishes we had.   Then came, OYSTERS (16.00) fantastic!...maybe I should I be complaining of the price for only four but as good as they were...probably not! And...The highlight of everything we had...and worth coming here for...the GRILLED OCTOPUS  ($who cares). Come here and try, you'll probably order more plates.  We actually ordered another after this...being a flatbread... the MARQUEZ (15.00?). This being a thin crust pizza with spicy lamb sausage, peppers, onions, and mooz. Fantastic. We, at this point, took half to go and finished off cold at the airport.  Not sure if it was from my amazing woman mentioning it or if she said beforehand but they came with an amazing cake for my bday...soft and hot chocolate mixed with cold ice cream (caramel topping) and a hard, crispy, sweet cracker on top. Unbelievable!  P.S. to the SLS, CREO, and more importantly...the beautiful woman that made this happen. Best birthday dinner ever! Thank you!  P.S.S. The SLS Hotel and casino will be getting fewer starts..I'll keep you posted.  P.S.S.S. Hey Peter D...is this how a yelp review should be?

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms w/dates, hazelnuts, and puffed rice. 13.00
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surprise bday cake.
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marquez. Flat bread pizza with peppers, onions, spicy lamb sausage and mozz. 15.00

S-QOSz9rjJCuJ0t90PqDmg.text: The food here is outstanding BUT the service is truly lacking and that is the reason for the 3 instead of 5 stars. We ate here 2 times on our last Vegas stay and once the month before. Out of the 3x, the best and most attentive service was dinner at the bar. The two bartenders were attentive and quick on every level.  Regular table service dinner has been a different story. The first visit the restaurant was empty except for us and 4-5 other tables. We had to look for and ask after our server numerous times. The food was good but a couple of dishes arrived room temperature. The second time we ate here was for a business dinner with 10 people in which we spent over $1k. Again, the restaurant had other tables but was not busy and again the service was lacking. We had to ask the bus boy numerous times to send over the server, request water for the table etc. Frustrating because the food here is delicious but they definitely need some changes to the service approach.

SrCoL17AqhqqHWwiHzNiYw.text: This is one of my fav spots in Vegas. The the ambiance, the food, everything is spectacular. Especally the food. It's flavored to perfection.  yummm :D

qvGHjcnVHiKusoe3UBXvdg.text: Probably the closest thing to my mum's homemade dolmades, but hers are still so much better. I purposely go to Mediterranean restaurants to find one that compares to hers, and this is as close as it gets. I've never had any with a dipping sauce before, and this one had one. It actually made it yummier.   The chicken tagine was very good, even though a bit on the small side.   The environment is very warm, dimly lit. Service staff is exceptional. Thank you for being so kind!  I'd go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tip1J_HNn0YJfrFHpt54Yg.text: As a local here in Las Vegas, this is by far one of the best Mediterranean restaurants in town! Although it does say tapas style, I personally think the portions are a little bigger then typical tapas style.   My party and I got mostly meat dishes, and let me tell you, they were all to die for. I don't have a favorite as they were all amazing! The kababs were cooked perfectly, and you are able to pick three different meat choices for that. The dessert we got Sticky toffy pudding and it was perfect!  The ambiance and vibe was also super cute and hip. I would defiantly come here again for a fancy date night or a girls night out type of vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jR5pTftWbbo0kIopWuQ9wA.text: 4.5 stars. I'm skeptical about hotel & casino restaurants, but Cleo is one of the best ones I've ever been to. About 50 of us were seated in the back after the first day of our meeting. There was a prie fixe, family-style menu (with printed copies) and everything the organizer selected was delicious.  All the dishes were brought out in a random order, separated on smaller plates and scattered across the table. It was a smorgasbord from heaven. The wait staff also made sure to take good care of guests with dietary restrictions. These were my favorites:  * Hummus with Tahini + Laffa Bread * Cauliflower with Vadouvan, Cashews * Brussel Sprouts with Capers, Almonds, Vinaigrette, * Grilled Hangar Steak with Grilled Peewee Potatoes, Spoon Salad  Service was quick and attentive. The only thing is Cleo seems to value a high table turnover time. After all, business was popping! Plates were cleared when they still had food or when people were still eating. Sometimes they asked if we were done. But overall this was a top-notch dining experience, and I would love to come back here again if I ever attended another event at SLS Station!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

g1tPOnwOkBWTCL9fDZ_RLg.text: So glad I finally got a chance to try this place.  There is one in LA where I'm from, so when I saw there was one here in Vegas I had to go.  On the menu, there was a "tasting" for $65, but tbh we ordered 5-6 things and it was the same price + we were able to try everything we wanted (which included a cocktail).  We ordered babaghanoush (the bread they served with it was unreal), dolmades, scallops (the lettuce/garnish or whatever that came with it was really good), bone marrow (a VERY hefty serving size), wagyu beef kebobs and something else I think.   For tapas style, I felt that the servings were generous. The cocktail I had was nothing to write home about, but it was decent -not so bad it deserved taking off a star.  I left feeling full and satisfied.  The best part, since it's Mediterranean, the full feeling isn't heavy.  Win-win for me.

cyK08uYYO1-dEqX-L1ol-Q.text: It was a good idea to make reservations even if for two people. I met up with a  friend of mine here last night and the place was packed. The noise level was a bit loud for the ambience but not too bothersome.  The atmosphere is definitely upscale, this would be a great date night spot.   We had a pleasant server. I came for the happy hour as I saw it was available on Thursday night. She stated they don't have it that day but she went and asked the manager and ended up giving the Happy hour menu.   Some of the food ordered are Hanger Steak from the Regular dinner menu. From the happy hour menu, we chose Pork Belly that blew me away. The spices they used were flavorful. The Lamb Shawarma tasted fresh and very authentic.  For desert, don't miss out on Fig and Almond Panacotta. It's simply the best.  The only dislike was the table next to us was too close, you can give a High 5.  Totally recommend checking this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fig and Almond Panacotta
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2fHdugfg4yoZA8OlMkxaGQ.text: Not my favorite. The food was really greasy and I couldn't even finish the little bit I ordered. The happy hour menu isn't great and the prices are still high for what you get. I went because it's rated high for happy hour (that's what the billboard says). I wouldn't recommend this spot.

d-FKAoaYwaJ_3_wyMbzDiw.text: Great, great food.  Yes, I know it looks cheesy.  Yes, I know it's in a hotel (it's Vegas).  Its also really fresh and tasty.  Pro tio: ask for the special menus -- they usually have a great deal.  Recently, I ate here and ordered from the Summer Menu.  Two apps, a main and a dessert $45.

0qbnCPN2x79aJXWOB87b4Q.text: I wandered in with my husband on a Saturday night for Happy Hour, and was immediately greeted by the friendly staff and incredible aroma of baking pizza. The restaurant was filling up quickly (it was almost 7:00pm) We ordered Lebaneh with feta bread. They were little bombs of buttery, yeasty goodness, and the garlic inside the yogurt dip was robust but not overpowering. The bread was crisp, flavorful, and chewy. We were planning our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lebaneh with feta

VNVXsu0miPex_X4LYdFo0g.text: Wow! Surprisingly great. Ended up eating here twice on our trip because it was so good. Would definitely recommend their happy hour aswell.

L2oj2R5xKc-yDLtI25JniA.text: I live in Vegas, and the food here is incredible.  Went last night for restaurant week. I must say of all the restaurants doing restaurant week, they had the best choices and the price of 40 dollars  for 5 courses can't be beat. One of us ordered from the restaurant week menu and then we ordered 1 soup, charred octopus and the bone marrow.  There was a total of 8 dishes, one of which was dessert included on the restaurant week menu.  All 8 dishes were excellent, portions quite big to share.  If you are a bone marrow person, this might have been the best I ever had along with the mushrooms served with it. Even if you just do ala carte prices are very reasonable.  Definitely, keep this place in mind when visiting LV or if you live here.  Also, parking is free.

X8JcBVvm2BIxOYWx-HRcpw.text: We were at these restaurant several times and had a great experience. Great food , Mediterranean style Fusion. All Tapas dishes are amazing.  If you come at your birthday they break a Plate for you! Enjoy.

L1LFyV5O3iR7hCVLO0jW9w.text: Stayed at the wynn Hotel and took a short uber drive to this restaurant, we tried the tasting menu that filled us completely with some amazingly delicious dishes, great service, beautiful restaurant, Highly recommended, you'll enjoy it.

gLIziyrdSjpqNH26JAuq3g.text: This was a last minute place that we stopped at & I'm glad we stopped here! The food was good but it was all small plates. Which isn't an issue for me. The flatbreads were like mini pizzas. They could feed like 2 people for an app. We had 7 people & we each ordered 2 meals. I think that if you order a flat bread you should have to order a second meal because it was very very filling. The clam noodles were amazing!! The drinks were also very good &  set at a decent price. The staff was very good. Kept waters refilled and brought food out warm. Def a place to try out

ujpP3jaywc8Ly9Emb54Z0g.text: Mediterranean tapas galore.  Of the many dishes we tried, the scallops & the clams and noodles were my favorite.  The out of restaurant restroom (in the nearby casino) was a little inconvenient but the overall mood of restaurant romantic and cozy...as long as you don't get seated near the entrance which borders some slot machines and gaming tables.

ureFvLlKXDcwjKB6Em3OoQ.text: Cleo was amazing the roller cigars were awesome! also our server , cant remember his name but he was awesome as well!! the Brussels sprouts were out of this world! would for sure go back any day of the week.

_uS4rBOBGRXnWimkOAbDug.text: Disregard every review less than 5 stars on this restaurant. I came with a group of 5, we tried 15-20 different dishes and every dish was mind blowing! Cleo has a very, very unique menu and our server Laurel was fantastic! Highly recommend!

__W4z_QkPEM4ZUJTlmAJUQ.text: Had dinner here before the Rock in Rio.  After having a lot of bad dining experiences, this one was remarkably amazing. It was a flawless experience.  Owners and managers seem to fail to understand that it's not just their food but the entire experience that makes a person wish to return. The details were so amazing, so I'm going to share them.  We were greeted immediately by a smiling, cordial hostess who was very welcoming. No attitude or lacking of interest in us as many places hire young ladies who are used to non-human communication of their phones.  Seated at a great clean table near the bar. Love the dim lights and candle on the table.  Menu has a light tan background so was hard to read but they have menus printed with bigger print with a white background and not only brought us those (for our older eyes), but a pair of readers for my friend.  Andre came over to us right away, like within a minute, with a big smile and great attitude. He was very knowledgable of the menu and gave us great suggestions.  Everything came out like a symphony... When the beer was ready, someone delivered it. Not our waiter, but another server that seemed to be just helping him. Great teamwork.  I loved the  bread that comes in a bag to keep it warm.  We ordered the cucumber yogurt dip appetizer and it was amazing. We had falafel, fried artichokes, one of the flatbreads, and the Greek Salad. I loved everything. Lots of attention to detail and great flavors.  Staff was extremely attentive.  The music was very sexy and amazing adding to the atmosphere.  I love the cool water bottles they leave on the table so you don't have to wait for refills but they are very attentive to keeping your glass full.  Andre kept an eye on us enough to be happy but not too much to be bothersome.  It was beyond refreshing to have a completely flawless dining experience.

fXAcWZujzNYBtWV1TwdmfA.text: My friend and I went to Cleo's for the first time. Excellent food! So many different vegetarian and meat dishes and appetizers. Fun place to go! The deserts were delightfully excellent also. We totally enjoyed our meal

CLG6cinNtyVokTxAflUKFA.text: Excellent babaghanoush, bread, tomato salad, roasted lamb with couscous and toffee pudding. I highly recommend this spot.

-03nRWkffuLV5q7Ut759eQ.text: Excellent food, delicious cocktails and great service. Very unique food for the strip, not to mention Las Vegas in general.

MV-1Qv8TK32J3Ugtbv2StQ.text: Excellent food and excellent service. Tapas style meals perfect for sharing, each dish was amazing Mediterranean style food. Our meal came with sticky toffee pudding which came topped with ice cream, my friends and I were practically fighting over the the last bite. We also ordered the pannacotta and it was divine.

16iycE6xW1ObrA0e-Ju7Rg.text: The worst service. Food was to bland. No taste. And sat on the toilet most of the night and morning. Never will I go back to that place.

Uclx_7MA26OGb4PV_xELwg.text: Service was good, food is small plate style, so more sharing/snacking (always fun). We ordered six items and cocktails. I had their blackberry vodka drink, very delicious. We had the oysters, they were also good. The hummus and pita were what you'd expect. The lamb wasnt great. The bone marrow was excellent (and they give you quite a bit for what you pay). Overall, I wasnt wowed for Vegas dining, as the other dishes arent even worth mentioning.

9ui_GzXC50vzsMHxvI8q6w.text: I could eat Laffa all day...if only Cleo were open for more than just dinner. Cleo is the perfect place for a light meal or snack it's a shame that it's only open for dinner as it's the perfect lunching location. The lebaneh and feta with laffa, maybe some lamb or chicken kabobs and some tea you have yourself a delicious meal for $15. The waitresses are a little pushy when it comes to ordering more plates, but it is a tapas restaurant so it's to be expected. Biggest complaint is it's not open for lunch.

ujvwI2lE-gbzGrEt1WSdhQ.text: The food was AMAZING but the decor of the place was less than to be desired.  It looked like the decorator thought they were designing a buffet.  It could be very sexy and dark with the Egyptian theme, but they failed.  My only complaint was the $4 upcharge for the Moscow Mule making the drink (a very small size serving at that) $18! And the server didn't even inform us of that.  Definitely reccommend the Lamb sliders and mushrooms......yum!

I2SSu_vYUM6oeqi-1RnTJg.text: I had the toasted Kale on flatbread, Moussaka and a sliver of the apple tart for dessert.  Everything I ordered was tasty. The server was nice, the assistant servers need a lesson in placing hot plates on the table etiquette. My experience was just OK. I would not go out of my way to revisit this restaurant with so many other way more fabulous restaurants in Vegas.

i6iUrNR5XYeuuepobT88ag.text: This location is better than HOLLYWOOD! Came with 4 other friends and we all agreed. Best dishes are the lamb, steak, burrata, hummus, shrimp and chicken skewers, tagine chicken, and feta cheese dish. You must have the bread pudding and salted caramel ice cream for dessert! Everything was a flavor explosion. No wonder why this spot wins numerous awards!

YmsvlcB0iOjKrepPD1Z5kQ.text: This restaurant had the most laughably bad service I had experienced in Vegas.   Here is the setup: * large group (10 of us), all local, all foodies, all hungry, but all in a good mood.   * great environment, table, music.  Here are the problems, in chronological order: * 1/2 empty restaurants should never take that long to seat someone with a reservation.  6-7 minutes.  and 1/2 empty is generous.  * Look, I lived in Spain for a while so I understand Tapas culture.  But menu items showed up so randomly and so far apart that you would almost assume they forgot about us or served other people our food.  * They brought us 3 dishes we did not order.  Then they re-brought us the same dish (the 1st of the 3) 5 minutes later as if to say "going twice......"  Is this an auction?  * The silverware was cleared, in preparation for what we thought was coffee and dessert time.  Instead, they brought out more of our food.  Coordination / chaos.  * The server then asked if we wanted to keep the food out there, and we asked them if they noticed the missing silverware.  So they were a bit matter-of-fact and humorless as if this is normal course-of-business.  "OK, do you want me to bring silverware back so you can finish your last 2-3 courses?"  * After turning down the final plates post-silverware clearing, we were presented with dessert menus and set up with dessert plates and coffee cups.  We each ordered dessert.  Then the manager came by 5 minutes AFTER ordering and said "we are sorry, the kitchen is closed. We didn't know you would be staying so long."  Some restaurants deserve a second chance.  I used to work in the service industry, and I know that sometimes you can't do anything right.  This was just one of those nights for them. But it was a complete disaster - and it was specifically MISMANAGED / POORLY COORDINATED.  The place has promise, but would need a new GM and waitstaff that care.

_lgo_wut9EHaeGZvXHgetA.text: I came for a dinner with my wife I really was happy with the meal the waitress was very kind and give me an excellent service and the price was fair for the meal we got enough time was very fun at the restaurant.

NVI4aD1F-I17ONu6-_G7wA.text: Food was good but please don't ever sit in Jessica section.. Service is terrible she never even checked to see if we needed anything.. Took forever to bring us our drinks ..we took. our girl here for her birthday big mistake!!!!! .. We would've got better service at the Circus Circus buffet..smh

FbPyh8f_ox7nw37dLzVlYA.text: Waited almost an hour to get our food and then it was cold!!  Kitchen staff needs some organizational help.

l3DR06YzLU1xJp6P1uEDdw.text: best dinner out in years. hummus appetizer with fantastic bread. lamb chops, Brussels sprouts, fish, sliders, latkes and cauliflower dishes were served family style and all were nicely seasoned. Warm Cinnamon Apple Torte. Cannot wait to go back!! Service was excellent and we were seated in a round table area set back from the main area. Perfect to be able to visit with the other couple we were with. 4 thumbs up!!

xC_05VMrNWjx3WmrRgVJ6A.text: Loved it here almost ate everything on the menu  very cute inside. Prices are very decent. There's an la location as well.  try this place for sure.

loi6VAQJ87qxRdnW99Zcww.text: Cleo never fails. This is our 2nd time here and we absolutely enjoy every time. The food, the ambience, the service, the drinks. Everything. Such a cute place.   Food- being local, from dec 1st-23rd. All restaurants except bazaar is HALF OFF. Including alcohol!! You just need you players card. What a deal so we couldn't resist but go to Cleo again. We ordered about 4 items. Started with the hummus with tahini with their pita bread. SO GOOD. Then we ordered the 3 kebabs for $29 which is the burribatta sausage which taste like salami, though that was the best, the lamb kefta which my boyfriend thought that was the best and the chicken which is nice also, not dry. The dish came with saffron rice as well. Then we ordered the scallops, TO DIE FOR. The favorite thing we ordered in my opinion, had this salad topped off with it with this sauce. It was sooooo delicious. And then we also ordered the grilled octopus which we love ordering at places but this grilled octopus was a little too sour for our palates. It was cooked well though. Just didn't expect the sourness in the sauce they put it in. By then we were stuffed. Along with dinner we ordered cocktails, my boyfriend ordered the gardo which was Hennessy and champagne and I order the vinebury which was super refreshing, it was like a spicy mojito.   Ambience- super cute, very rustic and modern which tan leather booths, lighting is dark but it sets the right mood and atmosphere for it. There's books and shelves as decor. A lot of brown and white. Not too loud, not too busy at all.   Service- can't complain. Our waitress was super accommodating. She recommended our drinks and some things to order. We were totally surprised the alcohol was included for the half off deal. Couldn't ask for anything else. Our waitress was super nice and didn't rush us at all.   Overall, an amazing experience. Love Cleo.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pick 3 kababs for $29. We picked the buribatta sausage, lamb kefta, and chicken

vrA-vyfCkDBtk2Lpl3DS0w.text: I really like Mediterranean food in general, so believe me when I say "Fabulous" food!  We tried a bit of everything - just filled up the table and everyone gave it a try - the Brussel sprouts were my favorite (amazing).   Quiet enough to have a decent conversation, too.

6Cq2fidySi5wXeGWFVv7Fw.text: Yummy place. 5 course menu is good if you're not on a diet. Price is right and location is near major hotels.

6ZlWVaaMHtNwq0u-ykxHZA.text: I wasn't too impressed with Cleo. Their food wasn't anything that impressed me, and at the end of our meal I asked for everything to go so I could have a midnight snack and they just cleared everything away - and I love my leftovers!

YNvx1DCa1x3sF8XLMhVA-Q.text: It was my First time at Cleo for dinner, we had wonderful service, great cocktails and every dish was amazing.  The Brussels sprouts were the best I ever had.  I would definitely go back!

J20Is7rexpYhtciXC_KCRw.text: This Mediterranean restaurant is one of the best I have been in a long long time. Their food is so authentic and the services is amazing. My husband and I sat at the bar to have dinner the other night and our bartender Jose was such a great help to guide us with our experience. We started by having a delicious lebanaeh dip with Laffa bread. Jose also recommended we try an old Hollywood cocktail and a Pinot noir glass of wine to go with our meal. We really enjoyed Cleo's happy hour. We also tried their lam shawarma, it was the best I've ever had. Their Brussels sprouts are to die for, Crispy like potatoes chips. I will definitely be coming back to dine here with my family next time we are in Vegas. Thanks to all the Cleo staff for the great service.

LStk1sPXXN-gUd7LlmHwig.text: Best Mediterranean food I've ever had. Not usually a fan of lamb, but it was AMAZING. Would recommend to anyone in Vegas. Will definitely be back.

MVw5eXnGHKF0yhK9-2Z-AQ.text: Update! Came in again tonight and it was amazing as usual!  Brussel Sprouts- so flavorful, light, crispy. Delicious Spicy cigars- tasty and the dill sauce that comes with is fabulous! Kibbeh!!! Shout out to the GM Peter for arranging to make sure I could try the kibbeh since they were out last time- above and beyond! It was amazing tastes just like my families dish Clams w Noodles - unbelievable.  The flavors are out of this world! Pork belly- very tasty Spanikopita- warm and delicious, cheesy perfection  Hangar steak- perfectly cooked, tender, impressive  the flavors at this restaurant are just unbeatable. I love Mediterranean cuisine and this is the best place for it!  great service - thank you all!   Also the Janapolitan cocktail was insane, vodka, muddled strawberries and basil.   Bottom line this restaurant is a must try. I'll be coming back!!

QngD3rE2b8iJ66KLl0pdTA.text: I've been to the LA one before and I prefer that decor. This time in Las Vegas, I got to try more food. The soup was one of my favs and I enjoyed the tartare.

kuwzwc3t2ndTMgTVF3ai-A.text: Absolutely wonderful in every way. Dinner was amazing. We had lamb & bunch of appetizers.  I would recommend coming here with your family & friends.  Restaurant is located inside SLS.

xjq8IRCb4pW4cjs0gTBKHw.text: We chose Cleo at SLS for our final hurrah during Restaurant Week. We had no trouble securing a reservation via opentable with only an hour's notice. This dinner was just my husband and I. Though, it would've been a good choice for a group because much of the menu is served family style. It would've allowed us to sample more items, but fear not, we had ourselves a feast for $40.15 per person (+$16 for lamb).   The restaurant itself is rather peculiar, but I liked the quirkyness. I really admired the open kitchen. Service was attentive, management checked in a few times to be sure we wanted for nothing. That attention to detail is a nice touch.   We thoroughly enjoyed the first course. We loved both the Hummus and the Spicy Cigars. The laffa bread took us directly to carb heaven. It was light, airy and perfectly seasoned. Ideal for dragging it through the smooth and creamy hummus. The Spicy Cigars were like meaty spring rolls, they were packed with flavor and pleasantly cooled with the tangy sauce. Consuming ten of these bad boys would be an easy feat.   Next were the Spicy Potatoes & Eggplant. The potatoes didn't have much kick, but they were loaded with flavor. I think I misunderstood "spicy" but they were satisfying. The eggplant, on the other hand, was a dud. A little disappointing, but it left room for other tasty bites.   Next we were each served a portion of Chopped Salad. The husband thought it had too much cucumber so I took his home as leftovers. I loved the salad! It was so fresh, crisp and filled with bright flavors. I've never had freekeh before, I am now a fan. It's a bit nutty and chewy, it was a perfect fit in the salad. It was delicious the next day too.   Moving on to the entrees we had Beef and Soukouk Kebabs with Saffron Rice, Couscous and Seven Vegetable Soup and Lamb Tagine ($16 add-on). The kebabs were my favorite both with bold seasoning. He was fond of the lamb. I admit you cannot beat the tenderness achieved in a tagine. The couscous was pretty dry and the soup was bland until we added some zest with the harissa.   Sticky Toffee Pudding seemed like an unlikely option at a Mediterranean restaurant, but it was extremely delicious. Baklava was prepared two ways and they were fine versions, but it was our least favorite dessert.   Beers and cocktails were a bit steep; Weihenstephaner ($10) and Stella ($9). But it didn't stop us from ordering them anyway. Cleo is a fun twist on tapas and it's rather unique. It definitely fills a niche on the Las Vegas strip.

nKnkngMWmSDvKvkWgBIpZQ.text: Staff was wonderful, we dined at Cleo for Thanksgiving. It was quite expensive though for the portions you received. Definitely not enough to fill a big table of guests. Several dishes were tasty, but in our opinion they didn't capture the flavor and spirit of the holiday.  As locals we've tried many of the restaurants on the strip. On second take I would recommend a more traditional dinner at The Country Club at Wynn, Carmines, Del Friscos Double Eagle Steakhouse, or the Capital Grill to name a few.

CNTyeLGSYlDmE1cL2SKlsg.text: This place had my taste buds in a frenzy! And in a good way. I can't even explain how delicious all of my dishes were, but the most impressive was the Grilled Octopus. My boyfriend is the most picky and boring foodie there is, however he was very happy with all the exciting flavors of the food.  Whoever the chef is, my hat goes to you, you are amazing! Will be back next month when I visit Vegas again.

OgGa8zVQUmZUKTttGkhmVA.text: Delicious food!  Unique take on traditional favorites.  A bit pricy, but worth it!

oPuPVAZ4nzWyYvSkx614Ew.text: Good happy hour and friendly bar staff.  I'm eating low carb , they have options.  The  Brussels sprouts are amazing!  Pork belly a must try- will ruin you for everyone else's

wn3H0KZyh3KB6tF23iHfzw.text: Cleo continues to be one of the best Middle Eastern restaurants in the valley.  Delicious cocktails, superb service and delicious food. We had nearly a dozen dishes and we were very pleased with everything we ordered.

QTONWyEmys3h78jVzC-H9g.text: Nice place and staff is very friendly! Great food and special menu for vegetarians! Check it out once if you are in Vegas !

HoHpTBT5BpHDTbeD_LYf2g.text: Cleo just might be my favorite restaurant on the strip. The atmosphere is great- like any fine dining on the strip, the food tastes amazing, but it won't burn a hole through your wallet like many eateries on the Las Vegas Strip.  I have been to Cleo on several occasions and everyone that I have dined with is a fan. The first time I visited- I was on a very strict diet and they were very accommodating for me. Everything I have eaten here is tasty and I mean everything. The pita bread is warm and fluffy, hummus is smooth and delicious and the fish is always cooked to perfection.  I wish it was closer to my house and I would be going on a weekly basis. Such a great spot and look forward to going again soon.

MgzrxFQ56AGbWmDD0f5YLw.text: Had a very nice dinner here Wed night. Was here for a conference, so I sat at the bar and chatted it up with the cool bartender chick.   The tapas here are a bit spendy, but the portion size is quite generous compared to tapas places I've been to in California! I got three items and couldn't finish them. Here's what i had:  - Grilled octopus: Loved it!! Not rubbery at all as i had feared. Delicious and highly recommended! :-) - Cauliflower with cashews: Curry flavor, a bit spicy, but good - Spanakopita: You get three and they are tasty..filled with spinach and feta cheese - Lotus Flower cocktail: Delicious, not too sweet. Light fruity and floral flavor.  Service and atmosphere were great. Overally, positive experience and would come back when in Vegas.

BbpP9y-rVrT3h0H-_7uGLg.text: So sad to see this place go, such a great restaurant. Food is always delicious, service on point and atmosphere is hip.   Too bad it was in the SLS.

V6tpUX-cXW5H2p4z8vFjGA.text: Cleo's food is very good. Service is very slow!  We ordered 1 dozen oysters, shrimp dish, clam dish, chicken kabob, potatoe latka, falafel, brussel sprouts are delicious!!!!!! Shishito  peppers, hummus at first but they forgot about it and literally a whole hour went by, I was not sure if they were waiting for the garbanzo beans to grow out of the physical ground or not so I changed it to babaganush!, another round of a dozen oysters and octopus! The crazy thing is alllllllll of the food eventually came but the last item to hit the table was a tiny little skewer of chicken kabob. I mean this was a typical Thursday night in Vegas aka not busy especially in a pricey restaurant like this one. I would def go back for my drink and everything else but the clam dish, bland bland bland, where was the clam? No clue because it was the size of a pebble! lol   The drink I tried was called the Vinberry and it was delicious!!!!!!

H_ZyDNe-IZMcWQlugh7xxw.text: Its not many times I get to have a great dinner and rib the employees.  But what a great time and great meal.   We did not have reservations and Cleo was completely booked.  They said bar is open seating.  But it was full.  We decided to wait for a open place. Waited about 15 min.  We met the bartender Stephan and one of the front of house managers.    We decided to do the tasting menu and do a app of oysters.   The food came out fast.  Maybe a bit to fast really. The first portions of the tasting menu anyway.   I was pretty sure it was to push out food before the ticket machine went nuts, the Place was packed.  But we were having a good time with Steven.  Lol his yelp was awaiting him lol.    They had a very difficult customer.  They really handled her well.  I'm convinced she was doing it for free stuff. But again they handled her well.   Our food was very good.   We did not get the oyster though.  I'm sure they went to another table.  We saw them get put in.    All in all great meal great fun. Steven and the manager were awesome.    Food good.  Customer service great. Fun place.

aRekZD4JAReXS9uKJJCEog.text: Outstanding restaurant! Authentic Mediterranean food and friendly service. Had a wonderful dinner with family and friends. It's really good for large party's. I heard it was closing, very sad, hope they can stay open in this economy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lFwbIFwSDw3_1jY-Auv2mw.text: Perusing the restaurants included in Restaurant Week 2019, we saw Cleo and it's been years since we have been. We made reservations the day before and had no issues, even got an email confirmation.  Upon arrival we ordered an Old Vegas cocktail which is made with Aviation gin, very delicious 5/5. A couple waters and perused the menu as well as the Restaurant week 5 course offering for $40 a person. Most courses had 3 options so we both decided on different items so we could each share 10 items! Oh and since we love the oysters here and the babaganoush I guess we made it 12 items!  Service was a little slow at first but picked up. Even got another cocktail on the house.   Summary of courses: Roman flatbread 4/5 Hummus with tahini 5/5 Beet salad 5/5 Quinoa and roasted vegetable salad 5/5 Spicy cigars 5/5 Filafel 4/5 Chicken tagine 4/5 Grilled hanger steak 4/5 Sticky toffee pudding 5/5 Yogurt sorbet 5/5  Three words: Food Coma Happens!  Overall a great meal and awesome to get to try so many items for such a good price. Also nice a portion goes to Three Square for a good cause.

QEkcRF_294gwVpz26axauw.text: Was staying at the SLS and got a 50% offer for staying at the hotel so why not?! Cleo is a Mediterranean cuisine restaurant with amazing service and attentive staff. We had a reservation for 7:30 pm on a Wednesday night. There were a few tables but it was not extremely busy.   I ordered the hummus with laffa to start (not pictured) a Greek salad and a raspberry twist cocktail (the tequila creeps up on you with this cocktail). I loved this cocktail it was refreshing after a long day walking on the strip. I'm partial to cocktails with fresh berries and/or herbs.   For our entrees I ordered the roasted lamb served on a bed of Lebaneh (creamy yogurt spread) and Israeli couscous. I loved this dish, the combination worked very well together. My only complaint if I'm being absolutely picky is that the lamb was not warm enough. We also had the hangar steak with potatoes and salad. The steak was delicious and cooked to temperature.   For dessert we ordered the fig and amaretto panacotta. I'm a huge fan of panacotta and this one was unique. I loved all of the components of this dessert. I'm not a huge fan of nuts, but the almond brittle that was served with this dessert was the perfect accompaniment. I could eat this dessert 10x it was that good.

EOo78YccAE0irJbb1oJdeg.text: Located in the SLS Hotel, decided to try on my way to the Monique Does Vegas Show, happy hr of course. You are not allowed to come in in your bathing suit, they do have a dress requirement and they should! I have seen it all at other restaurants in Vegas, people should not be allowed in dining with wet bikinis. Thanks Cleo for having some standard in the dining area.  The ambience was very elegant and sexy, I enjoyed the service and professionalism of the bartender during our visit. She explained happy hr and gave suggestions. The drinks were good and not watered down, and the food was delicious with lots of flavor. Portion size was small compared to other restaurants in Vegas, so be prepared to pay. Being honest.  I would give them a chance for dinner.  Yes and Yes I will return when Im in Vegas! Great experience.

MJWgUH3hgK4AXTeBU0BqIw.text: Came here for restaurant week and I gotta day I was pleasantly surprised. I mean, all Mediterranean food is the same right and taste the same... well that's not True. This place was really good and for the fact that we got so much food for the price was outstanding. The service was great, food was great, atmosphere was great! Overall I would totally would go back again for regular food menu to try more out. By far out of everything we had, the spicy cigars were my favorite. The sticky toffee pudding was good but wasn't my overall favorite. But overall the food and everything was absolutely great!

yrHldFbL7RnaoWYLqpSp4g.text: Very elegant restaurant inside the SLS Casino hotel....that enforces a dress code. Which I very much appreciated....so you're not dining with young people in bathing suits.  We decided to stop by this restaurant for happy hour specials before Monique does Vegas comedy show...and it was a great experience. The bartender was very courtesy and professional. She was very helpful and gave us some suggestions on drinks and appetizers. The ambience is very classy and romantic. The restrooms are male and female. The entire restaurant was very clean and maintained to the highest standard for cleanliness.  I would visit them again and will recommend them to friends.

ULlv0IOEzk8sXIp6K00iwA.text: I love this place. I stay at the SLS and this restaurant is located in its casino. It gets very busy so reservations are a must. I took my husband here after raving how amazing the food is. We didn't make a reservation but luckily a table was open an hour later so we hit the roulette table to kill time.   Our table was located towards the back. The only drawback to this place is the noise level. It does get very loud with everyone's voices bouncing around the room. But our service was excellent. They have an awesome share deal where it's $65 per person that I got with coworkers the last time and it felt like the food never ended!   My food favorites here are first and foremost the grilled octopus. It's out of this world amazing! Also the spicy cigars, Brussels sprouts, and scallops are all my top picks. The laffa and all dips are great too. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.   For two of us, we had the octopus, lamb sliders, tuna tartare and laffa with lebaneh and feta. This was plenty to make us full.

8ssl0-3v_VVAseaB7PWuTA.text: Approachable, well-lit, and delicious.  You can't ask for much more at the end of a weekend in Vegas, really.  The bread is so good that I hate it a little bit.  It's like that unfairly pretty girl in high school who is also genuinely nice and smart and funny.  So I just gave it a side-eye as I devoured it.  We ordered the lebaneh with feta to dip the lovable bitch bread in, and the complimentary hummus was just as tasty.  Our Greek salad was good, and fine to share if 2 or 3 people are desperate to shove a bit of tasty roughage down their pipes in preparation for a return to real life.  The skewer trio (chicken, shrimp, lamb) was perfectly light and incredibly flavorful.  I tried to mitigate my three days of reckless carb consumption by asking for a lighter side dish, and our server (Neda?  Spelling might be off but she was a delight) recommended the cauliflower couscous in lieu of the saffron rice.    I actually was disappointed when it landed on the table because I saw a lot of currants in it (death to raisins forever), but once I actually tasted it, my mouth stayed too full to complain.  It was so very very yummy.  Ask for that cauliflower couscous, y'all!  The downside to hitting Cleo as a last supper was that we were too exhausted (aka still drunk from earlier) to order cocktails or dessert, but I'd love to return on my next trip to LV.

ZpOXwYWHaYJWB1PwPw_mDA.text: Long overdue!  We were beyond pleased with our visit to Cleo. After carefully searching for places to select for my babe's birthday I honed in on Cleo for its different style and enticing menu. My expectations were blown thru the roof. Cleo has an intimate ambiance; which is not easily achieved by most restaurants that are in the lobbies of casinos in Las Vegas.  After a brutal hike and near death experience, arriving at Cleo's felt like opening heaven's door. The restaurant is located in the lobby of the SLS hotel. They have free parking.   Browsing quickly over the menu we decided that the tasting menu wasn't for us (meaning: we like to eat and that wasn't enough). We ordered two delicious cocktails; I had The Old Vegas which consisted of gin, oranges, and I can't remember the rest but it was great. He had a cucumber cocktail which was unbelievably refreshing.  The plates I'll recommend are: Grilled Octopus~Celery, Potatoes, Lemon Vinaigrette. Mushrooms~Dates, Hazelnuts, Puffed Rice (best mushrooms ever). Oysters~ Chili-Lime Mignonette, Granite (small portion, order 2).  Everything was superb.  A must! I highly recommend!

T4hPyF-JsGAi9jc9M86K2A.text: The food was great and the service was amazing! Servers were all super friendly and the food came promptly. Drinks were superb!!!! definitely recommend the clementina and the spicy potatoes!!! Will definitely be back again!

From the beet salad to their scrumptious hummus to their chicken tagine and the fried chicken to their delicious desserts this place is worth every penny! Great pick and I would definitely love to come back next time we are in Vegas. A must try at the SLS Hotel!

57TZcddCQdig53BUQueYhw.text: This was a solid four star restaurant located inside of SLS Casino. My husband has been wanting to try it for a while, and I am a huge fan of tapas style dining in addition to Mediterranean food being some of my favorite. We made reservations for 7:30pm and were promptly seated. The ambiance is intimate yet social -- it is open kitchen style adding that extra entertainment factor. Even though it is tapas, keep in mind that many of the choices are protein heavy and will fill you up quickly. I would suggest perhaps starting with 2-3 plates for two people and progressing from there. They have an extensive wine and cocktail list as well. I really enjoyed Old Vegas with Aviator Gin, muddled orange and fresh lemon. They started us off with amazing delicious hummus coupled with incredible pita bread. Our plate choices were Oysters (4), Grilled Octopus (personal favorite), Shishito Peppers with Parmesan (light and delicious until I bit into a really spicy one, ouch!), Roast Lamb with couscous, and finished off with Wagyu kebab (2nd favorite) which costs extra $4 and does not include a side so we opted for saffron rice. I do wish they served more of the delicious pitas they served initially with the hummus. Overall, everything was balanced well with perfect flavor and texture. We finished off with Greek coffee and felt satiated and happy with our meal. Our server was personable and very helpful. The price point was a bit high for me taking into consideration portion sizes and lack of sides. Despite the small list of cons I would certainly recommend this place and be back myself to explore more of their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted peppers w Parmesan
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast lamb w couscous
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu kebab w saffron rice

QhxZRSJvg-3j1OlFqdIlcw.text: I have been to Cleo before.  While at the SLS, I was going to have a burger at Umami.  Sanity took over when I realized it would be slammed with the NFL playoffs and it was packed and loud.  Instead, I opted for a more relaxed dinner at Cleo--a wise choice for a couple of reasons.  My server was Jessica and one could not have a better person as their server!  Because many of their dishes are meant to be shared, I had to ask about my picks based on dining solo.  Jessica was a great help!  I started with harira soup--a spicy Moroccan vegetable soup with chick peas, cilantro, and harira (lemon) in a tomato based stock.  This had nom lamb as some harira soup does.  Next up was kibbeh nayeh--lamb tartare, bulgar, mint, and labaneh served with some flat bread and a spoon to put the tartare on the crisps.  The mint was in small flakes interspersed on the dish with flaked red pepper.  The labaneh was on top of the tartare under a wedge of lemon to squeeze on the raw lamb for some zest.  It was a great dish.  For the main course, I got the Moroccan fried chicken with apricot mustard, harissa aioli, and a small serving of pickled vegetables.  The harissa aioli was stunning in how good it was.  The apricot mustard was OK but a bit sweet for my tastes in a main course.  If you look at the photo, it looks like the captions are not right.  The mustard looking dish is not mustard but the spicy harissa aioli.  The apricot mustard is the lighter dish.    Jessica brought a dessert menu and told me the first two were her favorites.  The first one--sticky toffee pudding--I already had on a previous visit so I ordered the flourless chocolate cake with vanilla gelato.  The chocolate is Ecuadorian arriba chocolate.  The menu suggests a 15 minute wait but it was less than that.  The chocolate cake was so very rich and the gelato was excellent!  Boy, am I glad it was playoff day!  Instead of some hamburger, I had great Mediterranean food from Cleo.  They now have a tasting menu but it requires two people minimum.  Next time with a friend--or not--but there will be a next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flourless chocolate cake.
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moroccan fried chicken.

JBL4zggE-r4ruTRsr58zqg.text: I haven't had a dip here that I didn't love!  We'll get to the delicious food in a moment. Let's start with how beautiful this place is! The experience begins under the pyramid-shaped entrance. Feels like you've traveled thousands of miles into another country. The lighting...furniture, Moroccan tiles, art, all the details are all so pretty. As if that wasn't enough there's an open kitchen with a brick-covered oven filling the space with intoxicating aromas.   Begin with a cocktail and loosen up a little. They offer many great options.   As for the food, here are some of my favorite dishes perfect for sharing. Lebaneh with feta (basically a yogurt cheese), hummus with tahini, spicy potatoes with cilantro aioli, brussels sprouts, falafel, and the grilled octopus that's always the star of the show.   Two fun facts! Free dip with Yelp check-in. Thanks Yelp! And parking is free at the SLS. Thank you SLS!!!

I actually forgot to take a picture of one item and it was so good my husband ordered another one and I was able to take a picture before my husband shoved it into his mouth. XBQ2A4QocwEO5uZkPsG-Xw.text: Cleo has fantastic food and service. We had a feast of dolmades (best I've ever had), potato latkes, cauliflower, lamb kefta kebab, and a butterscotch sticky pudding for dessert. The cocktails were also wonderful. Definitely make a reservation here if you're in town!
