Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and chicken kabob
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom flatbread

V3LA5qryyAe-1fNcaF0_RA.text: Restaurant Week 2015 Dinner $40.15 Donation Level: Gold Platter ($5)  FIRST Hummus w/ Tahini: A nice version of hummus; nothing special though. The bread served in the paper bag was nice - it was a type of flat bread with, I believe, Za'atar seasoning.  Cauliflower w/ Vadouvan, Cashews: This was my least favorite dish. The cauliflower was cooked well in their wood-burning oven, but I didn't care for the dish's flavor and sweetness.  Spicy Potatoes w/ Cilantro Aioli: Delicious! Fingerling potatoes cooked in the wood-burning oven with a spicy oil and served with complementing herby aioli.  Dolmades: Cold stuffed grape leaves served with Greek yogurt. They were fine, but nothing standout.  Spicy Cigars: Fried phyllo rolls filled with beef. Yum!! There's nothing to hate about these fried delicacies. You'll wish there were more than two.  SECOND Chopped Salad: Cucumbers, Freekeh, tomato, lemon. This was a bonus course for the typical 3-course RW menu. A very generous bowl of tasty and refreshing salad. Although great by itself, it was also fantastic with other dishes.  THIRD Chicken Tagine: Preserved lemon, olives, almonds; served on saffron rice. The chicken was flavorful and moist. Solid dish.  Kebab Plate w/ Saffron Rice (Lamb Kefta, Longanisa, Butifarra): The lamb kebab was tasty and served with a spicy paste-like sauce. The sausages were fantastic. My favorite was the Butifarra; described as a salami sausage, it's very flavorful with a subtle kick of spice. One of my favorite sausages is Linguica and Longanisa is supposed to be very similar, but I disagree. It's described as a chorizo-like sausage and that's exactly how it tasted. Either way, still good, but not my type of sausage. The saffron rice with visible stands of the coveted saffron was delicious. There was also a small dish of pickled vegetables that went well with the kebabs.  FOURTH Greek Yogurt & Fresh Berries: Earl Grey and Orange Blossom tea, macerated berries. The menu doesn't state that the yogurt is actually a sorbet and that was pleasant surprise. It was great with the tasty raspberries, blueberries, and blackberries and the fragrant tea.  Baklava: There were two pieces of traditional baklava and another two pieces of chocolate baklava. Both were really fantastic. Nice layers and it wasn't too sweet or dense.  We also ordered Falafel ($9) and they were very good. Crispy exteriors with a delicious, moist interior. It also came on a bed of Tabbouleh and Tahini. I would seriously go back for this alone.  Service was truly wonderful. We never had to flag anyone down for anything because what we needed was in front of us before we actually needed it. The restaurant was beautiful. Also, it was very comfortable in terms of temperature. It's hard to find a restaurant that's nice and cold during our sweltering summers. Either way, Cleo is serving up delicious Mediterranean food in a really sexy setting. Great for date nights or special occasions!

q-l8pQP27YyNgRrsSx5uNQ.text: Great food!! Happy hour from 5-7 includes great prices and wonderful options! Been now twice when in business and enjoyed it thoroughly. Staff at the bar is the nicest and very attentive. I'll be back!

I6USLWSDqOZgmpcXuKpnaQ.text: Enjoyed the food selection and our beautiful server was so good and professional. Food was awesome and tasty. Tried all of the kebobs, Wagyu beef and lamb was my favorite. Will definite go back! The hummus  and pita bread was sooo yummy and freshly baked!!!

O3W6ypnW7oS6pDD-fkmwUQ.text: Food was ok.   Make sure you like onions and garlic because that's what you will get.  Giving it 3 stars because no restaurant should be serving dishes with such a high level of sodium.   Way too much.  I did not eat much as I felt I would have had heart failure from all the sodium.  If you don't have a heart condition like me, you can get away with it but it's such an unhealthy way to prepare food.  If it was legit Mediterranean cuisine, it would not be so loaded up with salt.  If there was one dish to order, or the Brussels sprouts from the fire grill.  Insanely good.  Crispy and flavourful.  That's what kept me from giving it 2 stars.   Decor is cool.  Don't understand the link to the type of cuisine, but it's a cool spot.   Would I go back? Yes, but would order hummus and an order of those Brussels sprouts.... a double batch.

mF69gQz9ilYZJML0eKy85A.text: The food was just ok but not impressive. Environment is great and I like I can see the chefs cooking. The servant was trying to be polite but I can tell his unpleasant smile while we were trying to decide what other foods we can get since they ran out of clam and noodles. The manager stopped by our tables twice to check, which I really appreciate!

QUFX4FbQQu3yOfFQy5ESFw.text: Service was superb and food was exceptional. Everyone raves about the Brussels sprout leaves with shaved almonds - it was very good. The Shawarma and Lamb Orange was very tasty. Beer and wine selection was good.

S1oZ0wtkR6KGZnqWcjvIyQ.text: Came here to celebrate an early bday dinner for my dad, when we arrived there was no wait so we got seated fairly quick and they even gave us a private dining room.   The food here is seriously out of this world !! They do Mediterranean styled tapas here so I recommend each person ordering 2-3 plates and then everyone sharing family style.   Everything was seriously a 5/5 no joke. But here are the things we ordered :  Cucumbers & Yogurt - Kind of a tarty yogurt dip with fresh cucumbers and super fresh hot flatbread for you to dip it in  Brussels Sprout Hearts, Hazelnuts - Super delicious, they were cooked perfectly still crunchy but soft  Tuna Tartare - TO DIE FOR !! The tuna was soo soft and fresh it just melted in your mouth. My dad (who is not a raw fish eater even loved it)  Spinach & Ricotta Dumplings - Yummy balls of goodness, it was more ricotta tasting than spinach but good none the less, and the creamy pesto sauce it was drenched in was cleaned off the plate   Roast Lamb - So tender and juicy and cooked a perfect medium rare. Not all places serve good lamb but Cleo definitely has got it down, it also comes served on a bed of couscous  Merguez - It doesn't say in the description on the menu but it has slices of lamb "pepperoni" if you will and is accompanied with onions, peppers and mozzarella, really good flatbread   Scallops - Melts in your mouth and when it was gone I wanted more ):   Garlic Shrimp - The sauce is what makes the dish !   From now on every time I come to Vegas I'll be making a stop here too

J9cdpHALLmaeaBxEhMMQLA.text: So I've been on a major Mediterranean kick; the food is plentiful and healthy- what more can you ask for?   We've dined at Cleo twice once in the beginning of the year and once last month.  Funny enough we saw our server from our first experience, although she wasn't our sever the second time, and she actually remembered us; pretty neat!  We remembered her too because she was super friendly, chill and easy to talk to- that is always nice when that happens.  Cleo is my dream restaurant, literally if I could pick any restaurant in the world and relocate it to the Bay Area, this is it. I know we have Kokkari but I HEART Cleo!  The decor is exactly my style; slightly bohemian with touches of a 90 year old grandma and the casual yet elegant ambiance we want in a Vegas dining experience.  I don't consider this a pricey meal by Vegas standards, you can come in and try a bunch of small dishes.  Must Try List:  Brussels Sprouts: I have tried to mimic these at home to no avail. They are a must eat, next time I think I'll order one for myself.  Kabobs: We ordered several orders of the Waygu, all the various meats were good but that was the best. Super tender, and a generous portion.  Moussakah: YUM best mousakkah I've ever had, except its super filling and LOADED w cheese. I know that's what you get w a mousakkah but be warned, it will leave you full.  Lamb Shawarma: Easily the #2 favorite thing behind the Sprouts, this was delicious and nothing like what I thought it'd be. I'm not huge into lamb but always order it at finer dining locations, I think this could be the best I've had. Portion is tiny if you have a few meat eaters.  Grilled Octopus: Ignore everything I just said the grilled octopus was REALLY my favorite thing behind the sprouts. OMG I think about this all the time. The texture is unreal, super duper soft and not at all your typical octopus. It's charred to perfection, you won't find a dish like this elsewhere.  Halloumi salad is tasty too!

sLC2aWJWPqqTGeyazApXKg.text: - I liked the space.  Not too loud - I didn't like the booth that they gave to us.  A booth for seven?  Very cramped - Service was friendly.  A little pushy with food recommendations, but not overbearing  The food:  - The octopus was the most tender octopus I've ever had.  The flavor was a little weird though.  Just wasn't my thing.  Too curryish (and I love curry) - The mushrooms were very nice.  Meaty and sweet - The foie gras pate was smooth, buttery, sweet.  Mmmmm - The venison sausage was too sweet and not gamey enough - Of the three dips we had (labaneh, hummus, carrot something), only the hummus was good.  The other two were much too bland or much too carroty - The brussels sprouts had great flavor, but were too greasy - The spicy cigars were a great start.  Enjoyed the crunch and the taste of the herbs in the meat - The bone marrow was ok.  Great presentation, but the mushrooms didn't seem to mesh well - The panna cotta dessert was delicious.  Creamy, smooth, just the right amount of sweet and the figs were excellent  Loved the small plates concept.  Was a little disappointed in some of the food.

gviC6gihAYL1M_cOsZpWaA.text: This was an expensive, but delightful experience! I took in the lamb, the pork belly and the shrimp kabobs with the yummy saffron rice! The artichokes were to die for and so were the Brussels sprouts. That fire pit bread and carrot harissa - YUMMERS!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Come  And  Get  Your  LIFE!!!!!!!

HunxB7WyOXe3NJi527Jegw.text: Food was good/ok. Waiter was pushy towards the chefs taster menu even though we told him we didn't like most of what was on it. 20% auto grat is fine but we should be told at time of check.

9MYpM8FBUMjrsJv3_hiAyA.text: I was invited to dine at Cleo at the all new SLS Hotel & Casino. I didn't know what to expect having known that the property was the former Sahara H&C. Walking into the restaurant I felt like I was walking into a magazine. Everyone from the hosts to the servers were stunning, tall and extravagant. The restaurant has "Trend" down to the letter.   The second we sat down I took in the atmosphere and reveled in the old meets new aspects of the decor, from the beautiful Victorian styled chandeliers to the individualized plates that threw back memories of grandma's fine china cabinet.   We were there on a pre-fixed menu which was fine, but what was a bit unusual was the fact that I didn't have a choice in what was served to me. Granted, all the food that was presented to us was extraordinary but if I happened to be a vegetarian, vegan or just didn't like Chicken I would not have been able to enjoy my meal.  That being said, the Hummus was delectable and flavorful, the Brussel Sprouts was unlike anything I ever had before (and I don't really care for BS), but what was really impressive was their Flatbread. It was definitely worth the meal.  They served us a drink called the 'Vineburry' which took my by surprise. At first it looks gentle enough until you take your first sip. Be warned, this drink is not for the faint of heart. It is infused with Serrano Chili's and therefore has a very strong KICK to it. If you're not into spicy drinks then this is not the one for you.  All-in-all this was an experience worth the effort. If you are staying anywhere near the SLS and looking for an exciting dining affair then you will not be dissappointed.

nRZBIQ0eXVqt-XBjEFi3Sg.text: Their labneh comes to me in my dreams... I love it solo much!  I've been to the Cleo in Los Angeles many times and decided to try out the one in Las Vegas.   The ambiance is great and the food is just as spectacular however... It seems they are understaffed... And I am really sad to say I was disappointed...  I came here with a group and on several occasions they removed my plate while there were still items on it. I had made myself the bone marrow toasts and took one bite and turned to say something to someone at the table and they removed it... Same with a half martini!!!  Come on Cleo!!! You are supposed to let me eat and enjoy your food!!! Food flavor were amazing but I give a two because they kept stealing my food :(

f2Y6ebnj05s5px6LKZ-5ZQ.text: SPEECHLESS!!!!!!!! THE FOOD WAS FAR BEYOND AMAZING.   It was my first time ever trying Mediterranean food and for sure won't ever be my last. everything was perfect.   I highly recommend to try their Scallops, Oysters, Meatballs, Lamb, and most def. for dessert their Sticky Toffee Pudding.

I87kZXqb8m4IkUvHRb_fQA.text: My wife and I visited last night (Friday) before the show at the SLS. It was restaurant week and they had a special menu. My wife also added the wine flight. While waiting for our first course, I read the main menu and noticed that the wine flight "special" for restaurant week actually cost more than if we had bought it from the main menu. Plus, you had to accept the wines they chose - all house wines.   We learned from the hostess that there was also a spring menu that was even less expensive than the restaurant menu. She said she would bring it over but she never did.   Service timing was off all night. My first two courses came out together. My wife's first course came out alone. My wife's second course came out fifteen minutes later. Since I had finished my first two courses, I waited half an hour for my next course. I ordered the flank steak. Chicken was delivered to me. The manager said he would check with our waitress. Both the manager and the waitress passed our table twice again without comment. Ten minutes later, my steak was delivered. My wife was about finished with her meal by then.   The Restaurant Week menu came with dessert. Thirty minutes after our entree dishes were cleared away we asked our waitress what the hold-up was on dessert. She said the tortes would be right out. Ten minutes later, we asked the manager. Ten minutes after that, dessert arrived. The wine flight included coffee. So, my wife was given coffee. I was not asked if I would also like coffee or an after dinner drink.   During the time we were waiting for dessert, the manager stopped by to thank us for dining there. He acted like we were ready to leave. We reminded him we were waiting for dessert. He hurried off never to be seen again.  The restaurant was not busy at all. But, all through the meal, our waitress never smiled once. She told us once she thought it was going to be a long night.   There are a lot of places to eat on the Vegas strip. Cleo will not be a repeat.

3nO9SrwcLRE6D7O42sYqXQ.text: While I would not say this is one of the best meals I have had, I will say it was one of the best for the money.  Very trendy, mediterranean tapas style restaurant.  Open kitchen, in the center of the restaurant.  Food, service, and atmosphere were all very good.  Main reason I am giving this restauran 5 stars instead of 4, is the value.  We had a table of 4, we all had too many dishes, plus a couple desserts, and cocktails.  This all came to only $50 per person, which in most LV places similar, would be $100+ per person.  We will definitely return

nug9ELwWt9pMzelvH6OgHA.text: Big Mediterranean fans and this place delivered. Hummus, Brussels sprouts, octopus, cigar rolls all very good!  Cocktails - exceptional!  We will be back!

0dofFpZR5ZW9rk-pNLK6tw.text: Food here is great!!!!! I recommend share am bunch of dishes to get the whole experience.  But don't forget to order the Brussel sprouts!  They are just crispy and perfectly seasoned. And I just found out that there is one in Cali too!!!  We will be here again for sure!

MM6dIoapJxI16U0Z7TxigA.text: I made a reservation for 6 pm and was seated promptly. I had a party of 4, and we loved every bite!  We ordered: Spicy cigars (don't let the name fool you, they just have a bit of a kick) Lebaneh with feta with lavash chips - my favorite! Hummus with lafa bread Chicken/beef kebabs - which were so tender and mouth watering.  Brussel Sprouts - must try. Merguez Flatbread Garlic Shrimp Falafel Sabra chocolate bar Baklava  My entire party was truly amazed with the flavors in the all of the dishes, and the service provided by Cleo. Harold is also an AMAZING singer! It may be a little pricier than other tapas places, but the quality of the food makes it completely worth it to me. We will definitely be back.

o1ZDo6HYi3lBTePrHCUxQw.text: Being a local I'm always looking for a great spot to have a nice dinner, and I'm soo happy I visited Cleo for the first time last night . I enjoyed every single dish I had , the Manager recommended me The grilled octopus which was my Favorite ,Perfectly cooked !  Paired with some good Moroccan wine . Great service , nice ambiance ! Gotta go back soon to try the rest of the Food .

-YA7mmaYW7_K-KD1me_6pQ.text: OMG finally a decent Mediterranean place in town!!!  Qualiy of food is great.  You feel the freshness.  Prices are reasonable and service is awesome.  Let alone, the design of this venue is really cool, with the wood burning ovn in the center.  Definitely try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great room!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and shrimp kabab.  Manifique!

gZ8vXWWGqfLsKi9075GhJg.text: Yum! This was a solid 4.5 review, but just wasn't in the amazing 5 category. We were at the SLS for the nigjt and didn't want to venture in the heat. Among the options at the hotel, this was the clear winner on Yelp so we decided to give it a try. Even my skeptical BF was happy! Service and ambiance were great. It's tapas style, so we got the hummus to start, the Brussels sprouts hearts, falafel, lamb Sharma, lamb tangine. The falafel and hummus were both awesome, and BF liked the schwarma and tangine (portions were generous although the lamb wasn't as tender as it could have been on the tangine). The Brussels sprouts were the only dish I could have gone without as they were just too salty with the sauce they use. But overall, excellent!

4w3G3M9PI2sdVWLwZp08tQ.text: DELICIOUS! Can't wait to go back! My husband is Lebanese and loves authentic Mediterranean food, I like it but loved the food at Cleo. Great service, great drinks, great atmosphere. What a great way to try different types of food by offering it as a tapas style dining experience. We started off with hummus and baba ghanouj or eggplant dip, their bread is awesome! We then added raw lamb, (kind of like sushi of the Middle East) bone marrow, lamb and beef kebabs along with a Greek salad and dessert. Everything was fantastic, cooked to perfection, go now as it was not crowded and people are not aware of this fantastic dining experience at the SLS casino and hotel.  Ok, we are back! My son was with us and he loved it too!!! Very crowded tonight! Greek coffee and toffee bread pudding for dessert, yum!!!

ndngmhwyuoZYNSsRswT-YA.text: My girlfriend and I were just looking for a place to eat after our first restaurant choice wasn't available. We walked by Cleo and checked out the menu. I can't say anything blew me away and I'm not much of a foodie, but we decided to try it. It's Mediterranean and tapas style so we ordered 4 or 5 different items.  To say I was blown away is an understatement. The service was amazing.. The food was beyond amazing, with some items smelling better than anything I've ever sniffed.  I'm a local in LV and am so happy we found this spot. Will I be back? Oh ya!

03-vzFGHL7PmcB15hU8tAg.text: The carrot harissa is made for a sour loving Persian palate, so keep that in mind. It may not be exactly what you want, but if is a good example of how the restaurant does not aim the food at a common denominator tourist, thereby ruining any chances at an exceptional experience.     This place ends up being cheaper than you'd expect. A group of four was well fed for about 90 when we thought the bill would be 120.  Everything was well made. I would suggest ordering half of what you want, starting on that half, and then ordering the next half. I was going to write something about how you should keep in mind the order for yourself b/c they just bring things out as they're finished. On second thought, there is no reason to worry about your plates clashing with each other, just enjoy the food.

-Pr3M-CArg8zjCrKQCot_w.text: Wow. Just fantastic! Our first night in Vegas and we were exhausted after a hectic travel day. We chose to eat here, and it was just the best decision ever! Fabulous tapas/small plate selections - our server Manny was very helpful with suggestions. Absolutely have the Brussels sprouts - totally amazing. We also enjoyed the scallops, the mushroom flatbread, the chicken tagine, and the hummus.  A wonderful experience for us!

1JEG2xbq_FYkGK2hMf7Vfw.text: This large Mediterranean restaurant has received rave reviews since opening. Located in the middle of the restaurant is an open kitchen dominated by a wood burning oven.  We started off with an order of lebaneh (Lebanese yogurt cheese) with feta that was served with fresh baked laffa bread that we could not stop eating. This order also included eggplant, fennel and chili prepared in the oven.  Next we requested chicken kabobs, spanokipita and lamb tagine with couscous. The chicken was well seasoned, moist and the best we have ever experienced. Though the spanokipita was on the petite size given its price tag, it too was delicious. We were a little less thrilled by the lamb tagine with apricots, silan, sesame seeds over couscous principally because the couscous was bit on the dry side.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tagine
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. eggplant, fennel and chili
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lebaneh with feta and laffa bread

F36DlMuFMmV39rnYZsGQig.text: When we went, there were only about 90 reviews on Yelp. I asked the hostess and I guess they had only opened two months prior. Their biggest problem, as expertly noticed by my ex-waiter fiance, was the inxperienced system. The hostess was running around doing some of duties that I think runners typically have. Once we were sat, we were ignored for a while. I don't blame them. They were far too busy and there were far too few servers... but it was 7pm and in Vegas, attention to detail is everything.  -1 star  The food, however, was largely delicious! Get the kale bread. We expected something bitter, but the creme fraiche made it sweet and savory. It might be the best thing we had that night. We also loved the falafel, but be warned: they are bite-sized. The hummus was great. I was looking forward to the babaganoush but it tasted plain. Nothing to write home about~more cheese than eggplant.  Definitely go, but at not at peak hours until they get into the groove of things.

k27SA1dPI7HfuE5MhwGHAg.text: Probably the best new restaurant I have been to in ages (not counting Wicked Spoon since it is a buffet).  Sit at the bar for attentive service and recommendations from all the bar tenders and servers picking up drinks. Everyone is friendly and has opinions on everything.   Hummus, Brussel sprouts, lamb kefta, grilled octopus, scallops... Absolutely everything was incredible. It would be hard to go back and not order everything I tried already, but will have to remember that anything else is probably equally as delicious.   Do yourself a favor and go immediately.

YYIjrNTz0Fy-VFN_-m922g.text: Amazing food - loved every single bite. Could eat here every week!   The branzino and the octopus was so incredibly good. We love eating tapas and this place might have now ruined us for any future tapas restaurants. We are hooked and.glad to hear there is another location in LA.  Yay!

8iBTw2-1PK9EF5H5sW0k2Q.text: Cleo's at SLS Las Vegas 2535 Las Vegas Blvd South, Las Vegas, NV 89109  I've tried all the SLS restaurants and came away disappointed by most, but Cleo's is their shining star.  I say this surprising myself, because I don't really like Mediterranean food.  We chose it because my son wanted to try it.  Or I should say - I never liked it before.  I have to say that the service and food has been overall disappointing in many of the SLS restaurants with the exception of CLEO'S and Ku Noodles.  Our night at Cleo's was fabulous, almost a complete five stars across the board.   SERVICE:  The service was, hands down, the best service I have had at a SLS or any Las Vegas restaurant in a very long time.  Most restaurants are hiring young, perky, pretty totally inept servers ... but Cleo's workers from hostess to busboy to server were just the BEST.  My beverage glasses were never below half before refilled.  We were checked on numerous times, food arrived fast and in a very timely manner and it was the right temperature.  The servers were attentive without being bothersome.  Wow.  Kudos to the entire staff for actually training and using the best servers.  They made our experience exceptional.  FOOD:  We ordered coffee and water to drink.  We changed from sugary beverages to water with lemon as a healthy step, and added coffee as a treat.  Some servers give you a cheap look when you order water, but not here, and it came with a side dish of lemons.  Nice!  The coffee was absolutely delicious.  It was strong but not bitter and very tasty.  We had appetizers which included Lebaneh with Feta (a dip for $9) and I think it's called laffa bread which comes with it.  I though $9 was high for dip, but not for this one!  The bread came in a paper bag, nice and warm, and the best bread I've ever tasted.  I could have made a meal out of just bread and dip.  The dip was feta cheese with a vinegarette tastiness, sooo good, we practically fought over it.  We'll order it every visit.  We also ordered Spanikopita ($9), which was three triangle shaped crisp dough tapas.  I didn't care for these but I'm sure they were made right.  My son really liked them.  We also ordered the Brussels Sprouts ($12) which was charred with capers, almonds and vinegarette (similar to the Sprouts at Katsayu next door).  They are absolutely delicious and I'll order them every visit.  For our main course I order the lamb kabobs ($14) which was three small perfectly cooked tender lamb chops with sauce.  My son order the Seasonal Flatbread ($14) with gruyere cheese, chili and arugula.  The lamb was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Neither of us liked the flatbread.  The flavor was just okay, and the bread was a little burnt and over crispy.  But that might be the way it comes .. other people have commented that it is very good.  For dessert we shared the Sticky Toffee Pudding ($9) which didn't seem like a pudding at all.  It was a warm chocolate cake with cold scoop of ice cream in a shallow dish with a little caramel like dripping in the bottom.  It was delicious, just not what we expected.  AMBIANCE:  The restaurant has a beautiful layout and decorations.  However, we found the tables, especially those for just two people, to be very small.  There was barely room for a plate each, let alone a couple of appetizers with drinks.  And it was so loud in the restaurant that we almost had to shout to share comments about the food.  Some of the noise came from the music, but the rest was from people around us just being very, very loud and boisterous.  Maybe that's part of the Mediterranean personality.  SCORE: Service ... 5 stars Food ... 5 stars Ambiance ... 3 stars The total for our meal for two people was $84.

g3mvHY9MhB3C2TkiziY5Fw.text: I am not sure what all the great reviews are about. This place is barely mediocre. The service included.  The falafel, though crispy on the outside, was way too dense on the inside. The little salad with it was better than the actual falafel. Grilled Eggplant was pretty bland. Tender yes, but not seasoned. Again the fennel was better than the eggplant.  Lamb Tartar was pretty tasty. Good flavors and not too gamey.  House Pickles? Um, I guess pickled things are all pickles? Because it was just picked carrots, celery and cauliflower..strange, way too spicy and just doesn't work at all.  Chicken Tagine was fine. I liked the rice more than the chicken. It was buttery and delicious, while the chicken was pretty plain and bland.  I would say the worst dish of the night was the grilled octopus. Very small dish, tasted very bland and not charred. Once again I I enjoyed the garnishes more than the actual star of the dish, which seemed like a pattern throughout the meal.  Scallops, ok so at least you can't mess that up right? No, they weren't seared correctly, so were pretty rubbery and the mistakes were very visible on the plate by anyone who spent more than a few weeks learning any cooking techniques.  Fig and almond panacotta was actually promising, with delicate custard and sweet figs, but then the sauce on top was just unreduced alcohol based sauce which took over the whole thing. This was the first time in a long neither me nor my gf finished a desert. Sauce on top was awful.  Service was ok, but it was my gf's birthday and they knew in advance, but nobody said anything. She was kind of upset, and that alone probably deserves a one star rating. The atmosphere and decor brings it barely up to 2 stars.  Overall very very disappointing.

himuzOaMt-kCin_Tt4fKpg.text: My wife and I loved our meal here! I never thought I would like this type of food, but wow was I surprised! Delicious, every bite! The staff and our waiter were outstanding as well!

J5O_0rU6LLT1pDeh5UeZIQ.text: Ive never been here before! The first experience was OVER THE TOP! It was my husbands and I anniversary, we came to the SLS we had reservations. Once we pulled up to park our vehicle the security guard was very friendly and engaging for the 2 seconds we spoke to him!! Once we head into Cleo they had a beautiful booth with a chandelier above us and waiting for me 24 beautiful roses that they placed in the middle of the table, they asked if we had any requests for music and made us feel VERY welcomed every employee congratulated us on our anniversary, the food was DELICIOUS!! We had cigar rolls and hummus to start and I did not want it to stop coming!!! Also had shrimp, beef and chicken kebabs that were perfectly grilled and seasoned! MUST GO place!!!! WONDERFUL customer service! Btw we chose to go here EVERY anniversary!

9V2QY4O1gXUXmm2suwZiLA.text: I pass this place all the time on my way to Katsuya and stopped by to ask the people at the front desk how it was and my host was there and said "do you want to try it, I'll give you a comp" so I tried it and it was wonderful, I would definitely go back again and again... the service was great ...I sat at the bar and Steven was amazing and friendly and the food couldn't have been better !! I had the pork belly and the heirloom tomatoes with burrata and of course the brussel sprouts which they definitely take up a notch so delicious can't wait to go back !!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cleon at SLS
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most amazing brussel sprouts sliced thin with slivered almonds and fried with the most amazing flavor
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pork belly....maple glazed !!! Yum

EdsNnDSaOJojPT0SQ69sog.text: We love this restaurant. Every time we are in Vegas, we make sure that we stop by at least once. Try their mezzes they are all really good! Their mushrooms and flat breads are also excellent. You also have many options if you are a vegetarian like me. Highly recommended!

usgU79qk4u0gZGj3lOPeBg.text: This Mediterranean tapas place is one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas, and balances between being a hipster-worthy enviornment in the hipster SLS and great cuisine with artful dexterity.  We tried several dishes and all of them were exceptional. The service was equally good. There are far more pretentious places around the Strip slinging high end hash that live on their past glories, or what their chefs did a million miles from Sin City.  This place is organic to its kitchen and True to the art of delivering great mediterranean options with thankfully small enough plates that we could share and enjoy!

RlQTt1DfkTm2-7LLNxxdVA.text: My girlfriends took me here for my birthday and it was wonderful!  The homemade pita bread was so good!  I don't usually like brussel sprouts, but theirs had me trying to figure out how to make the recipe at home!  The flatbread was also very good.  We had such fun sharing everything - they even let me smash plate in honor of my birthday - OPA!

B6icSU5pozsmfSvx3P06Yw.text: Cleo where culinary innovation meets superior service.  Vegas food can be a truly amazing experience but it can often be lost with arrogant or apathetic staff.  Cleo is a star at the North end of the strip.   The food is best described as classic Mediterranean with subtle twists that create complex flavour profiles that make every bite memorable.  The chef at Cleo does an amazing job of rolling three or four distinct profiles in every dish. Hummus -  fantastic creaminess with a hint of cumin Spicy Cigars - crispy filo wrapped around a finely textured wagyu beef Shrimp Kabob - perfectly cooked slightly sweet shrimp  Brussels Sprouts - flash fried leafs in a lemony brine  Lamb Tartare - fresh mild lamb  Hangar Steak and crispy potatoes - so tender with a bold beefy profile  Service - As good as I have had on the strip.  Our server Ricardo was  attentive and knowledgeable. His food descriptions were spot on he knows hi menu!  The house manager was also friendly.  I just can't say enough about Cleo, it's a can't miss if your into food and in Vegas!  Cleo can be recommended for a great fine dining experience.

ybgz7QWEKiilLkNCU6KoPg.text: Very good Mediterranean food. Chicken kebab, spicy potatoes were to die for. Babaganoush is okay. Not necessarily amazing. Lamb shawarma was good especially when you have bite with bread, ricotta cheese and lamb all together.

th8cN6ufAkHho8VJ6y-3Ig.text: Good Service, Good Food  The starters were all awesome.  If it wasn't for the gross lamb/sausage kebobs, I would give it 5 stars.

ak_yvX1aGLMBtApJKlsVLg.text: Cleo holds a special place in my Yelping HEART! I went here for my past Birthday and it was amazing!!! First of all I would like to give a YELPING round of applause to the amazing 5 star customer service at Cleo... secondly... I would also be honored to give a YELPING round of applause to the amazing chef in the kitchen at Cleo. The amazing time started  when we first got there, the host was super friendly and attentive,and I'm not going to mention she was cute...lol...but she was cute...and our waitress was cute 2...lol...but seriously she was an awesome waitress and very very knowledgeable about every single vegan dish they had on their menu. This place is super vegan friendly,they actually have a separate menu for vegans...The menu is A le carte... so I did splurge and order almost everything off of the vegan menu between three people... every single piece of food that we ordered on that menu was "AWESOME"definitely a place for vegan to show off excellent "vegan Mediterranean food" to their carnivore friends,And family.This place is a must visit regardless,if you are a carnivore or vegan. Here's the big question...what I ever go again??? ABSOFREAKINLOUTLEY!!!

dd_maOhDp4J4V-HA5zkU_Q.text: Nothing too crazy. Food is okay. I've been to a lot of Mediterranean places and this one is a bit different. Their bread and hummus is amazing tho! The interior is amazing! But food is just okay in my opinion.

OZh7yuYyC8I8nKe_3u15ww.text: Simply spectacular!! Came in because I saw an ad for the summer menu in our local magazine and I wished I had come in sooner. I was very impressed with the food, every ingredient had a reason for being in that dish. Between two people, we ordered 6 dishes and I was stuffed to capacity. The mushrooms with dates and nuts were insane. My watermelon salad is something to remember for life and the rice under the chicken tagine took me on a trip to Morocco just by it's fragrance. I had to force myself to order dessert because when in Rome... Awesome cocktail and beer list. Try the grapefruit beer! Absolutely yummy! Our server, Ricardo made sure to explain everything on our menu to the last detail and never left us hanging. Excellent service, we were always attended to. Meat lovers and vegetarians could happily dine here together. I appreciated how the manager came around to hear our feedback and I could not fault one dish. My only gripe was we sat at a table right under an aircon vent but that is minor compared to the whole picture and that there is only 3 oysters in a serving which makes it hard to share. Overall, a lot of creativity went into the menu and I appreciated it. Kudos for churning out top quality dishes plate after plate. Just perfect. And I can't wait to go there again.

kqKdipGb9gKEIpxOZ5SJLQ.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas. I can't pass this place when I am in town. It will not count a trip to Vegas if I don't eat here. It's been a traditional for me. Great service, friendly staff, and manager Spencer is very kind! He accommodates every customer pleasantly.  Love this place! Harrira soup is a must have.

SxSz5q3YjuQKGFclG8WwgA.text: Dinner at Cleo was great! The kale flat bread and the chicken tagine were my favorite. And the service was great, our server Manu made some great recommendations. Thanks!

6bx0BDmv5Ofe2i7-szI4fg.text: Just not a big fan of food on the Vegas Strip - too fancy, too pretentious and of course too expensive.  Cleo is an exception to the rules.  Located in the SLS Hotel (formerly the Sahara) in the DMZ between the Strip and Fremont Street, this restaurant did turn out to be a rather pleasant surprise.  And Eastern Mediterranean tapas (Greek, Lebanese, Turkish) is a very nice break from the norm, so a welcome change of tastes.  Small plates which our server recommended four per person to start.  And with five diners - a lot of sampling was going on.  The menu is a bit limited, but enough to choose from and have a well rounded sampling of the cuisines.  Standouts included - a delicious Babaganoush, really good hummus with tahini, the Lebabeh, yogurt, spankopita - all very good.  A variety of bold but not overwhelming flavors and spices that complimented but did not battle each other.  One other standout - the potato latkes - I like a good latke, these were really good.    A nice Harira soup - great tomato base with lentils and veggies and a decent Greek salad.  And really good bread for dipping - fresh and hot.  Only disappointment - the falafel.  Dry, kind of bland, Just not at the same level as all the other dishes we had. Odd.    A word of advice - order no more than three plates per person to start,  You can always add on as you go and not wonder where all this food is coming from and why it keeps coming to the table.

67YUxRMY3DlInwbd40rlvQ.text: We have returned to this restaurant several times since our initial visit and find the food to be stellar. The service is always very good to excellent. But the food! That's the real stand out. The quality and tastes are amazing, the mix of spices and herbs is extremely unique. We have taken several other people to this restaurant in all of them have also raved about the quality and taste of the food.  5 to 7 plates are filling for two individuals. The downside is the price, which tends to run a little bit on the high side. However, with the code, locals can enjoy a 50% off from now through December 23. We have taken advantage of this deal several times and will be sad to see it go.  They also have a gluten-free and vegan menu.

whsdHiMJDD_Qbv2xmQIS0w.text: Awesome meal!!! Service - the best! Food - incredible! Cocktails - delicious!  We had the labneh with fresh baked bread, Greek salad, spanakopita, garlic shrimp, scallops and octopus. Our server suggested 2-3 shareable plates per person and that was perfect. The Old Hollywood and Janapolitan cocktails were great. The staff was unbelievably kind and accommodating to my bell pepper allergy. The food was delicious and beautiful. I highly recommend this as a Vegas dinner destination!!!

9fLwW2Pn8xc-AaT22Vbgjw.text: I had never even heard of Cleo until I was riding the deuce from the strip to Fremont Street. I saw Cleo advertised outside the SLS casino and looked it up on Yelp. I was surprised that it hadn't come up in previous searches given its rave reviews. I knew I had to try it. My friend and I already had dinner plans , so we came to Cleo to try an appetizer and a dessert close to closing time. We had an amazing waitress who was friendly and gave great advice on what to order. We ended up getting the eggplant moussaka and the sticky toffee pudding. The eggplant moussaka was like heaven! The eggplant was tender, beautifully cooked. It had a good balance of richness from the cheese and acidity from the tomato sauce. This isn't the type of dish I would typically order, but this dish inspired me to try moussaka again. The dessert was also on point, but maybe not quite as good as the eggplant. The sticky toffee pudding was served warm with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream and a tasty sauce on the bottom of the plate. The next time I'm in Vegas I would like to try a full meal at this restaurant. It was definitely worth the somewhat high price point.

3bhj8vpoTZG8wr5wYdNU6Q.text: Overall, this place is great. However, there are a few sparse items that are simply epic. Any meal that you can say 'was the best xxxx ever' wins huge marks. To be specific, the Cucumber & Yogurt was 'the best ever!' And of course their Laffa is amazing. Besides that, everything I ordered was 'great.' The server recommended  the Shawarma, I'd prob get something more I interesting next time.  Best option at the SLS

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert was the only relative miss of the meal.
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken kebab. Good, but wouldn&#39;t reorder.
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Cucumber dip ever.

MK5R1cw6ip3LYxZ8tSBpng.text: This is our favorite tapas restaurant. Service is great and food is delicious. Recommend Cleos to everyone.

rCUpQqiw-tF6nub3_UvlEA.text: Great staff, great happy hour, it's dark in there but a nice atmosphere farther into the restaurant so you don't feel like you're in a casino so much. The food was excellent, great bread, dips, beet salad, shrimp entree, sprouts, no complaints! No drink reviews. It wasn't too busy so I didn't feel bad letting them work around my pace, which was an early in the week day. If it was busier I suspect a party of one wouldn't get this level of attention. Thanks for a great meal.

ZiN9RrSI5439rE0xem1bjQ.text: Went there for my wife's bday celebration before a show. Great service by Jessica. Food was excellent . Atmosphere was quiet and relaxing. The lamb there was served to perfection. We would definitely return there for another dinner.

qbbMLApqSy22ShzSDHJH1g.text: 5 stars because the chef personally came out and greeted us and made sure to explain that the dishes were cooked without any nuts since my husband has a severe nut allergy.  Tapas style Mediterranean food with small dishes to share family style. Scallops, grilled octopus, roast lamb, hangar steak all made to perfection. The grilled octopus was definitely my favorite. Lebaneh and cucumber dips were delicious also.  Had a nice selection of wines and beers on tap - service was impeccable. Will absolutely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels sprouts!

dcYovDANggiQ0dQg25Gwfw.text: Great small plates. Enjoyed their Social Hour prices. Service is spot on and the food is well prepared. Manny was our server and he was attentive with the right amount of friendly. We enjoyed the Branzino and Brussels Sprouts (Social Hour menu). Moroccan fried chicken was good but I don't think I would order it again. Price for 3 dishes and 2 beers was $51 (gratuity not included). Not too shabby for Vegas. I am not local but my dining companion is and she has never been disappointed.

JNOB5BCCl623nlzV_cjSTg.text: Pleasantly surprised by this place.  Like the atmosphere - not too loud and the middle area is a bar with tandoori oven.  We decided to share tapas style and frankly it was too much. Their portions were more generous than most Vegas restaurants.  Amazing: - Feta dip with bread - Clementina cocktail! - Brussels Sprout Hearts with chili - Spanakopita - Moussakah (I don't like eggplant - this was awesome!) - Grilled Octopus  Okay, would have it again: - Cucumber yogurt with bread - Hummus  (average) - lamb sliders  Not good: - Nothing :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Clementina
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili Brussels
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 dips with bread

4PWoRxdzBIppiCtPzuIMzQ.text: A fantastic experience. The food was the star, everything we tried was just incredibly flavorful. Most of our order was tapas-style and shared between the three couples in our party. Three of us had salads--I had the Greek salad which, while simply adorned with olive oil and oregano, was deeply flavorful. The hummus and the falafel were standouts, as were the wagyu beef, chicken and shrimp kababs. Our server, Lindsay was wonderful: professional, knowledgeable, warm and personable. The atmosphere was elegant. I would recommend Cleo without reservation, and will most assuredly dine here again when I am next in Las Vegas. (Dined here on September 1, 2017)

GeqfniwuPxyTvbGZYy9ajQ.text: Yup, really good. Loved it! Took my mother for dinner, we are a vegetarian and a vegan and there was loads of choice. The food was delicious, the flatbreads fresh and warm, the dips freshly made and tasty. We ordered spicy potatoes which were fabulous and so were the chargrilled artichokes. All in all a really great meal paired with a mid priced but decent bottle of Pinot. Five stars!

48a4A2YXYOWrHuA5Lk-eQw.text: I was very skeptical about this spot.  First it's almost impossible to find good authentic legit spots on the Las Vegas strip for exotic cuisines- hispanic, Asian middle eastern, etc. If you want one, go off the strip.   second A place that proudly serves "Middle eastern" and also "Greek" food usually misses those authentic flavors. For example serving Jewish Latkes, Israeli/middle eastern humus, and Greek moussaka is usually just too much for a fusion.   And yet, the food was tasty! Even tough it wasn't 100% loyal to the original flavors or shapes of the Middle East the food was yummy! And I do have to give them a round of applause for their hummus. Simply really good!  The lamb shawarma was also good. And branzino fish with labaneh was on point.   Even though our hostess did a terrible job, our server was lovely.   So bottom line. Worth visiting. A solid 4 stars spot.  Trust me. I know food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Branzino and Labaneh
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Purple Potatoes

LVrJqwAXt8Nz_eReIiSguA.text: We celebrated New Year's Eve by having dinner at Cleo with another couple. We first ordered hummus and dolmatas. The hummus was about the best I've ever had. Unfortunately there were only 3 dolmatas and 4 of us. Seems weird to have an odd number of them.  For sides we ordered the roasted beet salad and brussels sprouts-both were great. The main courses were the Chicken Tagine, scallops, and a shrimp dish. All were excellent. Everything tasted fresh and unique. The chicken on the bone and it made it hard to share. There were also only 3 scallops for $26.00. Since the concept of tapas is to share, then it would be great if the numbers were even and the chicken cut up off the bone to facilitate sharing.  We all ordered cocktails, each of us ordered something different. While all were tasty, they seemed really light on the alcohol. At $15.00 a drink ($20 when you add on tax and tip), a more generous poor would have been nice. The service was very good, almost a little too good as the servers were ready to whisk away the dishes before we were done dipping bread in the wonderful remnants at the bottom. Overall I'd give the food quality 5 stars, only marked down for ease of sharing dishes intended to be divided up.

z3fJA-nLM_2EFGNI3oCspQ.text: Exquisite & Chic Mediterranean cuisine, served in a striking & sexy atmosphere! The entrance is shaped like a Pyramid, when you walk in you can smell the aromas of the open kitchen, the striking ambiance with the chandeliers, Moroccan tiles and plush decor of green drapes makes it so alluring & sumptuous.  The food is outstanding, carefully seasoned & intensely flavored, the portion size is perfect!  The service was above & beyond helpful and attentive, they went out of the way to make a birthday girlfriends weekend very memorable.   I definitely will return for another incredible & "Unforgettable" dining experience at "Cleo"

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An Unforgettable experience at &#34;Cleo&#34;.   Mwah
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank you Cleo!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sexy Chandeliers!

GXV_Eeru28G85u77aM5I4g.text: Cleo restaurant in Las Vegas SLS delivers amped up conviviality over classic shareables such as homemade laffa breads and dips, meatball tagine, kebabs, hummus, chicken shawarma and moussaka baked in a central wood-burning oven. Jessica was our waitress and was sweet as can be. For dessert we enjoyed the flourless chocolate cake with vanilla gelato.   Can't wait to go back!

mr6aK-IGyJtROrUbZoWjoA.text: The food is pretty good but definitely pricey, so be prepared to fork out some greens.   The portions are very very small, so expect to order at least 3-4 dishes per person. Nothing is complimentary, so when asked if you want more laffa bread, know that you are paying for it. We got 11 tapas to share between the 3 of us, and I have to say I wasn't full. Each dish was prepared well, tasted good, but the presentation was seriously lacking for such a fine dining establishment. The service was good, but our waiter kept pushing us to order more drinks. Not sure I like being hustled while having dinner.   There was definitely alot of tight dresses barely covering fake parts on some of the customers dining at the restaurant. Big hair and lots of makeup seems to be the norm here also.   Ok meal, probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

FGPlBimF1UrVx2wQqttLFw.text: We are new to Las Vegas and wanting to spend our first year anniversary in a really good great romantic restaurant. I looked around trip advisor and yelp and found this one. Probably one the few restaurant s in its class that lets you book for free without putting hundreds of dollars even before you get there. They are more of a small plate restaurant with amazing flavors. The serving size is excellent for sharing, we ordered the spiced potatoes, the chicken tagine, the roast lamb and everything was on point. No long wait the ambience is incredible we didn't try the cocktails but did go for the dessert. Sticky toffee pudding highly recommended!

JxBZul-G4qfiempxupzZWQ.text: This was our absolute favorite dinner of our trip and is a restaurant that we will return to on every trip. We are a big fan of tapas-style dining and Mediterranean food, and this place exceeded expectations. We ordered hummus, babaganoush, falafel, marinated olives, Brussels sprouts, a quinoa and vegetable salad, and cauliflower. Everything was absolutely superb and we thought it was one of the best meals that we have ever had in Vegas. The service and look of the restaurant also made the experience top-notch. We also thought that the meal was a shockingly good value. I would highly recommend Cleo to anyone who likes Mediterranean food.

3bIW9BvLQgc8Z_OLKexEdg.text: I love the Cleo in LA so when my boyfriend and I were in Vegas we wanted to go here. Everything on the menu is tapas style so make sure you order a good amount of food. I love the fact that Cleo is in the SLS hotel whch is far away from the strip and not so crowded. I actually got to enjoy my intimate dinner with my boyfriend. We did a few of our favorite dishes. Everything on the menu is seriously so delicious!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Branzino.
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Safron rice, Shrimp and beef skewer.

3kYy48GzFaTebXupevZtoQ.text: If I have ever overdone it while eating - this might of been it.  This spot is all small plates - meant to share with your table. So naturally we got a ton of things! Here's what I remember:  Wagyu kebabs - really good! lamb sliders Brussel sprouts pork belly - really well done! It melted in my mouth. hummus spinach dumplings - these things were incredible! Possibly my favorite of the night! Plus I am sure a couple of more things.  Really everything was delicious. Towards the end we couldn't do anymore and left a couple of things on the table...but really every single dish had a great presentation and tasted fantastic.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated with the kitchen right in the middle (with a really cool smoke stack/oven (?) running right up the middle of it and into the roof.  Granted...It is a little pricey, but considering it's inside of a resort - and the quality is great - you expect it to be a little pricey.

MVoywtuy2kbPwUvjoHVCvA.text: Update: Checked out this spot once more and the service was slow and inattentive. I had written a stellar review previously but this time the food came out cold and it seemed as if no one cared. Maybe I came on a bad day. Understaffed maybe? Eh. I'd skip it.

gwgFgVdcNhb8QlouJvWrwA.text: Really gorgeous! Chandeliers, green velvet curtains, English flower plates, stacked books, open kitchen. Perfect place for a cozy dinner party. Our favorites were the lamb schwarma, grilled octopus (so amazingly tender) and wagyu beef kebab.  We also ordered the latkes, pork belly, moussoukah, lamb sliders, shrimp kebab, sticky toffee pudding, and spanakopita. They were all good, although not as dynamite for me as the above 3.

vO95P4eyitPRriNvP5QSPQ.text: LOVED Cleo.  First off, I enjoy tapas-style dining as long as the little plates keep coming and I don't end up hungry later on (not a problem at Cleo.)  It's about the explosion of lots of different flavors and textures.  Had the pleasure of dining with three others, so we were able to order two of the fixed-price menu items which came with lots of different dishes.  The grilled octopus was amazing - not rubbery like octo can be - delicate, flavorful and delicious!  We sample meats - grilled hangar steak and roast lamb...mmm.  Enjoyed different salads - watermelon salad was a hit!  The mushroom flatbread (think thin crust pizza) was INCREDIBLE!  Seriously, the meal was excellent!  Other than the restaurant being very busy and loud, the service was efficient and friendly, the decor warm and inviting - Cleo scored big-time in my book.  5 stars, can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The oven is the centerpiece of this amazing restaurant. Try it, you&#39;ll like (maybe love) it!

8-U3yQnvxLGIG3kWQEwcsQ.text: My husband & I enjoyed a wonderful Anniversary Dinner @ Cleo Restaurant in the SLS Casino last evening! The atmosphere was lovely, the service was excellent, the dinner scrumptious, and the wine, out of this world! We ordered: Roast Lamb ~ Sonoma Lamb, Lebaneh, Israeli Couscous                      Lamb Tagine Apricots, Silan, Couscous, Sesame Seeds                      Villa Ponciago 2012 ~ Red Wine from Beaujolais, France The portions were just right! The price was less than expected. I totally recommend a trip to Cleo's when you are in Las Vegas! We are locals, so we will definitely have dinner there again!

v_KHrrS1MXZBjasuGDkGEg.text: Delicious food. Loved the shawarma. All food is tapa style so order a lot of different things. Authentic taste and good drinks.

nJTb5brKdCu0Q3hoKKZQIQ.text: Cleo for fine dining was the perfect ending to my stay at the SLS. Very shareable nice classy Atmosphere the Decour was perfect and the food was delicious I was stuff in a matter of minutes and the food just kept coming. My server with Stacy who was the perfect waitress ever and explain in depth the food and the mediterranean   background of the restaurant  she was very very polite and beautiful. I would recommend and I dine there again Thank you for the wonderful experience.

99NJJowZpaVEoqxbDzgMqg.text: Every time we come to Vegas, we always make reservations to Cleo's! The oysters are as fresh as they should be. They practically dissolve in your mouth. The bone marrow is another one of our favorite.

ixHcUSLV6-nYmp4gOsORuA.text: Fantastic Mediterranean food! You would be missing out if you didn't start with the fresh bread served in a brown paper bag with the accompanying dips. The lebnah is a must get! We enjoyed it so much that we ordered two!

xirFYFrba3LV_T0K9aAnCw.text: My husband and I stayed at the SLS for four days and we ate here everyday! The food was incredible and the service was spectacular. They have True professionals working there. Definitely check out their happy hour, but save room for dessert!

vTaz9jDIiU49IB4LZzU-tw.text: Wow!  I've never had high quality Mediterranean food before. The wagyu beef kabobs were so good that I repeated my order. The falafels were off the charts. However the Brussel sprouts were a little greasy. I'll definitely return. Super surprised.

erJ3M6wz9SyM7osjiiPoDA.text: I really loved this place! We checked it out for a date night while in Vegas (we stayed at the SLS, so it was a quick trip down from our room).   Our server was soooo friendly and amazing (I really wish I could remember his name!). He was so patient and helpful with answering any questions we had. Food was fantastic, and the small portions were surprisingly filling. Kebobs were amazing, rice was perfectly cooked, and the Lebanah appetizer dish was perfect.   I'm half Lebanese and was familiar with the Middle Eastern dishes on the menu. I saw Kibbeh Nayeh (what they call "lamb tartare") on the menu before going and was craving it soooo much. However, it wasn't as authentic or tasted as I'd hoped, but still ok! They basically took the traditional dish and gave it an upscale twist. The crackers that it came with had a huge spice kick, so I ate it with the pita that was served with our Lebaneh. If it's your first time trying a raw meat dish (like my boyfriend), its great!  Overall, I'd definitely recommend for the service and the quality that you experience while dining here. Very worth it!

NdUsLNmsupPZdev7r1palA.text: AMAZING. such a great experience, exquisite flavors, and great staff. I love try my new places, so it is hard for me to go back to the same place again, but this is absolutely on the list of restaurant necessary to go back to every time I travel to Vegas! One of the best meals I've had -- EVER. the scallops, crispy Brussels sprouts, cauliflower, etc etc were to die for. Make a reservation and GO!

ozJA63nZg1h6LcKgf9aLgg.text: Amazing food. Enjoyed every moment.  Food is incredibly good and delicious and prices are super affordable

PObd_KDNtAeKtIe5brZZ0w.text: Reservation took in the morning via the hotel and excellent service there. Being seat in the middle of the room ordered couple cocktail who made forever to come. The waiter even took the order before we got our cocktails. Ordered un simple vegetable couscous and same thing. My guest were finish before I got my meal. The waiter compted my meal on the spot. Food was excellent and nothing to say there. The waiter was very polite and understanding but the flow between the bar, kitchen and the table was not there. I will go back since it is already my 5th visit, I never got a bad meal there and I consider Cleo the best Restaurant in town for the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable cous

WOCOckOzlZ4VcImhPnjNbg.text: Great restaurant with a very cozy feel. The portions are Small but packed with lots of flavor. Decorated with beautiful chandlers definitely a great spot for a fun evening. The food is very delicious. Portions are small but packed with lots of flavor.  Their fresh baked bread is delicious   Appetizer.  Lebaneh with feta is a MUST Hummus with tahini was ok Brussels sprouts with almonds and capers is really tasty but a little too much oil.  Falafel was good  Sliders are very tasty another must (2 per order)  Greek salad is very good and fresh.  For desert we ordered the sticky toffy.  A little too sweet for my Taste buds I really liked the fig and almond pannacota.  Overall great food. Great service I will definitely come back.

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful private dining area
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky taffy a little too sweet for my tastebuds

Bgp-wr8-INQNUYV0-u9r8g.text: After having a few french restaurants, we needed to diversify our culinary appetite. :)  I'm usually not a fan of tapas style menus, but Cleo pulls it off very well. Grilled Octopus, Lamb Chops, pork belly, hummus with laffa bread, spiced cauliflower, and just about everything else delicious. Even for tapas, they are large enough for two people to share and get a good portion of it to satisfy the palate.  Would definitely come back for more.

O9We83hWc-VxUvBFunmV5w.text: This restaurant is inside SLS hotel. Very fancy, great ambiance and such friendly and professional staff. But the food and drinks didn't hold up. The style in this restaurant is tapas and drinks. So you order small plates to share with cocktails and drinks. Two of us had market mohito which had an artificial flavor and was not good at all. My other friend got a drink named lotus something and she was very happy with her drink. It is worth mentioning that our waitress came in checking on our drink. Probably if we have told her we are not enjoying it she would have changed them. But we were too tired and too shy. We ordered five different tapas from the menu. Lamb kebob, shrimp kebob, and lamb kefta and none of them were really good. Falafel was bland and tasteless. The only good thing was mushroom flat bread. This one was really good. This is a nice restaurant with good staff but they have to improve food and drink quality.

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom flat bread, this one is worth trying
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Market mohito, too artificial flavor

RX5M2OWn-iksJ4B3hLztLQ.text: They have nailed the fusion Mediterranean food menu.  We ordered the cucumber yogurt, hummus (best I've had) and cigars. Delish!  Or cocktails with vodka and a dash of Serrano chilis was killer. Our entrees roasted lamb and chicken tagine were spot on and perfect portions.  It is important to state that even though we made reservations - once we were seated the service was impeccable. We received our food quick and perfectly presented. We frequent the SLS Hotel and we will definitely be back!

wURJr2iewhyXpeojK3ClEA.text: The best in Mediterranean cuisine, this place offers a unique experience that is up to par with the Vegas best. The ambience is very unique and gives a good feel of authenticity, but at times confusing with random decor. Service is fast and quick and very accommodating. Our appetizers and food as the pic that came out in due time and we're all great. Portion sizes were very small so we had to order a lot to be satisfied. Pricing is not cheap but worth the quality. If you don't mind paying a lot for small portions and try different things, this place is a must

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JWN8njZVnutZJ1pXYH_C8g.text: Top 10 dinners ever! Even the staple Greek salad was exceptional. Ordered from the social hour menu (5 -7), you must have the grilled octopus, even if you have never tried this before, it will become the gold standard. I also had the raw oysters, that and a yogurt dip, and my meal was complete. Staying 2 days in Vegas , for work, zero interest in gambling, sorry, but Cleo will be highlight of this leg of my journey.

GCbURRdg_7qvUiSpOMeyhA.text: Enjoyed an amazing meal here! Started with the Lebaneh with feta dip, which was very flavorful and creamy. The laffa bread that came with it was fresh and soft. The spicy potatoes were tender and delicious and were well accompanied by a cilantro aioli. The Greek salad was just as expected, nothing too special here, but the feta was great. The highlight were the kabobs, which were very well seasoned and perfectly cooked. Get the Wagyu kabob!! I highly recommend Cleo!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy potatoes
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lebaneh with Feta
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek salad, three skewers with saffron rice: chicken, Wagyu and shrimp

9Y6vckHxAk592UqZcCbT9A.text: This is probably the best Mediterranean that I have ever had. We wanted to try a conceptual restaurant on our anniversary and Cleo seemed to be a nice option.   It turned out to be awesome. There is an artsy black and white Cleopatra picture outside the restaurant. Beauty of the restaurant starts here. The interiors were fab.  The unique thing about this place is - Though its a high end restaurant, they serve decent quantity plates for reasonable prices. So you can try many dishes with no worry of shelling out lots of money.   Every dish we ordered was top notch. Chicken Tagine was the best. The rice in it was so full of favours that I might go to Vegas just to have this again. Moussakah was another gem. You got to try these both here. Hummus and Peta were so different from other Mediterranean places we have been to.   This is going to be a tradition for us to visit this place whenever we go to Vegas

Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tagine. Took it at the end of the meal.

pDij_NcZbTXM4WVBAvD4BQ.text: Not impressed. Came here for dinner on my birthday and was a bit disappointed with the food. The beets in the beet salad was too tangy, the Brussels sprouts was too oily. The hangar steak was nothing to rave about. The octopus and the lamb chops were the highlight of the dinner. Thank God for the amazing fig and amaretto pannacota which saved the night... Although on the sweet side,  the generous amount of amaretto made up for it. Service was very good though.

impQfI6LcK6gyQ8OXFtT5Q.text: I chose to stay in the SLS because I feel their food selections are above par in comparison with some other resorts or hotels close by (for an affordable rate). Cleo was no exception, service was decent to good, food was delicious. I had the lamb schwarma, spanakopita, and brussel sprouts. All were amazing except the brussels cooled off so quickly. It would be better if they were served in a hot skillet or something to keep them at serving temp.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb schwarma, spanikopita, and brussels.

10O98xDtN_OJUvHfNCXokg.text: I don't know why this place isn't packed nightly. 5 of us went on a Friday night and there were 3 other tabled in there at 7pm. The food was amazing, the service was amazing. Maybe the location keeps people from going. Don't let that keep you from trying Cleo. Vallet is still free and the hotel is very beautiful. Please go to this place at least give it a chance.

cG8SQnlLeXd1kOyQtyIGCA.text: A YELPers dream came True 2 weeks ago...   I really can't believe this place doesn't get more attention because I've had a hard time not thinking about this meal. Cleo is a tapas style restaurant so sharing is recommended. The highlights on the menu are the BRUSSEL SPROUTS, BRANZINO, the OYSTERS, and the SALAD with the watermelon! I could not contain my joy during dinner and in my mind kept on saying WOW/WHOA/OMG/HOW?/THE FLAVORS!  It's definitely hard for me to say this, but this might be one of the top 3 best restaurants I have ever eaten at, ever! Thank-you CLEO!!

a9S2JY_WMVfBM7cmuvt2Tg.text: Overpriced!! Atmosphere was very cool, different and trendy, but the two of us shared 5 small tapas and left hungry and $120 poorer.   Most of the food was decent, but only the roast lamb with couscous stuck out as being amazing. Would highly recommend coming to this restaurant and simply ordering a few of that dish and leaving completely satisfied.   I love the idea of Mediterranean food, and Las Vegas does not have very many Mediterranean restaurants, but I couldn't recommend this as a "must try."

H7vMGHHoC5IhBg1dW0vFhQ.text: We had to run in here quick but everything we got was delish!! Would come back when we have more time :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half eaten mushrooms!!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels sprouts!!
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled octopus!!

2Lu9HEP7Zn0P-amZewmfjQ.text: Checked out Cleo in the SLS Las Vegas ... Decor is great, Classic blue Chevron tile floor, colorful plates and pottery  chairs at bar as well as at the tables are not comfortable for bigger people.  The chairs around the dining kitchen are great.  Bar staff was great had one of their signature cocktails, the Adriatic Fresh and it was great.  In the dining area, the lighting was a bit too dim for me and the space got very loud at times with boisterous celebrations from a few tables, but it's Vegas and anything can happen anywhere.  Cleo is a tapas concept so we ordered a bunch of stuff...the stand out was the Chicken Liver dip, the Garlic Shrimp, and the Harira Soup.  Everything had great flavor and was well prepared.  There similar and less expensive options off the strip, but for the single serving experiences the strip offers, this is a great addition The Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Shrimp
