Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Liver Dip

KquCoLPdmT5stm-vR6whsg.text: Came with a group of five friends. 3 omnivores, 2 vegan/vegetarian . I loved their Vegan menu. They had so many great options for everyone to choose from. Service was outstanding. The management and the staff provided such an amazing service.  I would definitely be back to this location.  Food was amazing.

-GGppFHGbqxqvlyXE6VMZQ.text: We decided to give Cleo a second try based on the recommendation of our friends who come here fairly often. Also, we got the Travel Zoo "deal" for a 3 course price-fixed menu for the bargain price of $55 for 2. For those who don't read to the end of the review, I will start by telling you NOT to get the Travel Zoo coupon. You save about $5 to $10 a couple but are stuck with a very limited menu to chose from. Not worth it!! We started with the hummus. My wife thought it was pretty good, my vote was meh. Before we were half way through the hummus, they brought our salads to the table. What was the rush?? The table is small and already crowded. Why bring one course on top of the last? The server told us they bring the food out as it is ready. Really? Makes you feel rushed. An OK policy for Dennys, shouldn't be for a high end restaurant. And the restaurant was less than half full. No need to push us out that fast. My wife had the Greek Salad and thought it was good. I had a chopped salad. Meh at best. Left over a good part of it. Next we had the chicken kabob. The chicken was moist, but bland. It was OK, but nothing special. Next we shared the "giant" shrimp in garlic sauce. Yes, "giant" shrimp is an oxymoron. But this really wasn't since these were the smallest "giant" shrimp I have ever been served. Their consistency wasn't good, they were chewy, and the garlic sauce was bland. We left over half. Finally came the mushroom flat bread. This was the highlight of the meal. It was above average. Not good, but a little better than OK. Considering the price, not a good value. The service was fair. It's hard to feel good about the service when you feel the food is being rushed. The manager did come by to find out how we liked the meal. When I told him, he offered to comp a dessert and coffee. We took a pass. I just wanted to go home. I won't be back.

HYr-Z193kO_8Sst10b8e4A.text: Arrived late last night. Good food, good service, good time! Had the hummus, lamb kabob, moussaka, and cauliflower. The cauliflower was great! The moussaka was ok, not bad just not classic enough for me. Great vibe and attentive service!

4QMg6_t03btKF0bTMCGg_Q.text: If you want to reset your palette from steak houses, Italian food, or Asian food this is the perfect place.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you are tired of steak, Italian restaurant or Asian food... This is great place to reset your pallet

yKvQ0Bc08kdKyzIXYG9bVQ.text: FOOD POISONING.  This place went from my fave down into the toilet.  Literally.  I ate here with my BF on Xmas night 2017.  We don't live or work together and this was the only meal that we had that wasn't with other people that didn't get sick, so positive that we got it here.  Anyhow, the food is tasty, but not worth the 24 hours of projectile vomiting and diarrhea that followed.  I called the day after I recovered and the manager was kind and said he would report it to Risk Management and get back to me.  No follow up, so I will be calling the health department myself.

Jx05twD6plyFGoBpLvx-Dw.text: We love the SLS and are staying here for our second time this summer. We usually leave the hotel for dinner, but tonight decided to stay put. Great decision because we wound up at Cleo. Everything was so delicious! We ordered Babaghanoush and Labneh with Feta with veggie sticks. Also the Lamb Shawarma, Longanisa sausage, and Quinoa salad with Roasted Vegetables. My boyfriend who is Lebanese and familiar with real authentic Mediterranean foods said that Cleo tasted like Lebanon to him (that's a great compliment!)  Thank you Cleo, we will be back!!! Your service was great too! All the staff were friendly and nice. Our server was very knowledgeable. It was a great dining experience!!!

QwdP87Ir1FiWcldZeNA9pg.text: Great service and interesting menu!  Lots of choices for small plates and server and other staff were very helpful.  Delicious!

Rp8B9sH79m4jUyK7EeTqyQ.text: I've definitely had better Mediterranean food, but we enjoyed the ambiance. Came with a large group of 15+, think this place is more suitable for smaller groups of less than 5.

sewb9pkf_G3TCDF_qFsbDw.text: I have been wanting to try Cleo since the SLS opened and I am happy to say that I wasn't disappointed! First of all, I love the decor! We were seated at one of the more private tables, just to the side of the front entrance. I was happily surprised not to be distracted by the noise of the casino. The room itself was comfortable with thick velvet curtains and an awesome chandelier. Everyone at the table also loved the eclectic plates you dine from.  Service was great from start to finish. The chicken kabobs, falafel, spanakopita,  Dolmades, clams, tuna tartare, squid, cous cous soup and everything else we had was delicious. We ate everything plus dessert! Our bill was just under $200 ( before tip) for six of us! We didn't drink any alcohol though... I can't wait to dine here again but my husband wants to try Bizarre Meats first!  Cleo is obviously great for groups since it is Mediterranean tapas. I'm coming back here for my next birthday dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FHNpcpLqHHTqwbabGShPRg.text: Cleo is just about the only venue that can convince me to drive down to the SLS. I must say I love Mediterranean food, and Cleo has some really delicious dishes. Lebneh with Feta appetizer, Tabouleh and Lamb Tagine. The funny thing is that menu isn't what you would call traditional Mediterranean cuisine, and the palette I'd call rather bold. At any rate, dishes are very delicious and definitely worth the try.  A bit loud, but I'm not gonna take a star away for that. Some people tend to like noisy restaurants.

TrC98yII2Qdse6erqAgULQ.text: I usually don't write reviews but for this place it is a must. Best Mediterranean food I've had in town, we had the lebanah with feta to start, spicy cigars are a must and don't even get me started on the lamb shawarma, it's incredible! I love the ambiance and decor. Service was fast and attentive definitely will return!

VNYBxs5-lu2lfF8puT8k4g.text: Very tasty food. And our server was nice and helpful. We had hummus, tomato salad with burrata, brussel sprouts with hazelnuts and Lamb tangine. One anomaly was the falafel which was overcooked and horrible. We sent it back and they took it off the bill. Everything was delicious except the falafel. Flatbread here is super good. I really appreciate our server (Saira) helping us not over order since this is a tapas style eatery. Wish we could of tried more.

OnGRQz7PDGUCCWOtgdUv1A.text: This place is delicious, it's a tapas style restaurant so it can become very pricy but the food is delicious. I highly recommend the lamb sliders, the service is super friendly and you can watch the food being made In the middle  . It's a very quaint restaurant

qDZ03PSGFWGq1gkA1nps_w.text: I went to SLS to give this place a try , and boy it was impressive . The best hummus I've ever had. Laffa is amazing . The restaurant is beautiful and cozy . The staff are pleasant and helpful . I will definitely be back.

amZFMcOjOV8dgc-p2svOFw.text: The only reason I give this place two stars is because they almost killed me. In my reservation on OpenTable and when I entered the restaurant and when we talk to the waitress we told her multiple times about our food allergies. But somehow she failed to connect that with the chefs.  Two of the dishes we received had our allergies and  one was actually eaten. We had to write an incident report with the SLS and the manager had to handle the situation because the waitress was unable to. She couldn't even list the ingredients that were in many of the food that we ordered.  The busboys knew more then her.   On the slightly positive note about the restaurant some of the dishes we ate were very good. The shwarma  was excellent and so were the kebabs. We did not receive most of our dishes because after almost eating a pinenut  that would've killed me I wasn't really that hungry.  The management and busboys were excellent in handling the situation. The waitress was an epic fail. I would go back and try the restaurant again but I would make sure that my waitress truly understands what might kill me in my food.

2eneB_qSxaGYqgwL4pWkrQ.text: While the decor is inviting and the smells coming off the front grill station create an inviting atmosphere, the food and service do not measure up and were disappointing given the hype about Cleo. With only a couple of exceptions (we ordered over 25 items so we cannot be faulted for trying a good portion of the menu) the food was under cooked, served luke warm and devoid of any True flavor - certainly lacking in Mediterranean freshness and taste. Price points were reasonable. Would not return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cleo at SLS: Great decor but disappointing food and service.

Dn-Bj9g2AonUqY_816klrQ.text: A nice new tapas style restaurant at the new SLS to add to the mix of Strip restaurants.  Food was good although not exceptional where any one items is a "must have."  We had an array of items including quinoa salad (great flavor), brussel sprouts, meatball tangine, lamb kefta, and dolmades. Flavors were good and all tasted like they use fresh ingredients.  The dessert probably was the best flavor and consistency - the Fig and Almond Panna Cotta with Amaretto.  They have some nice private tables where you can draw the curtains and service was very attentive.  The highlight of our meal was Patrick, our server.  He knew the drink and food menu inside and out, offering some great suggestions and engaging all of his tables.  Often, you get servers who just mindlessly repeat what they are told and don't have the ability to ad lib or give insightful suggestions.  I would highly suggest that you request him and would definitely ask for him again. The busser, Nick, never let an empty plate sit more than a minute and was there to constantly fill water.  The manager even stopped by to check on us, which is also not something you see except in fine dining.  For service alone, I would make a return trip.  Highlights:   *Great vegetarian options *Prompt service and knowledgeable staff *Good portion sizes *Reservations recommended *Easy to get in and out

Fz0ERDBy_dIjO1Ykbf77kQ.text: If you don't look close enough you might just pass this great tasting place. Overall the food, service and prices are very good. Very polished and great service with affordable prices on the strip is what makes new restaurant on the North End of the strip. Server was very attentive and drink never went empty.   Hits: Cucumber & Yogurt dip with fresh baked flatbread.  Lamb Tagine / Tender chunks of slow braised lamb served over a sweet couscous.  OK... This is without a doubt the best thing on the menu... Brussels Sprouts that have been flashed fried with Garlic. They taste like potato chips. I am not joking these things are very addictive.   Price for the sharable apps run $7-10 Same on sides.  Most expensive Tagine ran $16 for the lamb, most of the tagine hover around the $13 mark. If you go and share with a group you will not leave hungry.

YdIHvmn08qsyon9MLjMFig.text: The food here is amazing! Flavorful and perfect portions! We liked it the first time so much that we came back!  So far our favorites are the Oysters!!!, Octopus, Cauliflower, Brussel Sprout leaves, Chicken Tagine, Lamb Tagine, did I mention the octopus yet? It's so tender and buttery soft! Melt in your mouth! And the oysters, you have to order at least 2-3 orders once you try them! We can't wait to go back!

LV5T457SFEs0mJC6YtAC8A.text: I've been here twice and both times didn't disappoint. The staff is welcoming and knowledgeable.   A glass of Domaine Baron de Rothschild Chardonnay 2012, grilled octopus, lebenah with feta and moussaka is the perfect indulgence.

XFyX2k1Wyu5_yRr7gXRD_Q.text: The service and food were fantastic.  I heard this place was good and the Bazaar was limited to late night menu so we tried this place. We ordered a slew of food and everything was good.  I am not even a big lamb eater and that was good.   The sirloin or steak dish was like a party in my mouth.  We had a semi private room at the front and it was just a good time. The naan they give you is some of the best I've had.  The only thing I wasn't a fan of is the bday desert I had.  It wasn't bad just not great.  I would definitely do this place over again and again.

qvcWDuYPsTeU6r3paFIU2A.text: Great food! I love the small plates motif, you get to try a lot of different foods and have things to share. They had a very crazy unique menu which is a must try. The flatbread pizza with mushrooms was delicious! Also a must try is the cauliflower and cashew curry dish. I never thought cauliflower could taste so good!

JxkueDgjJ5nqHIAKTWjvVA.text: Amazing! The Brussel sprouts, chicken tagine and kabobs were outstanding. Our waiter Manny went above and beyond to make us feel taken care of. And the sous chef Ivan was so hospitable and came to our table to make sure everything was tasting well.

Cd9RxioOBiPXJ2yzQW5azw.text: Yes...Im a fan.  Very good food.  Only gripe I have was the service was slow and I got overbilled me for items and I didn't order.  Since the food was good.  Was okay as I took the leftovers home.

_naaicAe_40Kq7Naj_7SLg.text: I used to think this was a five-star restaurant but now it is a three-star the food is good but they have changed their menu!  They used to have to die for matzoh ball soup! The humus was good and we are the lamb but it's just not the same without the soup!  Big disappointment :(!  I dislike when Vegas restaurants change stuff it's the only reason i go back is for my favs!

cdhCHn-GIUm9IFTeWqiGkw.text: Great place to grab a quick bite of Mediterranean small plates. Very similar to the LA outpost   Food quality was great and our server(s) were on point. They seems to work more as a team here as well as we were checked on repeatedly.

tZAyfiVjts0P1UdzYTyxOg.text: Amazing really the quality of food I'm enjoying here. It is a wonder that this place isn't packed on a Friday night. But that's what hidden gems are all about.

dkgvZHzNxGjrj7DFwaR3Yw.text: This place is incredible. Like seriously the best restaurant ever. The servers are amazing, down to earth, and not pretentious at all which I always worry about at higher end places. The food is divine and the restaurant decor is fun with the spices on the counter and the books on the shelves. There are also fun private rooms with curtains for bigger groups. It's tapas style so its fun to order a few things and share.  When we went they were doing a $29 dollar three item special so we did that for one person and then added a few things on. The prices for the portions and quality was fantastic. Here is what we got and I recommend ALL of it and more:-) We were stuffed so you could probably order a little less for two people.  1. The salt and vinegar Brussel sprouts-These were amazing, they literally tasted like salt and vinegar chips and they were Brussel sprouts which is crazy. There are almonds as well. We got it without the chili pepper. The texture and taste was ridiculous, we have never had anything like it. These ain't your mother's Brussel sprouts.  2. Greek salad-the best one I have ever had. Fresh big chunks of feta with herbs, slices of cucumbers, fresh tomato, great Kalamata olives, and a wonderful dressing. Tasted so fresh and clean, even better than the one I had on the beaches of Greece. I got it without onions. 3. Lamb-The lamb was fantastic. I don't even eat or like lamb, I always think of the baby lambs in the manger scene and can't do it but this was worth it. It came with a wonderful couscous as well that complimented the flavor. 4. Cucumber and dill dip-I LOVE dips like this and this was amazing. It was a greek yogurt base with fresh dill and cucumbers in it with fresh falafel bread served from the wood burning oven. I would order it without the pepper corns next time. 5.  Chicken Skewer-The flavor and texture were wonderful.  6. Fig Panna Cotta-this dessert was fabulous. Light but rich at the same time with wonderful fresh figs and almond clusters.  7. Excellent french press coffee. They also have a green coffee. 8. The Lotus flower cocktail is to die for.   All and All this is the best restaurant I have eaten at in a long time and maybe ever. Run Run Run to Cleo and get your walk like an Egyptian on.

photos.caption: Photo of Cleo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Fig Panna Cotta. Delicious.

Ly7FPUozaae7YmTvIH6FEA.text: WOW! Love this place, I'm still sitting here and I couldn't wait to write a review... Food is awesome, great service (we set in the bar) and fine cocktails! If you love food, you must try this place!

n7hKKtaHPSPdgvrdq4fWAw.text: We had one of the best meals at Cleo last night.  The staff and service were excellent. The lamb chap and all the tapas dishes we tried were tasty, creative and all a little different. I highly suggest people watching in the sls lobby as it's like a red carpet for the sexy youngsters heading out for a big night.  See a much different Vegas crowd here like the palms when it opened.

-5IHY7SQd6sRE7ABxlrQrA.text: Went here for a quick dinner while visiting Vegas last weekend. Saw all the reviews on yelp and figured we had to try it.... WOW.... These reviews are LEGIT.... Everything we had was top notch... Hummus was amazing (wish they gave you 2 pieces of the nahn bread). Everything we had was really good.. Grilled octopus was the best... Service was A+ through the while meal and not just by the server but by everyone there!!! Not much else to say except try it.... You won't be disappointed. Me and my wife will be headed the the Santa Monica location cause it's closer to San Diego ..... Hope they live up to what we had in Vegas!

yFs9iIUZCcNrrMukY9neYQ.text: This place is so great! I had a reservation for 7pm and was seated pretty quickly.   Their tables are very cool, higher than most and beautiful marble. The atmosphere is warm and comfortable.   The drinks were delicious!  Things to try   Hummus and flatbread  Scallops  Lamb skewer   Overrated: Chicken skewer  Spinach and ricotta balls   The Honey citrus sidecar martini is amazing!!! I don't usually like whiskey but this drink was awesome.   Their lotus flower is great too.

rGBaus4xRCsA1UDeku-cCg.text: Everything was delicious! The cocktails were so unique and flavorful. I loved all of the different small plates so you could try a little of everything. The borek was amazing. The octopus was surprisingly tender. The vegetarian dishes were so full of flavor that they weren't even missing meat. I will definitely be going back.
